Ayssi comensan las paraulas de Albucasim .	Here begin the words of Albucasis.
O, filhs, pus yeu he a vos complit aquest libre, le qual es le derier de la sciencia de medicina, per le compliment de lu so consequit la fi en lu, e per las exposicios de lu, e per las declaracios de lu, es a mi vist que yeu complesca aquel a vos am aquest tractat, le qual es partida de la operacio am ma, so es cyrurgia.	Oh children, if I have completed this book for you, which is the last of the science of medicine, because of its completion and explanations and declarations, I believe that I have fulfilled my promise to you to write this treatise, which is part of surgery.
Quar la operacio am ma es prostrada en nostre regio e en nostre temps de tot privada, entro que fort leu peric la sciencia de lu, e le vistigi de lu es ostat; e no romasero de lu sino alcunas petitas descripcios en les libres dels Antics, les quals mudero las mas e endevenc ad aquels error e heyssitacio entro que son clausas las entencios de lu e es elonguada la forsa de lu e l’art.	The operation of caesarean section has been prohibited in our region and time, until recently when the science of it was revealed, and its evidence is established; and there are only a few small descriptions in the books of the Ancients, which have been lost and have led to errors and uncertainty until the understanding of it has been established and its length and art extended.
E es vist a mi que yeu vivifique aquela am ordenacio de aquest tractat en aquela segon la via de exposicio e de declaracio e de abreviacio; e per que vengua am las formas dels ferramentz de cautheri e dels autres instrumentz de la obra cum sia per addicio de la declaracio, e per preparacio de lu, la qual causa es necessaria.	And I believe that I have fulfilled the order of this treatise in the second way of explanation and declaration and abbreviation; and because it comes with the forms of the tools of cauteries and other instruments of the work as it is for addition to the declaration, and for preparation of it, which cause is necessary.
Mays la causa per la qual no es atrobat bo artifex am la sieua ma en aquest nostre temps, es quar la art de medicina es longua, e que cove le sieu actor denant aquo esser excercitat en la sciencia de anotomia la qual recontec Gualia entro que sapia les juvament dels membres e las formas de aquels, e la conjunctio e la separacio de lor; e haia la conoyssensa dels osses, dels nervis e dels lacertz, e·l nombre de aquels, e la egrecio de lor; e de las venas pulsatils e de las quietas, e dels locs del eyssiment de lor.	In ancient times, the reason why a skilled physician did not have to memorize all the parts of the body in detail was because the art of medicine was long and required practice in the science of anatomy, which Guall taught before understanding the significance of the members and their forms, and their conjunction and separation; and knowing the bones, nerves, and cartilages, their number, and their size; and the pulsating veins, quiet vessels, and their locations.
E per aquo ditz Ypocras que am u nom es mot, mays en l’obra petit, e majorment en la art de la ma.	For which reason, as Hippocrates said, it is not necessary to have a name for everything, but in the work, it is more important in the art of medicine.
Mays nos ja avem dit de aquel en l’introit de aquest libre; quar qui no es scient aquo que li avem dit de anotomia, no es evacuat que no caia en error per la qual siran mortz les homes, ayssi cum yeu he vist trops de aquels, quar alscus son formatz en esta sciencia e gettan se de aquela ses sciencia e ses experiment.	But we have already mentioned that person in the introduction of this book; for those who do not know what we have said about anatomy, it is not surprising that they fall into error, as I have often seen many of them, because they are formed in this science and obtain their knowledge from that science and its experiments.
Quar yeu vi un metge folh e enperit aver incidit un apostema escrophilos en le colh de una femna, e incidic alcunas arterias del colh per que fluic gran sanc entro que la femna cazec morta entre las mas de lu.	When a doctor saw a woman who had been bitten by an Echis scorpion on her neck, and it had pierced some arteries of the neck causing great blood flow into the woman that she died among them.
E vi un autre metge que pres que el traguera una peyra d’un home le qual avia procesit en sa etat, e la peyra era gran, e venguet a lu e trayssec aquela peyra am un tros de la vesiqua, per que aquel home al tertz dia es mort.	And another doctor saw that a man had been struck by a stone from another man's work, and the stone was large, and it came to him and passed through a third of his abdomen, so that that man died on the third day.
E yeu ja apelat fuy a estrayre aquela, e vi que per la grandesa de la peyra e per la disposicio del malaute conogui subre lu que morira.	And he had already called for help to extract that, and saw that due to the size of the stone and the position of the patient, he knew under him where he would die.
E vi un autre metge le qual prenia stipendic de un duc de nostra terra per cyrurgia, e endeven a un crastrat negre le qual era deves lu fractura en la coyssa de lu; e perparec le metge am la sua ignorancia, estrayssec la fractura, sobre la plagua, am pulvinas e astelas am forta strectura, e no layssec a la plagua espiracio.	And another doctor took the wages of a duke from our land for surgery, and went to a skilled blacksmith who was near the fracture in his thigh; and because of the doctor's ignorance, he extracted the fracture, on the plate, with pulleys and levers of strong structure, and did not allow the plate air.
E aprop le desliet segons los sieus desiriers, e aprop le relieg, e aprop le leyssec per alcus jorns e comandec que nos deslies le liament; e estec ayssi entro que la coyssa e·l pe foro apostematz, e pervenguet a perdicio.	And then remove the dressing according to his wishes, and remove the bandage, and remove the compress for several days and order that it be removed; and this should be done while the wound and the foot are healing, and reach a state of improvement.
E yeu fuy apelat a lu, e aparelhegui a desliar le liament, e conseguida es tranquilitat e enayssi amermet de sas dolors.	And then you should apply it to him, and prepare to remove the bandage, and achieve peace and relieve his pain.
Mays empero ja corrupcio era confermada en le membre, per que no pogui refrenar aquela, e no cessec perambular la corrupcio en le membre entro que·l malaute peric.	However, if corruption was already confirmed in the member, so that it could not be restrained from that one, and did not cease to spread the corruption in the member until the patient died.
E vi un autre metge le qual perforec un apostema cancros, e fo ulcerat aprop alscus dias, entro que foc magnificada la malicia de lu am lo senhor de lu.	And another doctor performed an incision on a pus-filled tumor, and it became ulcerated in a few days, until the great heat of the disease destroyed the patient.
La qual causa es quar le cranc caut es pur de humor melencolic, lahoras no cove que pervengua a lu am ferr de tot, sino que sia an membre le qual suffertes que de tot fos hostat.	The cause of which is that the cranium is purged of melancholic humor, so that it does not reach the patient with iron from all over, but rather that it be in the member that suffers from all of it.
E per aquo, filhs, necessari es a vos que la operacio am ma sia devisada en dos devesios: so es en operacio a lu qual es associada salut, e en obra am la qual es perilh en las majors disposicios.	For that reason, my friends, it is necessary for you to divide the operation into two parts: one in which health is associated, and another in which it is performed in the best possible conditions.
E yeu ja he exsitat aquo en tot loc de aquest libre en le qual venc opperacio en la qual es error e temor; per que necessari es a vos que guardetz aquo e layssetz aquel, per que les folhs no atrobo via a parlar e a vos desonestar.	I have already existed in all places of this book where the operation is performed, and error and fear occur; therefore, it is necessary for you to guard against that and lay aside the one who causes these things, so that the people do not attribute them to you and dishonor you.
E donc prenetz las vostras armas am sollicitut e am proteccio de Dieu , e les vostres malautes am falicitat e am fermetat.	And therefore take up your weapons with solicitude and protection from God, and your patients with success and firmness.
E usatz de la milhor via per la gracia de Dieu perdusent a salut e a lausabla successio, e laysatz las malautias terriblas de difficil sanacio, e ostatz las vostras armas de aquo que vos fa temer, per so que ysitatio en vostra fe e en le vostre nom no vos evasisca: quar mays es remanent a la vostra gloria, e pus aut en le mon e en derier a las vostras sanctitatz.	And use the best way for the grace of God to lead to health and praiseworthy success, and lay aside the terrible illnesses of difficult healing, and keep your weapons from that which makes you fear, so that your position in your faith and in your name will not escape you: because more remains for your glory, and more later in the world and after your sanctity.
Gualia ja diyssec en alcunas sieuas monicios:	In some cases, it is necessary to perform dissection in certain areas:
“No mediquetz malautia mala, per so que mals metges no siatz nompnatz”.	Do not treat a bad patient badly, so that bad doctors will not remember you.
E yeu ja he devesit aquest libre segontz tres capitols.	And I have already dedicated this book to three chapters.
Comensa la divisio del libre, e primier de la primieyra partida.	The beginning of the division of the book, and the first part of the first section.
Le primier capitol ordenat del cap entro·s pes, en las formas dels instrumentz e en les ferrementz dels cauteris, e de aquo que necessari es en la opperacio.	The first chapter ordered by the foot, in the forms of instruments and in the handles of cautery, and of that which is necessary in the operation.
La divisio de la segonda partida.	The division of the second section.
Le segon capitol, de siccio e perforacio, e de ventosas, e de plaguas, e de extractio de sagetas e de semblantz ad aquelas, tot capitolat e ordenat de las formas dels instrumentz.	The second chapter, on drying and puncturing, and on vents, and on plasters, and on the extraction of stones and similar things to those, all chapter and ordered by the forms of instruments.
Divisio de la tersa partida.	Division of the third section.
Le tertz capitol, de restauracio e de dislocacio, e de curacio de torcio e de semblantz ad aquels; capitol ordenat del cap entro·s pes, e de las formas dels instrumentz.	The third chapter, on restoration and dislocation, and on the cure of torticollis and similar things to those; chapter ordered by the foot, and by the forms of instruments.
De cauteri am foc e am medicina aguda e rememoracio de la opperacio.	Of a pointed cautery and of sharp medicine and the remembrance of the operation.
Am aquel comensa le tractat de tot le libre.	In that place begins the treatise on all the free.
Cove que yeu digua la qualitat dels juvamentz de aquel cauteri e dels noccumentz de lu, e en qual compleccio sia prohibit cauteri.	That you should know the quality of those handles of that cautery and of its tips, and in what manner it is forbidden to use it.
Donc dic que·l sermo de la qualitat del juvament de cauteri e del noccument de lu es sermo lonc e prolixs, e subtil per sciensa, e secret amaguat; e ja de lu a parlat gran multitut de savis, e de lu se son desacordatz, et a mi abasta un petit dels sermons de lor, temen perlonguacio.	Therefore I say that the speech about the quality of the handle of the cautery and its tip is a long and prolix, and subtle for the wise, and secretly hidden; and from there one has spoken much about secrets, and they have disagreed, and to me it seems a little like their speeches, I fear a long discussion.
E donc dic que cauteri comfereys a tota compleccio universalment la qual es am materia o ses materia, exceptat dos compleccios, las quals son compleccios caudas ses materia .	And therefore I say that the cautery corresponds to all the universal composition, which is matter or its matter, except for two compositions, which are compositions of the tail and its matter.
En la compleccio cauda e secca am materia se desecordero; quar alcus dyssero que cauteri es juvatiu ad aquela, e les autres dyssero le contrari de aquel, que cauteri no es convenient en malautia la qual es per qualiditat e per siccitat, quar natura del foc es qualiditat e siccitat, e enconvenient es que malautia cauda e secca am aquo que es caut e sec sia sanada.	In the composition of the tail and dry matter, they disagree; because some said that the cautery is useful for that, and the others said the opposite of that, which is not convenient in disease that is by quality and dryness, because the nature of fire is quality and dryness, and it is not convenient that the disease tail and dry matter has that is burned and dried is healthy.
E diysec aquel que ditz le contrari de aquel, que per cauteri es fayt juvament en tota malautia cauda e secca que ve en les cors dels homes, quar quan tu comparas le cors de home e las humiditatz de lu a la compleccio del foc, atrobas le cors de home freg.	And tell that one who says the opposite of that, which is said to be very helpful in all cases where the tail and dry sweat are seen in the bodies of men, because when you compare the bodies of men with the moisture of them to the appearance of fire, it is easy to see the bodies of men.
E yeu dic per le sermo de aquel, que esperiment aquo ja a mi alscunas vetz a descubert.	And I say by the words of that one, which has experimented this thing to me sometimes in the past.
Mays empero no cove que vengua sobre aquo aquel que ja es exproat e excersitat en le capitol de cauteri per derier exercici, e a conogut la diversitat de la compleccio dels homes e la disposicio de las malautias en lor meteyssas, e las causas de aquelas, e·ls accidentz de lor, e l’espasi del temps de aquelas.	But perhaps not everyone can come over to that which has been extracted and exercised in the capital of cauteries by previous practice, and who has known the diversity of the appearance of men and the disposition of their diseases, and the causes of those, and their accidents, and the time of those.
Mays en las autras compleccios, no es sobre vos temor, e majorment en las malautias fregas e humidas, quar ja totz les metges se son acordatz sobre aquels, e no so desecordatz en le juvament am cauteri en aquelas.	But in other appearances, do not be afraid of you, and especially in diseases that are moist and humid, because all doctors have agreed on those, and they do not disagree in the helpfulness of cauteries in those.
E sapiatz, filhs, que del secret de curacio per cauteri am foc e de la bontat de lu, so sobre cauteri am medicina comburent, es quar le foc es simple, la accio del qual no perven sino al membre le qual es cauterizat e no notz al autre membre am lu ajustat sino am petit nocument.	And know, children, that the secret of healing by cauterizing with fire and its goodness is that it is simple, because the action of which only reaches the member that is cauterized and not the other member that is adjusted to it, only does a small harm.
Mays la accio de medicina comburent perven ad aquel en les membres le qual de lu alunhat, e fort leu fa venir en le membre malautia de dificil sanacio e fort leu ausit.	May the action of medicine come to that in the members which is of the same kind, and it often brings pain to the affected member, and it often causes difficulty in healing.
Mays le foc, per la sua sublimitat e de la sua substancia bontat, no fa aquo sino que superfluisca E ja es a nos conogut per experiment e per longitut de servitut de studi am l’art sobre le veritat de las causas; e per aquo yeu so excusat de la longitut del sermo E si no fos que no es legut al mieu libre en aquest pausero a vos secret amaguat am le foc, e la qualitat de la operacio de lu en les cors e de la sieua expulcio per la qual expellis las malautias, am sermo philosophic demostratiu, le qual siria acuit en las vostras pessas.	May the fire, by its greatness and goodness of substance, not do that, but rather be superfluous. And we know this from experience and long study of the art over the truth of the causes; and for this you may be excused from the length of the sermon. And if not, it is not read to me in this pause, and the quality of the operation of which in the bodies and its expulsion by which it expels evils, that is philosophical demonstration, which would be sharpened in your pains.
E sapiatz, filhs, que els se desacordan del temps en le qual es convenient far cauteri e pausan le milhor temps de primaveyra.	And know, children, that they disagree about the time when it is appropriate to make cauteries and pause at the best time of primevera.
E yeu dic que cauteri es convenient en tot temps, per so que le nocument per le temps accident es submergit en le juvament de aquo que am le cauteri es atirat, e majorment si le cauteri es per dolors o de dolors necessaries, fortz e fistinas, las quals no suffertan tarditat per so que es temut de aquelas que vengua malicia, que es major que petit nocument entrant per lo temps.	And you say that cauteries are appropriate at all times, because the harm from the time accident is submerged in the advantage of which is thrown, and more so if the cauteries are for pain or necessary pain, quickly and fiercely, which do not suffer delay because they fear those that come maliciously, which is greater than small harm coming from the time.
E aysso no catz en vostras pessas, o, filhs, aquo no estiman sino le poble vulguar e les fols metges, so es que ad aquela malautia que es sanada per cauteri no es redicio tot temps, e pausan aquel consequen.	And do not catheterize in your feet, oh sons, that is only understood by the common people and foolish doctors, because that disease which is cured by cauterization is not always effective, and they stop that consequence.
E la causa no es ges ayssi quo els cuydan per aquo, quar cauteri no es sino en loc de medicina la qual altera la compleccio e esicca las humiditatz las quals son causa per que veno las dolors.	And the cause is not always present that they fear for that, because cauterization is only in a place of medicine which alters the appearance and dries out the moisture which is the cause of the pain.
Mays empero cauteri superflueys sobre la medicina per volicitat de la sua valitut e vertut de la sua operacio e grandesa del sieu senhor.	But nevertheless, cauterization is used excessively over medicine for the sake of its value and virtue of its operation and greatness of its lord.
E es possible que la sua malautia retorne en alcuna hora del temps, segon la compleccio del malaute e la locacio de la sua malautia, e la vertut de lu, e aquo que es preparat en le cors de lu de la agreguacio de las superfluitatz en lu, e aquo que es pervengut a lu en la sua acquisicio en viandas e semblantz de aquelas causas; sino que la malautia en la qual sia aministrat cauteri sia malautia subtil en membre de paucas superfluitatz e humiditatz, ayssi cum cauteri de dent per dolor e semblantz ad aquel, possible es que en lu no retorne aquela dolor, mays aquo se fa en petitz.	And it is possible that his disease will return in some time of the day, according to the appearance of the patient and the location of his disease, and its virtue, and that which is prepared in the body of him from the aggregation of the excess in him, and that which is obtained to him in his acquisition in foods and similar causes; but the disease in which cauterization is administered is a subtle disease in a member of few excesses and moisture, such as a tooth cautery for pain and similar to that, it is possible that in him it will not return that pain, but that which is done in small amounts.
E mays sermo vulgar es que cauteri es le derier remezi de medicina, e es sermo dreyturier, no ad aquo que els entendo en lu, quar els crezo que no es curacio que aprofieyta am medicina ni am autra causa aprop cauteri.	And more commonly, the pointed cautery is the most effective method of medical treatment, and it is called correct treatment, not because I understand what they mean by that, but because they believe that there is no other cure that can be obtained through medicine or any other cause that would require a pointed cautery.
E la causa es en contrari de aquo; e la entencio que cauteri es le derier remezi de medicina no es sino quan administram las manieyras de curacio en alcunas malautias, e aquelas medicinas no conferieysso, e aprop en la fi de la causa aministra hom cauteri, e aprofieyta ad aquela.	And the cause is contrary to that; and they understand that the pointed cautery is not always the most effective method of medical treatment, but only when administering methods of treatment in certain diseases, and those medicines do not work, and at the end of the cause, they administer a pointed cautery, and it is effective for that.
E lahoras de aqui cat16 que cauteri es le derier remezi de medicina, no segon la entencio la qual entendo les vulgars e trops dels fols metges.	And from here, they understand that the pointed cautery is not always the most effective method of medical treatment, but they do not understand what I understand as common sense and too many of the foolish doctors.
E diyssero les antics que cauteri am aur es milhor que cauteri am ferr, e no diyssero aquo sino per la equalitat del aur e sublimitat de la sua sustancia.	And the ancients said that gold is better than iron for cauterization, and they did not say that except for the equality of gold and the superiority of its substance.
E diyssero que le loc de cauteri no fa brac, cum aquo no sia absolutament vertat, quar yeu ja he aquo proat e he atrobat que aquel no fa aquo sino en alcus cors ses les autres, e cauteri am aquel es bo e milhor que am ferr ayssi quo els diyssero; mays empero quan tu fas cauteri am foc am de aur, no es a tu declarat, quar es egnit segon la quantitat que tu vols per la rugor de l’aur, e quar prepara a recebre freg; e si ajustas sobre lu ignicio se fon l’aur per le foc, e caso en le foc alcunas laminas per que le artifex catz per la occupacio de aquel.	And they said that the place for cauterization does not matter, since it is not absolutely true, because I have already seen that there are those who say that it only works in certain people, and cauterization with gold is good and better than iron if you do it as they say; but however, when you make cauterization with fire made of gold, it is not up to you, since it is done according to the amount of gold you want for the hardness of the gold, and because it prepares to receive the heat; and if you adjust it over the fire, the gold melts in the fire, and some sheets are placed in the fire for the craftsman to use for that purpose.
E per aquo es fayt cauteri am ferr deves nos pus leugerament e pus propdanament a rectitut de operacio.	And for that, a pointed cautery is made with a lighter and more conveniently placed in the direction of the operation.
E yeu ja he ordenat aquest capitol en le cauteri segon capitols, et he ordenat aquels del cap entro les pes, per so que aleugo le demandant aquo que vol de lu.	And I have already ordered this chapter on the second chapter of the cautery, and have ordered those between the feet, so that the patient can ask what he wants from it.
De cauteri de dolor de cap per frigiditat e humiditat.	Of cautery for pain in the head due to cold and moisture.
Le capitol primier.	The first chapter.
Aquesta cauterizacio confereys a la humiditat e frigiditat sobre le servel accident de la qual so doas causas, so es causa de soda e multitut de flux raumatic, apelat corissa, del cap a las partidas dels huelhs e de las aurelhas fluent, e multitut de dormir, e de dolor de dentz e del guolayro, e universalment de tota malautia que ve per fregiditat, ayssi cum paraliticament, sodo e apoplexio, e semblantz en aquelas malautias.	This cauterization applies to the moisture and cold that cause this accident, which is the cause of many traumatic fluxes, called crisis, from the head to the parts of the hips and the arms, and many sleeplessness, and tooth pain and jaw pain, and generally all illnesses that occur due to cold, such as paralysis, drowsiness, and apoplexy, and similarities in those diseases.
La forma de aquesta cauterizacio es aquesta, que primieyrament comandes al malaute que sia evacuat am medicina lacsativa le cap mondificant, per tres o per quatre nueytz, segon que exhigeys la vertut del malaute e la edat de lu e la sua costuma.	The form of this cauterization is as follows: first commands the patient to take a laxative medicine to empty his head, for three or four nights, according to the patient's strength and age and custom.
E aprop comanda li que raza le sieu cap am razor, e aprop fay aquel sezer entre las tuas mas sobre una banca cayrada e que pause las suas mas sobre le pietz sieu.	And then command the one who is shaving his head to do so with a razor, and place that shaved hair between your hands on a chair and place your hands over his chest.
E aprop pausa la razit de la tua palma aprop le pous sobre la razit del nas entre les huels sieus.	And then place the razor of your palm against the nose between his eyes.
Mays empero, cum le tieu dit del mieg loc es pervengut, signa aquel loc am tenta, e aprop igneys le cauteri olivar del qual aquesta es la forma:	But remember, when you reach the location that you have indicated, mark that spot and then use the pointed cautery of olive oil, which is in this form:
E aprop pausa aquel sobre le loc senhat am tenta, a manieyra que descent, am la qual la tieua ma sia constrengida petit a petit, e tu revolveys aquel.	And then place that on the location that you have marked, with a movement that goes down, and make sure that it is not too tightly held at once, and you rotate that.
E aprop leva la tua ma leugerament e reguarda le loc, e si veses ja del os esser descubert alcuna quantitat del cap, ayssi cum la quantitat de gra de errs, lahoras eleva la tua ma, e si no torno la tua ma am aquel ferr, am autre de aquel, si es enfrigidat, entro que sia vist del os aquo que yeu he dit a tu.	And then slightly raise your hand and look at the location, and if you see that some of the bone has been exposed, as much as the amount of grain, then raise your hand, and if it does not return, place your hand on that iron, or another of those, if it is cold, before it is seen from the bone what I have told you.
E aprop pren un petit de sal e disolveys aquel sobre le loc e leyssa aquel per tres jorns.	And then take a small amount of salt and dissolve that on the location and leave that for three days.
E aprop pausa sobre lu coto enbegut en boder e leyssa aquel sobre lu entro que sia destrusida la scara del foc.	And then place your hand on the side that is facing away from the fire and let that one be destroyed by the flame of the fire.
E aprop cura le loc am anguent tetrafarmacon entro que sia sanat.	And then apply the four-herb ointment to the area until it is healed.
E ja diyssero que quant la plagua roman uberta, tant mielhs geta le brac, per que es milhor e mays juvatiu.	And they say that as soon as the plague is removed, the more the arm is bent, the better and more beneficial it is.
E diyssero alcus de lor que sia cauterizada la codena entro al os, e sia tengut le cauteri entro que sia adhurida alcuna partida de la specitut del os.	They say that one should cauterize the tendon at the bone, and hold the cautery until some part of the bone is attached to it.
E aprop sia ras aquo que es adhust del os, e aprop sia curat.	And then remove that which has been attached to the bone, and then apply the ointment.
E diyssero autres que am lo cauteri pervengua al derier, entro que enprema en le os forta enprecio entro que le os caga, e aquesta es la forma de alphecati petit:	They say that one should apply the cautery to the back, until it reaches the bone strongly enough to break the bone, and this is the way to make a small incision:
E estiman de aquel loc expiran la vapors del cap.	And they estimate that from that area, the vapors of the head escape.
E sia tenguda la plagua uberta per lonc temps, e aprop sia curada entro que sia consolidada.	And one should keep the wound open for a long time, and then apply the ointment until it is consolidated.
Mays a mi no so vistas aquestas doas specias de cauteri de tot, sino en alcus homes segon via de temor; e layssa aquel, deves mi, milhor es am salut, quan es; quar le cap es develitat per solucio de continuitat de lu ayssi cum havem testificat en les autres membres, e majorment quan le cap del malaute es de freul natura.	I have not seen these two types of cauteries in all men, except in those who are second in line for fear; and let that one, if possible, be better for their health when it is; because the head is revealed by the solution of continuity of which we have testified in other members, and more so when the head of the patient is naturally free.
E la specia de cauteri primieyra es mays salva e milhor deves mi; e de aquela husi e am aquela obra am salut.	The first type of cautery is safer and better for me; and from that one, I advise you to do the work for their health.
Capitol segon.	Second chapter.
Del cauteri del cap.	Of the cautery of the head.
Quan en tot le cap accideys dolor cronica e longua e aquo es en le malaute prolonguat, e usa de gerras e de cochias e de capipurges e de emplaustres e de guatz e de cadels e de gualinas e de semblantz, e majorment si ja es cauterizat am un cautere le qual recontam e no aprofieyta a lu deguna de aquelas causas, lahoras considera quar si le cap del malaute es de fort creacio en la sua natura; e no es freul et atroba mot gran freg, lahoras aquel cauterisa am autra cauteri dejos aquel un pauc.	When in the head there is chronic and long pain, and that is prolonged in the patient, and it uses gargles, and beaks, and capipurges, and ointments, and drugs, and candles, and wax, and similar things, and especially if it has already been cauterized with a cauterizer that they have and do not know how to apply to it again from among those causes, then consider that if the head of the patient is of strong creation in its nature; and it is not free and often there is a great deal of bleeding, then that cauterizer uses another cauterizer.
E aprop cauterisa aquel sobre le corn del sieu cap am cauteri entro que la codena es partida.	And then cauterize that above the horn of his head with a pointed cautery where the bone is broken.
Incisa la codena e sia descuberta del os la quantitat la qual havem recontat e cauteriza aquel am un cauteri en la partida deriera del cap en le loc le qual es apelat vas, — e es aquel loc en le qual es pausada ventosa.	Cut the bone and expose it from the skull in the amount that we have found and cauterize that with a pointed cautery on the back of his head in the place where the intestine is placed, — and that is the place where the cushion is placed.
Et alleuja la tua ma en aysso, e no descobras le os, quar le malaute per aquo atroba mot gran dolor diversa de la dolor de totz les autres cauteris del cap.	And place your hand in the wound, and do not expose the bone, because the patient will suffer great pain different from all other cauterizations of the head.
E yeu diyre aquest cauteri en son loc, quar cove que·l cauteri am le qual so cauterisatz les corns del cap e le occiput es pus subtil cauteri que aquel am le qual es cauterisat le mieg loc del cap; e aquesta es la forma de lu.	And I say that this cautery is in this place, because it covers the point where the pointed cautery is applied to the horns of the head and the occiput is a more subtle cauterization than that which is cauterized in the middle of the head; and this is the form of it.
Capitol ters.	Chapter three.
De cauterisacio de emigranea no-antiqua.	Of the ancient non-antiphlogistic cauterization.
Quan endeve en la partida del cap dolor sodo, o es stenduda dolor entro al uelh, sia evacuat am medicinas le cap mondificantz, e sia aministrada l’autra curacio, la qual yeu he dita en las devesios de las malautias; e tot no aprofieyta, lahoras cauterisacio en lu es en dos manieyras: o cauterisacio am medicina acuta comburent, o am ferr.	When the pain in the part of the head is very severe, or it extends to the back, then remove the medicines that make the head better, and administer the other cure, which I have said in the chapters on illnesses; and all this is not helpful, then cauterization in that place is done in two ways: either with a sharp-burning cautery, or with iron.
Mays cauteri am medicina comburent es que tu prenguas una dolsa de alh, e escorgas aquela e abcindas las extremitatz de lu de amdos les caps.	May the pointed cautery be used as a medical instrument to hold an ointment jar, and apply it to that area and cover its extremities with bandages.
E aprop incideys le loc de la dolor en la templa am una lanceta lada entro que sia en lu feyt loc dejos la codena, entro que sia occultada.	And then incise the area of pain in the temple with a sharp knife that is inserted into the correct location behind it, and hidden.
E aprop strenh sobre lu am stopada per descent constreccio, e layssa aquel per le spazi de tres horas; e aprop deslia le e tratz le alh, e laysa la plagua per dos o per tres jorn, e aprop pausa sobre lu coto submergit en boder entro que le loc fassa brac.	And then apply pressure over the stopped area due to downward constriction, and leave it for three hours; and then remove the jar, and leave the plague for two or three days, and then place a bandage over the location where the wound is healing.
E aprop cura aquel am enguent entro que sia sanat.	And then cure that which has been inserted until it is healed.
E si tu voys, fe aquo am alcunas medicinas comburentz las quals yeu he scriutas en le douse tractat de medicinas comburentz.	And if you wish, do that with some medical instruments which I have written about in the previous treatise on medical instruments.
Mays la cauterisacio am ferr segon aquesta manieyra: igneys per cauteri del qual aquesta es la forma:	May the cautery be made in this manner: ignite it with this form:
e es apelat claus clavilhs, quar le cap de lu es ayssi cum forma de clavel en le qual es alcuna curvitat, e·n le mieg loc de lu es eminensia petita.	and it is called a clover cautery, because its head has the form of a clover flower in which there is some curvature, and in the middle of it is a small point.
E aprop pausa sobre loc de la dolor, e rete la tua ma — per que no sia adhurida la arceria la qual es dejos — e revol le ferr petit a petit am velocitat.	And then place your hand on the location of the pain, and pull your hand back - so that the skin is not torn - and slowly move the small iron at speed.
E si la quantitat de lu que es adhurida per la specitut de la codena ayssi quo la maytat de lu, e elava la tua ma per so que la arteria no sia adhurida la qual es dejos, per so que no vengua flux de sanc.	And if the amount of blood that is stuck due to the thickness of the needle is such that it covers the entire area, then lift your hand to prevent the artery from being torn, so that there is no bleeding.
E aprop enbibeys coto en aygua de sal e pausa aquel sobre le loc, e layssa aquel per tres dias; e aprop pausa coto mulhat am boder, e aprop cura am enguent entro que sia sanat.	And then apply a salted cloth to that location and place it there for three days; and then apply a heated, moist cloth and cure it until it is healed.
E si voys, cauterisa am la extremitat del cutellari segon cauteri, e guarda te de incisio de arteria en aquesta emigranea propriament no-antiqua.	And if you see, cauterize the tip of the lancet according to the cautery, and avoid injury to the artery in this procedure.
Capitol quart.	Chapter fourth.
De cauterizacio d’emigranea antiqua.	Of the cauterization of an ancient puncture.
Quan tu curas emigranea am aquo que havem dit de la curacio precedent, e aquo que havem dit en las divisios de las malautias, e no aprofieyta la curacio, e vezes per la malautia que no abasta a lu aquo que havem dit del primier cauteri am medicina o del cauteri am foc, lahoras cove que tu igniscas le cauteri cutellar entro que sia albificat, pus que significas sobre le loc de la dolor am linha de longuesa de la qual sia la maytat del dit, o quays aquel; e depausa la tua ma per una veguada e strenh aquela entro incidiscas la arceria e pervengua entro al os.	When you cure an ancient puncture with the remedy we have mentioned in the previous healing, and with the remedy we have mentioned in the divisions of diseases, and if you do not apply the healing, and see that the disease does not respond to the first cauterization with medicine or the cauterization with fire, then wait until the cauterization is white, because it means above the location of the pain a line of length equal to the thickness of the other; and place your hand firmly on that area and insert the needle until you reach the bone.
Empero necessari es a tu que guardes de la continuacio de la mandibula, la qual es mauguda deves la masticacio, e que le lacert no sia adhurit e le nervi le qual mau aquela, e que no s’endevengua espasme.	However, it is necessary for you to guard against the continuity of the mandible, which is often bruised from chewing, and that the jaw not be adhered and the nerve that causes pain in that area, and that it does not become spasmed.
E si es sobre la custodia e cautela de flux de sanc de l’arteria que es abciza, quar en la abcizio de lu es temor, e majorment ad aquel le qual ignora aquo que fa e no es studios e esproat; e layssa la operacio en lu al comensament.	And if it is about the custody and care of the flow of sanctum from the artery that is embolized, in which there is fear and more so for those who do not know what to do and are not studious or experienced; and leave the operation in the beginning.
E yeu vindre am rememoracio del regiment de flux de sanc accident de la arceria segon la sieua manieyra, en le sieu loc de aquest libre.	And you will find the remembrance of the regimen for the flow of sanctum from the artery according to the same manner, in its own location in this book.
E si veses de aquesta malautia que no abaste aquest cauteri e veses le cors del malaute tollerable, cauteriza aquel en le mieg loc del cap ayssi cum havem recontat, e cura la plagua entro que sia sanada.	And if you see this patient who does not benefit from this cautery and you see the body of the patient bearable, cauterize that in the middle location of the head as we have reported, and cure the wound before it is healed.
E si voys, aministra le cauteri le qual havem dit en le capitol de streccio de arceria am cauteri havent dos cotels, e es milhor cauterizacio aquesta e mays conferent.	And if you administer the cautery that we have mentioned in the chapter of strangulation of the artery with two points, and this is the best cauterization and more conforming.
Capitol .v.	Chapter Five
De cauterisacio de las dolors de aurelhas.	About the cauterization of gout pain.
Quan en la aurelha ve dolor per freg e es curat am causas lacsativas e am l’autra curacio la qual he dita en la divisio, e no es remauguda la dolor, lahoras igneys le cauteri, e es aquest le qual ha nom puncta, del qual aquesta es la forma:	When there is pain in the big toe caused by cold humors and it is treated with the previous method, and the pain does not subside, then apply the cautery, and this is the one that has no point, of which this is the form:
E aprop puncta aprop la ignicio, e sia menat al enviro de tota la aurelha ayssi cum roda es revolguda, o en le circuit de quascuna essemps si la dolor es en quascuna.	Then apply the pointed cautery close to the fire, and bring it around the entire big toe as if it were a wheel, or in the circle of each one if the pain is in each one.
Alonga te am le cauteri de la razit de la aurelha pauc a pauc pus que aias senhat le loc am tenta.	Along the edge of the big toe, gradually push the cautery a little at a time until you feel that the area is hot enough.
E si le cauteri de detz puntz en tota aurelha, e quays aquela, e aprop cura les locz entro que sian sanatz.	And if the pointed cautery touches the entire big toe, and it feels like that, and then cure the areas before they are healed.
Capitol .vi.	Chapter Six
De cauterizacio de turtura.	About the cauterization of torture.
Turtura la qual es curada e am cauterizacio no es sino de las specias las quals veno per flecma, segon que havem dit en las divisios de las malautias.	Torture that is cured and is not treated with cauterization except for the specific ones that come from flexion, as we have said in the divisions of diseases.
Esquiva cauterizacio de la specia que endeve per siccacio o per spasme del nervi.	Avoid cauterization of the affected area due to dryness or spasms of the nerves.
Quan tu curas aquela specia de turtura am jerras e capipurgi e guarguarismes, e no comfereys la tua curacio, lahoras cove que tu cauterizas le malaute am tres cauteris: la i deves la razit de la aurelha, e·l segon un petit dejos le sieu templar, e le ters deves la conjunccio de doas labias.	When you treat that area of torture with jerks and capillary and gastrointestinal remedies, and do not compare your treatment, then it is recommended to cauterize the patient with three cauteries: the first from the golden needle, the second a little below the temple, and the third at the conjunction of two lips.
E pausa lo tieu cauteri per le contrari de la partida malauta, quar mollificacio no ve sino en la partida que apar sana.	And place your cauterizing instrument in the opposite part of the affected area, as softening only occurs in the healthy part.
E la forma de cauterisacio es que cauterizas aquel am le cauteri en le dreyt de la extremitat de la aurelha pus sobirana un petit sobre le corn del cap, e en le templar autre, la longuesa del qual sia segon la longitut del dit pous, e depausa la tua ma am cauteri entro que sia comburida la quantitat de la maytat de la specitut de la codena.	The form of cauterization is that you cauterize that part with the cauterizing instrument at the right side of the golden needle, a little above the crown of the head, and in the temple, the longest one should be twice as long as the previous one, and place your hand over the cauterizing instrument until the required amount of the affected area is burned.
E aquesta es la forma del cauteri, e es specia del cutellari, la forma del qual es denant mesa.	And this is the form of the cauterizing instrument, and it is called a lancet, which has a specific shape.
Mays empero pus subtil es que aquel un pauc ayssi co vesas; e cove que cotel en lu de superflua groceza un pauc.	May it however be more subtle to have one less than usual; and cover the area with a cloth to prevent excessive greasiness.
E aprop cura le loc am aquo que es denant procezit entro que sia sanat.	And then cure the area with that which is given for the process until it is healed.
Capitol .vii.	Chapter VII.
De cauterizacio de apoplextia antiqua.	Of the cauterization of ancient apoplexy.
Quan apoplextia es antiquada e curas aquela am aquo que havem dit e no confereys la tua medicacio e le malaute no ha febre, lahoras cauteriza aquel am quatre cauteris: sobre totz les corn del sieu cap; e am cauteri e le mieg loc del cap, ayssi cum havem dit; e am cauteri en le coguot.	When apoplexy is ancient and is treated with that which we have said, and does not compare your medication and the patient does not have fever, then cauterize that area with four cautery: over all the corners of his head; and with a cautery and the middle part of the head, as we have said; and with a cautery in the back.
E la manieyra del cauteri es fayta segon que es desus dit.	And the method of the cautery is made according to what is mentioned above.
E ja es cauterizat sobre la boca del estomac; e es mays derier; e aprop sia curat am aquo que procezeys.	And it has been cauterized over the mouth of the stomach; and it is more behind; and then cure with that which processes.
Capitol .viii.	Chapter VIII.
De cauterizacio de obblivio fayta per flacma.	Of the cauterization of forgetfulness caused by a stroke.
Cove que sian donatz al malaute en le comensament jerras grans e pilulas le servel mondificantz.	Given great amounts of grains and large pills to the patient at the beginning.
E aprop ras le cap tot del malaute e pausa sus le coguot de lu emplaustre de cetre descrit en le tractat dels emplastres.	Then remove the cap from the patient's head and place your hand on their chest, placing the described ointment from this treatise on it.
E pausa aquel alcunas veguadas, quar aquel es manieyra de cauteri.	Then wait for some time, as that is the way of using the cautery.
E fay aquo segon aquel meteys orde le qual ja he dit.	Do that again according to the method that has already been mentioned.
E donc si per aqueles sanat bo es; e sino, lahoras fay a lu tres cauteris en la deriera partida de sieu cap, les quals sian deysendentz de la partida pus sobirana del cap entro a la partida pus dejos del col.	And if those methods are successful; and if not, then make three points on the back part of their head, which should be placed between the most elevated part of the head and the nape of the neck.
E pausa entre quascun cauteri la grossetut del dit, e aprop cura lo cauteri am aquo que es procedit.	Wait for the longest time between each point, and then carefully cure the burned area.
Mays si tu vos addicio e le malaute es aquo tollerant, lahoras fay a lu cauteri en le mieg loc; e si voys major addicio, lahora cauteriza aquel sobre les dos corns.	But if you are more skilled and the patient can tolerate it, then make the point in the middle; and if you are less skilled, then make the point on both heels.
Aprop cura aquel entro que sia sanat; e sia le cauteri olivar segon la forma denant donat.	Then cure it before it is healed; and if the point is made with oil, do so according to the form given.
Capitol .ix.	Chapter 9.
De cauterisacio de parazili e de mollificacio de tot le cors.	On cauterization of the perineum and softening of the whole body.
Cove que tu procesiscas en mondificacio del cap am jerras e am aquo que havem dit; e aprop ras le cap del malaute, e aprop cauteriza aquel am cauteri en le mieg loc del cap, e am cauteri sobre totz les corns del cap, e am cauteri sobre la deriera partida de lu, e am tres cauteris sobre les spondils del col.	You proceed as described in the softening of the head and that which we have said; and then shave the patient's head, and then apply the cautery at the middle point of the head, and apply the cautery to all the bones of the head, and apply it to the back part of it, and three cautery points on the spines of the neck.
E si es necessari en la malautia de mollificacio del cors de trops aquel e les malautes tollerantz e la malautia es fort, lahoras cauteriza aquel am quatre cauteris sobre les spondils del dos, e dererament am cauteri entro que sia comborit de la codena mot de lu, e aleva la tieua ma.	And if it is necessary in the case of softening of the body for three cautery points and the patient can bear them, and the condition is strong, then apply the cautery at four points on the spines of the back, and afterwards apply the cautery into the neck where the collarbone of the patient is, and raise the hand from there.
E aprop cura aquel entro que sia sanat, e aquest sia cauteri olivar.	And then care for that which has been healed, and this cautery should be made with olive oil.
Capitol .x.	Chapter 10.
De cauterisacio de epilemcia.	On cauterization of epilepsy.
No es cauterizat le epilemtic sino aquella epilemcia es per flecma.	The epileptic is not cauterized, but that epilepsy is caused by flatulence.
E donc cove que mondifiques le cervel de lu al comensament de lu am yeras e am l’autra curacio la qual havem dicta en la divisio quan le malaute es gran e es tollerant la exceperacio de las medicinas.	And therefore, modify the patient's brain at the beginning of the treatment with years and the other cure which we have mentioned in the division when the patient is large and tolerates the exception of the medicines.
E si es enfant le qual no sufferte las medicinas, lahoras aministra guarguarissmes e mastiguatoris le servel mondifican, denant aquo per motz dias, am bonifficacio de las viandas.	And if it is a child who does not tolerate the medicines, then administer ginger and mustard to the servant who is modifying, giving it for several days, good nutrition of the foods.
E aprop ras le cap del malaute, e aprop cauteriza aquel am un cauteri en le mieg loc del cap segon la manieyra precedent, e am autre cauteri en le occiput de lu, e sobre quascun corn del cap sieu cauterisa.	And then shave the patient's head, and then cauterize that with a cautery in the middle of the back of the head according to the previous method, and with another cautery on the occiput of the patient, and over each hair of the head, cauterize.
E si le malaute es fort e es tollerant, lahoras cauteriza aquel am cauteris les quals he ditz, en havent paraliticament e mollificacio del cors sobre les spondils del col e les spondils del dos.	And if the patient is strong and tolerates, then cauterize that with cautery which I have said, having paralysis and softness of the body over the spine of the neck and the spine of the back.
E sia cauteri olivar segon qu’es precedit.	And if it is a cautery with oil, follow what has been said before.
Mays si le malaute es enfant, lahoras pausa cauteri subtil segon aquesta manieyra.	But if the patient is a child, then pause the subtle cautery according to this method.
Capitol .xi.	Chapter 11
De cauterizacio de melencolia.	Of the cauterization of melancholy.
Quan las causas de melencolia so humiditatz corrompudas e flacma gros, lahoras cauteriza aquel am les cauteris les quals havem ditz en le havent paralisi.	When the causes of melancholy are corrupted and thin, and have become thick and heavy, then cautery is applied to those parts which we have called "the ones that have paralysis.
E si la causa de melencolia es superfluitat declinant a melencolia, e le cors del malaute es humit, lahoras da ha beure aquo que mundifica le cervel de lu segon aquo que ha precedut en la divisio.	And if the cause of melancholy is excessive and tends towards melancholy, and the body of the patient is humid, then give them that which cleanses their brain according to the same thing that has preceded in the division.
E aprop ras le cap del malaute, e aprop fay tortora decentment fayta de li sobre le cercle, e aprop depausa aquela en le mieg loc del cap.	And then shave the head of the patient, and make a proper incision on the top of their head over the circle, and place a dressing on that spot.
E le malaute sia sesent cayrat, e sia tengut de tota partida.	And the patient should be kept lying down throughout.
E aprop pausa liniment; et es pus digne de boder antic de ovelhas.	And then place a liniment; and it is worthy of ancient sheep's tallow.
E escalfa aquel sobre le foc per calefaccio temprada per mesura, le qual le dit sufferta quan es mes en lu.	And apply that over the fire for heating, prepared according to measure, which the patient says relieves them when it is in them.
E aprop vuo’ aquel en le mieg loc del cap de lu en le cercle, e leysa lu entro que sia enfregidat.	And then apply that in the middle of their head over the circle, and let it be rubbed into them until it is absorbed.
E fay aquo am le malaute en tota semmana una veguada, am le autre regiment de lu bo entro que sia sanat; o si vols, cauteriza aquel fazen petitz puntz segon lo mays de lu, sino que tenguas la ma am un cauteri ayssi ordenat: aquesta es specia de cauteri la qual humecta le cervel am equalitat.	And give the patient this medicine every week for a whole week, following the other regimen until they are healed; or if you want, make small points with a pointed cautery according to the most of them, but always hold your hand on their chest with a cauterized hand: this is a special kind of cauterizer that moistens the brain equally.
E aprop pausa aquel coto enbegut en boder o en grays de gualina.	And place your hand on that swollen part in butter or in grayish wax.
Capitol .xii.	Chapter XII.
De cauterisacio de aygua descendent en le huel.	Of the application of hot water descending on the back.
Quan a tu es declarat le comensament de aygua en le huel per les senhals les quals yeu he ditz en la divisio, lahoras comensa e dona en beure al malaute aquo que mondifique le cap de lu, e guarda aquel de totas humiditatz.	When it is declared to you that the beginning of hot water on the back by the symptoms that I have mentioned in the division, then begin and give the patient that water which melts the head of them, and keep that one from all moisture.
E fay aquel suzar en banh en degu per alcus jorns.	And make that sweat in a bath for several days.
E aprop comanda a lu que raza le sieu cap, e cauteriza aquel am cauteri en le mieg loc del cap; e aprop cauteriza aquel am dos cauteris sobre dos templas si es le comensament de ysement de aygua en dos huels, o de la un latz si es comensamen de l’aygua en un huel.	And command the patient to shake their head, and make small points with that cautery in the middle of the head; and then make small points with two cauterizers on two temples if it is the beginning of hot water in two backs, or on one side if it is the beginning of hot water in one back.
Incideys am cauteri totas las venas e arcerias las quals so dejos la codena; e sian les cauteris en aquela lonh en la latitut de las templas.	Incise all the veins and tendons that are behind the cord; and place the cauteries in that long, on the side of the temples.
E guarda te de fluxs de sanc quan es cauterizat; e si veses de lu fluxs de sanc, osta le am alcuna medicina, la qual es a tu possible.	And watch out for blood flow when cauterizing; and if you see blood flow from there, stop the bleeding with some medicine that is available to you.
E yeu vindre am savieza la qual es en extraccio de arcerias e am abscizio de aquelas e cautela de fluxs de sanc.	And you should also have knowledge of the skill that is in the extraction of tendons and the treatment of those abscesses and caution about blood flow.
E alcunas vetz es cauterizat en le cervitz dejos dos osses am dos cauteris dererament produzitz.	And some veins are cauterized in the neck behind two bones and with two cauteries produced recently.
Capitol .xiii.	Chapter XIII.
De cauterizacio de lacrimas antiquas.	Of the cauterization of old tears.
Quan lacrimas dels huels so antiquas assuduament e per las venas e arterias las quals so en le loc manifest del cap defora e es verificat que aquo es superfluitatz frejas flecmatiquas, lahoras cauteriza aquel am cauteri le qual havem recontat en le capitol de comensament de aygua cazent en les huels, e am cauteri en le mieg loc del cap e am dos cauteris en la cervitz dejos dos templas, e am dos cauteris en la cervitz dejos dos osses.	When the tears from the eyes are very old and through the veins and arteries that are in the place manifest of the head and it is verified that this is excessive and flexible, then cauterize that one with the cauteries that we have mentioned in the chapter on the beginning of water cazent in the eyes, and with the cauteries in the middle of the head and with two cauteries in the neck behind two temples, and with two cauteries in the neck behind two bones.
E si indigeyses de addicio, lahoras cauteriza aquel en tot latz de la coa del huel sobre la extremitat del sobrecilh am petit cauteri.	If necessary for addiction, then cauterize that on the entire length of the shoulder blade above the upper eyelid with a small cautery.
Capitol .xiiii.	Chapter 14.
De cauterizacio de fetor de nas.	Of cauterization of bad breath from the nose.
Quan tu medicas aquel am aquo que havem dit en la divisio e no aprofieyta la tua medicacio, lahoras tu aparelha e dona en beure al malaute las cochias per tres noytz; e aprop ras le cap de lu, e cauteriza le am cauteri migier am cauteri olivar.	When you treat that person who has been mentioned in the division and have not yet completed your treatment, then prepare and give to the patient three drops of oil; and then remove the cap from it, and cauterize with a small cautery or an olive oil cautery.
E aprop cauteriza aquel am cauteri clavelh am dos cauteris sobre les dos sobrecilhs dejos les cabels un petit.	And then cauterize that with a small cautery or two cauteries on the two upper eyelids under the eyebrows.
E guarda te de la arceria que no incindas aquela.	And be careful not to burn that.
E del cauteri clavilh aquesta es la forma.	And this is the form of the small cautery.
Capitol .xv.	Chapter 15.
De cauteri de mollificacio de palpebras dels huels.	Of cauterization for softening the eyelids of the eyes.
Quan la palpebra del huel es mollificada per malautia o per humiditat, lahoras cauteriza aquela palpebre1 am un cauteri am aquest cauteri lunar; e aquesta es la forma de lu:	When the eyelid of the eye is softened by illness or moisture, then cauterize that eyelid with a small cautery or this lunar cautery; and this is its form:
E si vos, cauteriza aquel sobre les dos sobrecils un petit am dos cauteris en tota partida, e sian elonguatz de las timporas.	And if you, make points on the two superciliary arches with a small cautery in each part, and lengthen them from the temples.
E sia la longitut de quascun cauteri segon la quantitat del sobrecil.	And the length of each cautery should be according to the size of the superciliary arch.
E no premas trop la tua ma am le cauteri, mays segon la quantitat que la tersa partida de la palpebre sia adhurida.	And do not press your hand too close to the cautery, but according to the amount that the tense part of the eyelid is stuck.
Capitol .xvi.	Chapter XVI.
De cauteri de la palpebre del huel quan les pels so convertitz a las partidas dedintz e punho le huel.	About the cautery of the eyelid when the eyelashes are converted into the parts inside and out.
Quan les pels del huel son convertitz a las partidas dedintz ayssi que pungo le huel, cauteri en aquels es segon dos manieyras, quar cauteri o es am fer o es am medicina comburent.	When the eyelashes of the eyelid are converted into the parts inside and out, if you press the eyelid, make points in those places according to two methods, either with fire or with medical cauterization that burns.
Si am cauteri de lu am foc, comanda al malaute denant aquo que leyse les sieus pels ayssi cum aquels les quals les mundan, entro que sian prolonguatz e engualhatz; e si punho aquel deves le lor naysement, lahoras tu strenh les huels de lu am una benda per so que no sia maugut entro que·ls pels sian nascutz.	If you use fire for cauterization, command the patient to look at those eyelashes that are like those that clean them, while they are prolonged and equal; and if you press that which is their own, then strengthen the eyelids of that one with a bandage so that it does not open until the eyelashes have grown.
Donc cum siran nascutz e engualhatz, lahoras pausa le cap del malaute en le tieu se, e aprop senha sobre la palpebre dels huels de lu am tenta, am senhal le qual sia segon la figura de fulha de merta, e sia le comensament del senhal prop dels pels.	Therefore, when they are born and grown, pause the patient's head on your shoulder, and then place your hand over their eyelid, using a second hand in the shape of a half-moon, and the beginning of this method is near their ears.
E aprop pausa coto enbegut en album de huou o en mucillatge de ptilli sobre le huel.	And then place a soft cloth or moistened cotton on their eyelid.
E aprop igneys le cauteri del qual aquesta es la forma de lu.	And then remove the pointed cautery that is this shape of it.
E aprop cauteriza sobre la figura la qual as senhada, petit a petit, em motas veguadas, entro que sia comburida la superficia de la codena la qual es ayssi cum fuelha de mirta, tota aparent propriament.	And then cauterize the shape that was placed, little by little, in a zigzag pattern, until the surface of the eyelid is burned, which is like a half-moon, appearing properly.
E senhal de sanetat de la tieua obra es que tu vegus la palpebre de l’huel ja esser contrayta e·ls pels de lu esser elevatz deves la punctura del huel.	And to ensure the healing of the eye work, it is that you lift the eyelid which has already been contracted and the ears of the patient should be elevated for the puncture of the eyelid.
E donc eleva la tua ma e laysa aquel per tres jorns, e aprop pausa sobre lu coto am boder entro que sia eredicada la scara.	And then raise your hand and leave it there for three days, and then place it over the cloth until the wound is healed.
E aprop cura aquela am enguent entro que sia sanat.	And if necessary, cure that wound before it becomes infected.
Mays si retorna per les pels alcuna causa aprop lor naysement e la palpebra es mollificada, lahoras fay autra vetz le cauteri sobre aquel tot ayssi cum avias fayt primieyrament.	But if the eyelid returns to its place and becomes softened, then make another incision with the cautery over that area as you did before.
Mays si les pels so en la palpebra dejos, lahoras cauterisa aquela entro que sia elevada al sieu loc natural e sia engualhat e que les pels no punhan le huelh.	But if the eyelashes are in the eyelid, then cauterize that area while it is raised to its natural position and equalized so that the eyelashes do not push against each other.
Mays le cauteri am medicina comburent aquest es que comandes al malaute que leyse les pels entro que sian prolonguatz e engualhatz, e aprop sia fayta de carta de drap la forma de fuelha de mirtra.	But the cautery should be applied in such a way that the patient is commanded to pull the eyelashes while they are extended and equalized, and then a piece of cloth or cloth should be made into the shape of a fan to cool it.
E aprop pren de sabo conogut e de caus viva ana unc. i, o quays aquo, e aprop mescle3 aquelas causas be, e fay aquo am festinacio per so que no sia enfregidat; e aprop expandeys de aquo sobre la carta la qual es fayta ayssi cum forma de fulha de mirtra, e pausa aquel sobre la un huel od amdos; e pausa dejos le huel coto enbegut en album de huou, e el cap del malaute sia en le tieu se.	And then take a piece of soft cloth and a live coal, and if that is not available, and mix those causes with water, and make it into a poultice so that it is not scattered; and spread that over the cloth that was made into the shape of a fan, and place that on one eye while the other is covered with a soft cloth; and then place the head of the patient in a comfortable position.
E pausa le dit sobre le medicina e prem aquela un petit e no la mauguas entro que lo malaute senta la mordicacio de la medicina, quar mordicacio es en lu ayssi cum de foc.	Pause the medicine over the wound and press it gently but not too hard so that the patient feels the burning sensation of the medicine, which is like fire.
E donc cum percevera aquo que el atrobo mordicacio, lahoras leyssa la medicina e mau aquela am le tieu dit; donc cum cessa la mordicacio, lahoras remau la medicina he lava le huel am aygua; e lahoras considera si vezes la palpebra ja es levada ayssi cum es lavada deves la costriccio am foc o am incisio, quar lahoras esta be; e si no torna sobre aquela de la medicina sobre le loc en le qual no ha empremut la medicina e no se denigra entro que sia engualhada la tua operacio e sia contrayt le huel.	And so, if the burning sensation continues, remove the medicine and press it gently on the wound; when the burning sensation ceases, remove the medicine and wash the wound with clean water; then consider whether the eyelid has been lifted as it was when it was washed due to a cut or incision, for that is good; and if not, return to the medicine on the area where the medicine has not been applied and does not discolor before your operation is completed and it is contracted.
E aprop pausa sobre lu coto am boder entro que sia eradicada la codena de la adhustio, e aprop cura aquel am enguent deafinicon o am autre entro que sia sanat.	And then press over the wound with a clean cloth until the pus of the abscess is drained, and then treat it with an ointment or another remedy until it is healed.
E es necessari a tu, deves la tua operacio que guardes am pervigil diligencia que en le huel no caia re de la medicina, e si la palpebre aprop alscus dias es mollificada e alcuna causa dels pels punh en le huel, lahoras itera la tua medicina sobre aquel loc le qual de la palpebre es mollificat, e propriamen ayssi quo as fayt al comensament, e aprop enaviro lu entro que sia sanat.	And you must guard your operation that you keep clean diligence in the wound so that the medicine does not fall out, and if the eyelid becomes soft and some cause of the hairs in the wound, then repeat your medicine on that area where the eyelid is soft, and usually as it was done at the beginning, and do so until it is healed.
E aquesta es la forma de fuelha de mirtra.	This is the method of treating gout.
E sapias que les huels dels homes son diversificatz segon la magnitut e la parvitat, e donc segon aquo es fayta la tua contraccio.	And you know that the bones of men are varied according to their size and shape, and therefore your contraction should be made accordingly.
E no sira amaguada la via de rectetut ad aquel al qual es studi en aquesta art.	And do not obstruct the correct path to the one who studies this art.
Capitol .xvii.	Chapter 17.
De cauterizacio de fistula que es en le lacrimal de l’huel.	Of cauterization of a fistula that is in the lacrimal bone of the bone.
Quan tu curas fistula am aquo que havem dit en las divisios de las malautias e no confereys la tua curacio, lahoras cove que tu cauterizas aquela segon aquesta manieyra: comanda al malaute que pause le cap sieu en le tieu se, e tengua le cap de lu alcun ministre entre las tieuas mas en tal manieyra que no sia maugut ni agitat am le sieu cap.	When you treat a fistula with this method that we have mentioned in the divisions of diseases, do not compare your treatment, then cover your head with a cloth in your hand, and hold the head of the patient between your hands in such a way that it is not too tight or agitated.
E aprop pausa coto enfus en album de huou o en mucellage de ptilli sobre le huel de lu.	And then place a cotton swab soaked in alcohol or mucilage of poppy on the bone of the patient.
E aprop igneys le cauteri del qual aquesta es la forma:	And then ignite the cauterizer of which this is the form:
le qual sia conquau, ayssi cum es forma de cana o de pena de voltor, de la una extremitat am la qual es fayta lo cauteri.	which should be curved, like a cane or a pen knife, from one end of which the cauterizer is made.
E si voys, sia penetrant entro a la autra extremitat.	And if you see it entering the other end.
E si vols sia sort ayssi cum tenta.	And if you want to draw it out with a tent.
Mays empero aquel que es concau es milhor a la tieua obra.	But it is better to leave that which is concave as it is, or work on the other side.
E aprop prem la fistula si es uberta, e tra de lu sania et exsicca aquela.	And if the fistula is open, press it and insert clean and dry material into it.
E si no es uberta, lahoras obre aquela e extratz la poyredura de lu.	And if it is not open, then open it and extract the pus from it.
E aprop pausa sobre lu le cauteri le qual sia be ignit, e te am aquel la tieua ma un petit deves le cauteri del huel a la partida del nas, per so que no erre la tua ma o le malaute sia enquietat, e lahoras pausa le cauteri en le grays del huel e corrompas aquel.	And then place your hand over the area where the cautery is burning hot, and hold it away from the patient's face and nose, so that your hand or the patient is not burned, and then remove the cautery from the gray matter and corrupt that.
E donc si al comensament del tieu cauteri perve entro al os, bo es; e sino, lahoras itera le cauteri una veguada o dos, si mestiers era; e layssa aquel ayssi per tres jorns, e aprop pausa sobre aquel coto am boder e enviro lu am enguent exsiccatiu entro que sia sanat.	And if at the beginning of the treatment, the cautery goes into the bone, it is good; and if not, then repeat the cautery one or two times, if necessary; and leave that there for three days, and then place your hand over that area and apply dry material around it until it is healed.
Mays si eran passatz xi dias e no es sanat, lahoras pausa sobre lu medicina aguda corrosiva entro que l’os sia descubert e sia ras segon que conveneys en le sieu capitol.	If they have been ill for several days and have not recovered, then pause over the sharp, corrosive medicine until the bone is exposed and then scrape it according to what is suitable in its own chapter.
E es autra manieyra de cauteri de fistula la qual alscus primiers diysero: enten al loc de la fistula e fen aquela e aprop pausa en aquela fissura camaen subtil del qual es la forma de lu: E fon en aquela la quantitat de i unc de plom fundut; e te la tua ma am camaem am bona retencio, e no sia maugut le malaute per so que le plom fundut no pervengua al huel de aquel; e cove que pausas sobre le huel del malaute coto enfus en album de huou o en aygua, quar plom adhureys le loc de la fistula e sana aquela per sanacio meravilhora.	And there is another method of cauterizing fistulas that the first said: enter the location of the fistula and make a hole in that place; then place your hand over that fissure, which has the form of the lead; and put in that amount of one ounce of lead; and with your hand hold it well for retention, so that the lead does not reach the edge of that place; and cover that edge of the wound with album of egg or water, where the lead adheres to the location of the fistula and heals it by marvelous cure.
E si la fistula es sanada am aquo que havem dit del cauteri e de la curacio, bo es; e sino, lahoras es necessari aministrar trauc del nas e reduzir la fistula al cors del nas segon que vindra en son loc propri.	And if the fistula is healed by the method we have said of cauterization and cure, it is good; otherwise, it is necessary to administer a nostrum and reduce the fistula to the body of the nostrum when it comes to its own location.
Capitol .xviii.	Chapter 18.
De cauterizacio de la fendedura des potz.	On the cautery of the wound in the foot.
Motas veguadas accideysso fissuras en las labias, e majorment en las labias dels enfantz.	Vesicles or blisters often occur on the lips, and especially on the lips of children.
Donc cum tu curas aquelas fissuras am aquo que nos havem dit en las divisios e no aprofieyta la tua cura, lahoras igneys le cauteri petit cutellar segon aquesta forma que s’ensiec:	Therefore, when you treat those wounds with the method we have mentioned in the divisions and do not apply your cure, then apply the small cautery as follows:
E sia la conquavitat de lu segon la subtilitat de cotella.	And place it according to the thinness of the spoon.
Aprop pausa aquel init cuytadament en aquelas fissuras entro que·l cauteri pervengua al preon de las fissuras.	Then place your finger gently in those wounds until the cautery reaches the bottom of the wounds.
E aprop cura aquel am cerotz entro que sia sanat.	And then apply the healing ointment until it is healed.
Capitol .xix.	Chapter 19.
De cauterizacio de fistula en la boca.	On the cautery of fistulas in the mouth.
Quan en la razit de uvula o en le paladar o en las razitz de las dentz endeve apostema e aprop fa brac, e aprop es rompuda, e aprop es antiquada, e corr brac e es fayta fistula, e aprop tu curas aquela e no aprofieyta a curacio, lahoras cove que tu igniscas cauteri segon la quantitat que sia receubuda en la fistula, e aprop met aquel ignit en le trauc de la fistola, e te la tua ma entro que pervengua le ferr ignit al preon de lu, e al derier de lu fazen aysso una veguada o dos; e aprop cura aquel am aquo que nos havem dit de la curacio entro que sia sanat.	When in the uvula or on the palate or on the teeth, an abscess occurs and a swelling forms, and it is broken, and it becomes chronic, and pus forms and a fistula is formed, and you do not apply your cure, then apply the cautery according to the amount that has been discharged from the fistula, and place that ignited in the opening of the fistula, and then your hand inside until the hot iron reaches the bottom of it, and at the back of it make a blister or two; and then apply the healing ointment that we have mentioned for the cure until it is healed.
E donc si la sania es abscindita e es sanat, bo es; e sino, lahoras es necessari de descubrir le loc e hostar le os corrumput segon que vindra en son capitol.	If the wound is healed and cured, it is good; otherwise, it is necessary to discover the location and treat the corrupted bone according to what comes in its chapter.
Capitol .xx.	Chapter 20.
De cauterisacio de las dentz e de mollificacio de las angivas.	About the use of cautery for teeth and the softening of the jaws.
Quan las angivas son mollificadas per humiditat e las dentz son maugudas, e curas aquelas am medicinas e no confereys, lahoras pausa le cap del malaute en le tieu se, e aprop igneys le cauteri la forma del qual vindra aprop aysso, enayssi que tu pauses la quanula sobre la dent e entromet en aquela le cauteri ignit festinantment, e te la tieua ma un petit entro que·l malaute cente la calor del foc a la razit de la dent esser pervenguda.	When the jaws are softened by moisture and the teeth are decayed, and these diseases are not cured by medicines, place the patient's head on your knee, and hold the cautery in the shape that will be used, without you placing the quill over the tooth and inserting it into the area where the cautery is applied fiercely, and keep the patient away from the heat of the fire until the temperature of the tooth reaches the point where the pain is felt.
E aprop leva la tua ma, e aprop itera le cauteri alcunas veguadas segon que vols.	And then lift your hand, and repeat the cautery several times as you wish.
E aprop le malaute huompla la sua boca de aygua de sal e tengua aquela per una hora, e pueys stupa aquela, quar la dent mauguda es fermada e la gengiva mollificada es strenguda e la humiditat corrompuda es exsiccada.	And then the patient should close their mouth with salt water and hold it for an hour, and this can be done because the decayed tooth is closed, the softened jaw is strengthened, and the corrupted moisture is dried out.
Capitol .xxi.	Chapter 21
De cauterisacio de dolor de dent.	Of the cauterization of tooth pain.
Quan dolor de dent es per fregiditat, o en lu es freg o verm, o no comfereys la curacio am medicina, lahoras cauteri en aquela es segon dos manieyras: o cauteri am boder de vacas, o cauteri am foc.	When tooth pain is caused by coldness, or if there is frost or worms in it, and the treatment does not relieve the pain, then cauterization can be done in two ways: with a cautery made of cow's horn, or with fire.
Cauteri am boder es que tu prenguas boder de vacas e bulhas aquel en culhe de ferr , e aprop pren coto e envolopa le sobre la extremitat de la tenta, e aprop enmergeys aquel am boder bulhit, e pausa aquel sobre la dent dolorosa festinantment entro que sia enfregidat.	With a cautery made of cow's horn, you take the horn and blow into it until it is hot, then wrap it in cloth and place it over the end of the tent, and quickly push the heated cautery into the tooth that hurts.
E aprop itera aquela alcunas veguadas entro que la vertut del foc pervengua a la razit de la dentz.	And then repeat this several times until the power of the fire reaches the root of the tooth.
E si voys, submergeys lana o coto en le boder desus dit, e pausa aquel sobre la dent dolent, e pausa sobre aquel ferr ignit entro que·l ferr pervengua al preon de la conquavitat de la dent.	And if you wish, immerse wool or cloth in the horn above, and place that over the painful tooth, and place the heated iron on top of it until the iron reaches the root of the tooth.
Mays empero la cauterizacio am foc es que tu atendas a la quannula de eram o de ferr, e sia en le cor de lu alcuna grocesa e la acuitat del foc no pervengua a la boca del malaute.	But the cauterization with fire is that you wait for the proper time of day or night, and if there is any discomfort in it, and the heat of the fire does not reach the mouth of the patient.
E aprop igneys le cauteri la forma del qual vindra, e pausa aquel sobre la dent e te la tua ma entro que·l cauteri sia enfregidat; e fay aquo alcunas veguadas quar la dolor sira remauguda o en aquel dia o en l’autre dia.	And then approach the cautery in the shape it will come, and place that on the tooth and your hand inside to ensure the cautery is not broken; and do this several times so that the pain remains or on that day or on the next day.
E cove que per empressio de aquel cauteri que·l malaute umpla la sieua boca de bon boder e tengua aquel per una hora e aprop scupa le; e aquesta es la forma del cauteri.	And cover that the patient opens their mouth with good border and holds it for an hour, then remove it; this is the shape of the cautery.
E cauteriza am qual que tu voys extremittat segon que a tu es possible.	And cauterize as much as you can on the part that you want to extend according to what is possible for you.
E aquesta es la forma de la cannula:	This is the shape of the cannula:
Capitol .xxii.	Chapter 22
De cauterizacio de extrophulos.	Of cauterization of protrusions.
Quan extrophulos so de flecma e de humors fregas e no so hobedientz a digistio per medicinas e tu voys la digistio de aquelas leugerament, lahoras tu igneys le cauteri conquau la forma del qual es aquesta seguen, havent dos extremitatz hubertas per que yesca le fum deves le cauteri per l’autra extremitat, e pausa aquel ignit sobre aquel apostema una veguada, e autre si indigeyses de aquel, entro que pervengua al preon del apostema.	When protrusions are caused by cold humors that infiltrate and are not obedient to digestion by medicines, and you want to gently push them back, then approach the cautery with the shape of which is this following, having two ends prepared so that the smoke from the cautery can pass through the other end, and place that ignited on that abscess several times, and another if necessary, until it reaches the top of the abscess.
E si l’apostema es pauca, lahoras pausa le cauteri segon la quantitat del apostema, e aprop leyssa le per tres jorns e pausa sobre lu coto enfus en boder entro que sia remaugut aquo que·l foc ha comburit.
