E aprop tira la tua ma am aquel entro que·l pel sia fora-gitat am alixolati en la palpebra am le pel natural.	And then pull your hand out and insert it into the solution, and place it in the eyelid to return it to its natural position.
Mays si es atirat alixalati e non es gitat le pel, atiraras alixati a las partidas dejos am le fiel le qual tu has compost am aquela, entro qu’en sia gitat alixalati del trau sobira.	But if it is not returned to its position, then insert the solution at the parts where you have prepared it, and wait until it returns to its natural position.
E vegas aquela am la visio del huel, quar lahoras tu gitaras alixati e lo fiel, e grotan quascu e clautz le huel, e laysse le claus per dos dias o tres, entro que·l pel adheresca al sieu loc e nasque sobre aquel bona carn.	And then apply it to the eye, as you have done before, and wait until it adheres to its position and heals, and leave the cloth for two or three days, until the eye has healed and returned to its natural position.
E si es mays breu le pel, lahoras tu ajusta un pel lonc dels pels naturals, e es elevat am aquel, o que·l leysses entro que sia alonguat aprop alcu spazi, e lehoras tu eleva aquel.	If the wound is too short, then adjust a longer one from the natural hairs, and raise it to that one, or until it is long enough to be evenly spaced, and then raise that one.
Capitol .xiii.	Chapter XIII.
De la cura de ehacratir la qual ve en la palpebra desus.	About the treatment of the eyelid that is above the eye.
Quan ve en le huel ehacratir, e es contraccio de la palpebra quan es contrayta en sus, o a dextra o a sinistra partida, per mala consolidacio de plagua o de seccio o de cauteri, e es apelada leporina, e aquesta ahercrati o es natural o accidental, e es fayta per consolidacio de plagua o de seccios o de cauteri, o per semblantz a lor malcuratz.	When the eyelid is drawn downwards, and the contraction of the eyelid occurs when it is turned upwards, to the right or left part, due to poor consolidation of the eyelid or dryness or cauterization, and this is called entropion, and whether it is natural or accidental, and it is caused by poor consolidation of the eyelid or dryness or cauterization, or similar to them.
May la manieyra de la operacio en lu es que tu fendas aquela consolidacio e que separes las labias de lu, e pauses en lu en aquo que es entre aquelas una meca de drap de li, e ligues aquelas entro que sian sanadas.	May the operation in it be that you cut that consolidation and separate the lips of it, and place it in that which is between those a wad of cloth of linen, and tie them together when they are healed.
E no cove que tu uses de curacio de lu de las causas las quals exsiccan, constrenho; quar si tu fas aquo retorna alixacratir pus mal que nulh temps no foc habantz.	And do not use treatment of it from the causes that dry and constrict; because if you do that, it returns to be drawn downwards more than at any other time.
Usa en aquela de causas que mollifico ayssi cum es fenugrec, e embroca am la aygua en la qual son coytz altea e semensa de li, o enguent dyaquilon, le qual sia liquefayt am alcu dels olis, e submergeys en aquel la meca, e cura am aquel.	Use in those cases where there is a cause that melts like fenugreek, and rub the water in which they are soaked and mixed with him, or apply dayquilon, which should be liquefied with some oil, and pour it into that place, and cure that.
E lo tesaur de la tua curacio es que tu perforsses am tot engen que no sia consolidat segon la forma que foc al comensament.	The treasure of your cure is that you puncture all the engine that is not consolidated according to the form that fire has at the beginning.
E aquesta operacio la qual havem dita, no es sino alcuna rectificacio de ehalixacrati que no retorna la forma del loc segon que foc denant.	And this operation, which we have said, is only a correction of echalixacrati that does not return the form of the place according to what fire gives.
Capitol .xiiii.	Chapter xiv.
De la cura de ehacrati le qual es fayt en la palpebra dejos.	Of the cure of echalixacrati that is made in the eyelid.
Aquesta alxacrati la qual es fayta en la palpebra dejos, la qual es nompnada vertadierament alxacrati; e es de lu alcuna natural, autra accidental.	This echalixacrati that is made in the eyelid, which is not named vertadierament echalixacrati; and it is of some nature, other accident.
Mays accidental es fayta per plagua o per scissura o per cauteri o per autres semblantz.	Other accidents are made by plague or by cutting or by cauterization or by other similar things.
E la via de la operacio de lu es que tu prenguas una agula en la qual haga fil doble, e fiques aquela en la carn, e que la fassas passar del lacrimal de senestre entro al lacrimal dextre, entro que·l fil pervengua en las doas extremitatz de la carn.	And the way of the operation is that you take a needle in which you make double thread, and place it on the flesh, and make it pass from the lacrimal of the left eye into the lacrimal of the right eye, until the thread reaches both ends of the flesh.
E aprop exten la carn a las partidas desus am la agula e cus aquela am la agula, e inscideys am spatum ample.	And then extend the flesh to the parts above and below the needle, and cut it with the needle, and insert it into a wide space.
E donc si retorne la figura de la palpebre segon que cove, bo es; e sino, pren le ray e pausa aquel en la figura fenduda, e am aquel converteys la palpebra, e fen las doas fissuras en le latz de la palpebra dejos.	And if the shape of the eyelid returns to normal after the cut, it is good; otherwise, take the needle and place it on the broken figure, and with that, convert the eyelid, and make both wounds on the side of the eyelid behind.
E sian las extremitatz de las doas fissuras de dos angles de la inscizio, la qual has fayta entro que concurren, e sia de lor fayt angle entro que quan se congreguan sia fayta figura de lor.	And the ends of both wounds should be made into two angles at the beginning, which you have made while they are converging, and make the angle of each one into a figure when they come together.
E aquesta figura es letra greca: la landa.	And this figure is the Greek letter lambda: λ.
E aprop osta la carn aquela per la quantitat que es le latz de lu agut dejos de lu, aquo que siec la palpebra.	And then place the flesh there for the amount that is on the side of the eyelid behind it, which will close the eyelid.
E aprop ajusta las partz seperadas e cos aquelas am le fil de lana; e aprop cura aquelas am aquo que havem dit de las medicinas mollificativas e de las calguas entro que sia sanat.	And then adjust the separated parts and tie them with wool thread; and then take care of those that we have said about the softening medicines and the poultices inside which it is healed.
E si alxacrati endeve per fissura o sutura o cauteri, lahoras cove que tu fendas am fissura plana sobre les pels de la palpebra segon que es precedit.	And if the wound is caused by a laceration or suture or cauterization, then make sure that you cut the flat incision on the eyelids according to what is prescribed.
E aprop separa am la calgua entre doas labias segon que havem dit.	And then separate the poultice between two lips according to what we have said.
En la suma del sermo de la cura de alxacrati quan es desus o dejos, que corra en lu operacio, segon que es preparat de la forma de alxacrati, e aquela es en forma de motas diversitatz.	In the sum of the sermon on the cure of lacerations when it is raised or lowered, that the blood flows in the operation, according to what is prepared in the form of laceration, and that is in the form of various shapes.
E le artifexs savi totz temps prepara engen en quascuna manieyra la qual es possibla a lu entro que fassa retornar la figura a la forma natural, o prop de aquela, e aquel malaute segon que a lu conveneys de la operacio e dels strumentz en las majors disposicios.	And the artificer always prepares everything in every possible way that is possible inside which it makes return to the figure in its natural form, or near to that, and the patient according to what suits the operation and the tools in the best dispositions.
Capitol .xv.	Chapter 15.
De la adherencia de la palpebra am la conjunctiva o am la cornea.	Of the adhesion of the eyelid to the conjunctiva or to the cornea.
Quan accideys aquesta consolidacio a motz homes enayssi que sia solidada la palpebra pus desus am le album del huel, e sia prohibida de la facilitat del movement e de las suas obras naturals, donc cove que tu entrometas la extramitat del ray dejos la palpebra, e eleva en sus aquela, o exten aquela am le unci.	When this adhesion occurs in men who have their eyelid stuck above the white of the eye, and it is prohibited from facilitating movement and their natural works, therefore you should insert the extraction of the ray under the eyelid, and raise it to that area, or extend it to the eye.
E aprop tu inscideys la adherencia am spatum subtil, le qual no sia am acuitat de las inscisios, habantz obtus un petit per so que·l malaute no sia inquietat deves la operacio, e remau le spatum que no ledesca le huel am la sua acuitat.	And then you should insert the adhesion into a thin space, which is not sharp for incisions, having a small opening so that the patient is not disturbed by the operation, and remain the space that does not descend the white of the eye from its sharpness.
E sia la tua inscizio quays excorjan aquela adherencia am facilitat entro que sia retornada la palpebra segon la sua forma natural e que sia sanada tota la adherencia.	And your incision should excoriate that adhesion with ease, so that the eyelid returns to its natural form and the entire adhesion is healed.
E aprop tu met en le huel aygua salada am la qual tu laves; o distilla en lu de zunia dissolvut en l’aygua.	And then you should apply saltwater to the white of the eye, which you wash; or distill it with lavender dissolved in the water.
E aprop separa entre la palpebra e l’huel am calgua de li, e pausa sobre le huel lana infuza en album de huou, e aprop le tertz jorn usa de causas consolidativas entro que sia sanat.	And then separate between the eyelid and the conjunctiva of the eye, place over the conjunctiva a piece of waxed cloth soaked in honey, and use the third day to apply consolidating remedies until it is healed.
Capitol .xvi.	Chapter XVI.
De inscizio de ungla e de eminencia de carn dels lacrimals.	Of the beginning of a nail and the elevation of flesh from the eyelids.
Sapias que ungla es segon dos manieyras, quar o es nervosa, e es semblant a ciphac dur subtil; o es no-nervosa, semblant a humiditat blanca congilada, la qual quan ferr la toca, o es forsat aquela prendre am onci, es abscindida e le onci no es ficat en lu.	You should know that a nail is of two kinds, either it is nervous, which is similar to a hard, fine thread; or it is not nervous, similar to white moisture gathered together, which when it touches the eye, often takes on an ulcer, which is then abscinded and the ulcer does not stick to it.
E amdos las specias no comensan sino del lacrimal major entro que va petit a petit que cobre la vista e prohibeys le lum e·l movement de huel.	And the special nerves do not begin until the major lacrimal, which gradually covers the vision and prevents the light and movement of the conjunctiva.
Mays la manieyra del obrar en la inscizio de lu es que·l malaute pause le sieu cap en le tieu se, e aprop obre les huels de lu, e eleva la palpebra am la tua ma, e aprop colligeys la ungla am onci de pauca duplicacio e exten aquela a las partidas desus.	When the nerve works at the beginning of it, the patient should place his head on his elbow, and then raise the conjunctiva of the eye, and lift the eyelid with your hand, and then collect the nail from the ulcer with a pair of tweezers and extend it to the parts above.
E aprop pren una agula e entromet en aquela un pel de cavalh o de buou o de vaqua, o de semblantz, o de fiel fort, o duplica la extremitat de la agulha petit a petit e fica aquela en le mieg de la ungla, e penetra aquela am la agulha, e lia am fiel la ungla; e exten aquela a las partidas desus, e excorja am le pel le latz de la ungla lo qual siec la pupilla.	And then take a needle and insert it into the joint of the cavalry horse or ox or cow, or similar animals, or strong iron, or double the tip of the needle small by small and place it in the middle of the nail, and pierce that with the needle, and hold the nail firm; and extend that to the parts above, and excoriate the skin on the side of the nail which is the pupil.
E ayssi tu sieguas aquela am le pel entro al derier de lu.	And then continue that with the needle through the back of the patient.
E aprop tu inscideys le romanent en la razitz del lacrimal am spatum subtil o am petitas forfexs, e leysa la carn del lacrimal natural per so que per inscizio de aquela no endevengua fluxs de lagremas continuabla.	And then you insert the needle into the space of the lacrimal duct with a thin spatula or small forceps, and remove the flesh of the lacrimal gland so that it does not continue to produce continuous tears after insertion of the needle.
E alscunas vetz la ungla am le sol onci estenduda o am fiel, ayssi co havem dit, e aprop sia excurjat am spatum leon del qual aquesta es la forma de lu:	And sometimes the nail is extended or held firmly as we have said, and then excoriate the skin on the side of the needle which has this shape:
E guarda te que am le spatum no toques la tunica cornea e que avengua en lu ruptura, e que la pupilla sia perforada.	And be careful that the spatula does not touch the corneal tunic and that it breaks in it, and that the pupil is perforated.
Aprop la inscizio geta en le huel un pauc de sal trissa o di cief fayt de siniar, e leyssa aquel entro al autre dia; e aprop cura aquel am aquo que cove entro que sia sanat.	Approach the beginning of the foot with a small amount of salt or salted water, and leave it there for several days; then care for that wound to ensure it is healed.
E si la ungla no es nervoza e no podes metre la agulha, ni es ficada en aquela le onci, lahoras motas veguadas aquesta specia de ungla es curada am medicinas, e es sanada ayssi cum yeu e recomtat en la divisio.	If the nail is not tender and you cannot insert the needle, or it does not stick in that place, then this type of nail is healed with medicines, and it is healed as well as possible and recommended for use in the division.
E si tu vols inscindir aquela, lahoras tu obre le huel del malaute e pren spatum subtil leon de freul acuitat segon aquesta forma:	And if you want to incise that, then you begin by opening the thigh of the patient and taking a thin, sharp lancet of suitable sharpness in this form:
am subtilitat.	with thin sharpness.
E si vezes que aquela es rarificada e es confugida e empren en aquela razit, lahoras distilla de la tua ora en le huel de cief fayt de siniar o am cief rog o am sal trissat, e opila le huel entro a l’autre dia.	And if you see that it is rarefied and contracted and begins to form in that place, then pour some of your own urine into the foot bath made of salt or rose oil or salted water, and keep it there for several days.
E aprop itera sobre aquela la operacio entro que sia remaugut tot aquo que es de lu, sino que·l contrari apostema caut sia en le huel, quar lahoras tu leyssa aquela, e cura al comensament la apostema entro que sia sanat.	And then repeat the operation on that until everything that is in it has been removed, but if the contrary abscess causes pain in the wound, then leave that and cure the abscess when it begins to heal.
E aprop itera la tua operacio sobre aquela am razo entro que sia sanat.	And continue your operation until the patient is healed.
La emenencia de la carn lacrimal, si notz en le huel per gran nocument, sia suspendut am onci; e inscideys aquela de aquela una partida, e no ultimes la inscizio per so que no inscidesqua fluxs de lagremas.	The problem with the lacrimal gland, if noticed to be causing great harm, should be removed surgically; and incise that part, but do not end the incision because you do not want to cause excessive tear flow.
E aprop distilla en le lacrimal cief rog e fayt de siniar entro que sia sanat.	And then drip some medicine into the lacrimal canal and let it heal until the patient is healed.
Capitol .xvii.	Chapter XVII.
De inscizio de alguazardenic e de aquo que es nascut de carn ajustada en le huel.	About the incision of the lacrimal gland and that which is born from flesh adjusted in the eye socket.
Alcunas veguadas en les huels de alcus es nascuda carn roga, e es sobre-pausada entro que cobre la pupilla, o apropinqua o estrenh sobre las palpebras e fort leu comprem las palpebras a las partidas deforo e es assemblada a roza de balaustra.	Sometimes flesh is born in the eye socket, and it is overgrown before covering the pupil, or approaching or stretching over the eyelids and strongly pressing the eyelids to the parts of the eye and is assembled at the edge of a balustrade.
Mays la operacio en lu es que·l malaute pausa le sieu cap en le tieu se; e aprop obre les huels de aquel e colligeys tota aquela carn am oncis convenientz ad aquo, e te aquo am una forcep o am cesti; e aprop inscindiys la carn el comensament entro que tot sia finit am le encisori, e guarda te del huel que no ledescas aquel deves la tua operacio.	During the operation, the patient should pause their head on the table; and then open the eyelids of that person and collect all that flesh with an incision convenient for that, and that with a forceps or a hook; and then incise the flesh at the beginning until everything is finished by the cutter, and guard yourself from the eye socket that you do not descend that which is your operation.
E sia la tua inscizio am la qual inscides aquelas o am espatum le qual nos havem recomtat en la inscizio de la ungla, o am petitas forfexs am las quals es colligit ascebel segon que vindra la forma de lu aprop aquest capitol.	And insert your instrument into that which you inserted those or the spatula we recommended in the beginning of the needle, or small forceps by which you gather the abscess according to how the form of it approaches this chapter.
Donc cum es complida la tua inscizio e es remauguda tota aquela carn, lahoras omple le huel de sal trissa, o destilla en lu polvera roga e semblantz a lu de las medicinas corrossivas, e pausa sobre le huel deforo coto am album de huou entro que sia asegurat de apostema caut.	Then, when your instrument is completed and the entire area is cleaned, fill the wound with salt-soaked cloth, or pour in the powdered herb mixed with a similar corrosive medicine, and place a sterile cloth over the wound until it is ensured that the abscess has been successfully drained.
E si roman alcuna causa de alguardenici e es senhoragat sanc caut, e temes apostema caut, lahoras leyssa le huel e cura aquela apostema am aquo que ceda aquela apostema, e aprop itera sobre aquel am operacio entro que sia sanat, e semblantment fay en la carn ajustada la qual accideys en le huel de aquesta especia.	And if there is any cause for alarm and the patient's condition is seriously endangered, and you fear an abscess formation, then lance the wound and treat that abscess with whatever remedy that heals that abscess, and repeat this operation until it is healed, and similarly treat the surrounding flesh which has been affected by this condition.
Mays empero tu cove que alienes tota curacio del huel freul per via natural o per via accidental, obran am ferr, e no metas la tua ma en alcuna de aquestas operacios entro que veges que aquel membre sia suffertant aquela operacio.	However, you must ensure that all care of the wound is performed through natural or accidental means, using iron, and do not place your hand in any of these operations until you are sure that that member has suffered this operation.
Capitol .xviii.	Chapter 18.
De colleccio de sabel en le huel.	Of collection of blood in the abdomen.
Sabel so venas rogas las quals son testudas sobre le huel e prohibeysso al vesement la sua operacio, e develican le huel am longitut de dias.	Blood vessels that are tortuous over the abdomen and prevent the surgeon from performing their operation, and they develop the abdomen in length of days.
Donc necessari es al comensament que tu consideres si le huel en le qual es sabel es fort e en lu no es autra malautia que sabel, lahoras tu colligeys aquel sabel.	Therefore, it is necessary at the beginning to consider whether the abdomen in which there is blood is strong and in it there is no other disease than blood, then you collect that blood.
E es que tu comandes al malaute que pause le sieu cap en le tieu se, e aprop suspen aquelas venas am un onci o am dos segon la tua prudencia; e sia aquel onci de subtil duplicacio segon aquesta forma:	And if you command the patient to lie on their back and suspend those veins with one or two according to your judgment; and that thread should be of fine double thickness according to this form:
o so dos oncis gradantment en un cos segon aquesta forma:	or two threads gradually in a coil according to this form:
E aprop sian colligidas aquelas venas am forses subtils, am subtilitat, e abstergeys le sanc hora aprop hora, entro que vegas aquelas venas esser remaugudas del huel e sian revolgudas.	And then those veins are collected with fine forceps, with fineness, and wipe them away hour by hour until they are removed from the abdomen and turned back.

Capitol .xxv.	Chapter 25.
De theyls natz en las extramitatz del nas.	About the nostrils on the outside of the nose.
Motas veguadas es nat theyl en las extramitatz del nas, e es magnificat e omentat en alscus dias entro en que mot es leg le reguardament de lu.	The nostrils on the outside of the nose are often blocked, and they are magnificent and open on other days when it is not looked at closely.
E per aquo cove que tu inscidas aquel en le comensament de la apparissio de lu, e erediques tot aquel.	And for that reason, you should insert a probe into the beginning of the appearance of it, and remove all of it.
E aprop pausa sobre le loc o cauteri o medicina comburent la qual estia en loc de lu.	Then place your hand or cauterizing instrument over the area where the burning medicine was placed.
Mays si es tardada la sua inscizio entro que sia magnificat, lahoras considera si es lapificat, dur, de fusca color e de pauc sentiment, lahoras no toques aquel am ferr quar es apostema crancos; quar motas veguadas ad aquel que inscideys aquesta apostema endeve per lu granda malicia sobre aquel le qual aquel havia.	If the insertion of the probe is delayed until it becomes magnificent, then consider whether it is calcified, hard, black in color and has little sensation, do not touch that iron which is a crusty abscess; because the nostrils are often blocked by the great malice of that which the person had.
E si le apostema es de leon tocament e no es de fosca color, e vezes que inscizio es possibla en tot aquel, lahoras evacua le malaute e inscideys aquel senes temor, e cura le loc am aquo que exsique e costrenh entro que sia sanat.	And if the abscess is of lion-like appearance and is not black in color, and insertion is possible in all of it, then evacuate the patient and insert that medicine with fear, and cure the area with what dries and constricts until it is healed.
Capitol .xxvi.	Chapter 26
De sutura del nas e de las labias e de la aurelha quan la continuitat es dissolvuda per plagua o per semblantz.	Of sutures of the nose and lips and of the earlobe when continuity is dissolved by a wound or similar injuries.
Sapias que quan accideys solucio de continuitat en una de aquestas cartillages, pauc confereys en aquela operacio sino en alcus homes.	You should know that when continuity is lost in one of these cartilages, you should not perform surgery on it, but rather on other men.
Donc cove, quan endeve ad alcu alcuna causa de aquelas, que consideres si es plagua fresca am le sieu sanc, e lahoras tu ajusta las doas labias de la plagua am sutura, e aprop cura aquel entro que sia sanat.	Therefore, if you have any reason to consider one of those, whether it is a fresh wound or its scar, and then you adjust the two lips of the wound with stitches, and cure that within which it is healed.
E si las labias de solucio de continuitat so ja separadas, e quascuna es fayta sana, lahoras cove que tu excorjes quascuna partida de la sua codena apparent entro que n’iesca sanc.	And if the lips of continuity loss are already separated, and each one is healed, then consider that you should excise each part of its scar within which it does not form a scar.
E aprop ajusta las doas labias am sutura e strenh aquelas, e sobre aquelas pulveriza sanc de drago e enses trissat, e pausa sobre la polvera una pessa de emplaustra diafinicon, o de alcu autre dels emplastres consolidatius, e leyssa aquel liat per dos jorns o per tres, e aprop deslia aquel e permuta aquel emplaustre e leyssa aquel entro que·ls fiels per si sian abscinditz, e aprop cura am enguent entro que sia sanat.	And then adjust the two lips with stitches and strengthen those, and above them powder dragon's blood and three-grained cinnamon, and place a dressing of diachylon plaster or of any other consolidating plaster on top of the powder, and leave that for two days or three, and then remove that and replace it with another plaster and leave it until the wounds have healed.
Mays la manieyra de la sutura es que tu agregues la solucio de continuitat o am agulhas ayssi cum havem recomtat en la sutura del ventre, o agregua la solucio de continuitat am fiel ayssi cum a tu e fayt saber.	May the needle of the suture be such that you add the solution of continuity or use needles as we have recommended in the abdominal suture, or add the solution of continuity with thread as you have done and make it known.
Capitol .xxvii.	Chapter 27.
De extraccio de aquela causas que veno en las doas labias en las partidas dedintz.	Of the extraction of those causes that come in the lower lips in the parts divided.
Motas veguadas endeve a motz homes en las partidas dedintz de las suas labias alcus apostemas durs semblantz a gras de errs, e alscunas de lors son mendres e alcunas son majors.	Some boils are found in men in the divided parts of their lower lips, similar to hard abscesses, and some are smaller and some are larger.
Donc cove que tu convertas las labias e fendas quascuna de aquelas duricias de tota part, e aprop la abscizio umpliscas le loc de sagi trissat entro que·l sanc sia restrengut, e aprop sia lavat am vi agre e sia curat le loc am aquo que es stipticitat, entro que sia sanat.	Therefore, you should turn the lips and cut each of those hardness in that part, and then fill the abscess with healing herbs until it is strong, and then wash it with very hot water and cure the area with what has stiptic properties, until it is healed.
Capitol .xxviii.	Chapter 28.
De inscizio de la carn ajustada en las gengivas.	Of the beginning of flesh attached to the gums.
Granre de veguadas nays sobre la gengiva carn ajustada la qual les antics apelero albulus, adonc cove que tu suspendas aquela am onci o que tenguas aquela am las forfecs e inscidas aquela deves la sua razit, e leyssas la sania correr o le sanc.	A large number of boils are attached to the gums, which the ancients called albus, so you should suspend that one or the one you have with the forceps and incise that one at its base, and let the blood run out or the wound heal.
E aprop pausa sobre le loc sagi trissat o autra polveras stipticas o excicativas.	And then place a dry or stimulating powder on the wound location.
E si aquela carn retorna, lahoras inscideys aquela segundariament, e cauterisa aquela, quar aprop le cauteri no retornara.	And if that flesh returns, then insert it secondarily, and cauterize it, so that the cautery will not return.
Capitol .xxix.	Chapter 29.
De razo de dentz am ferr.	On the reason for iron teeth.
Quan en la superficia de las dentz de las partidas dedintz e de las de foro e entre las gingivas so ajustadas escorsas aspras, legas, e alcunas veguadas son de nigradas e son faytas citrinas o vertz entro que a la gingiva ve per aquo corrupcio e son faytas las dentz legas.	When sharp, rough, and sometimes black scales are adjusted on the surface of the teeth, in the mouth, and between the gums, they are yellow or green, and through this corruption the teeth become loose.
E donc cove que tu fassas sezer le malaute entre las tuas mas e pausar le cap de lu en le tieu se, e ratz las dents en las quals apareysso aquelas escorsas e causas semblantz arena entro que de lor no romangua deguna causa, e aquo fay de la negror e de la citrinitat e de las autras entro que sian mondificadas.	And therefore you should brush the patient's teeth between their hands and place their head on your knee, and remove those scales that appear similar to sand, and through which no cause of decay has ever occurred, and this is how blackness, yellowness, and other discolorations are caused.
Donc si es ostat aquo que es en aquelas del comensament de la razio, bo es; e sino, lahoras tu itera la razio sobre aquelas al autra dia e al segon e al tertz entro que vengua al derier stament en aquo que tu vols.	If this is the case at the beginning of the reasoning, then it is good; otherwise, you should repeat the reasoning on those teeth every other day and the second and third time until it reaches the desired state.
E sapias que las dentz han necessitat de motz rezoris de diversas formas e de motas figuras segon que es preparat a la tua operacio.	And you should know that teeth require different shapes and sizes of files and instruments according to what is prepared for your operation.
E per so quar le razori am le qual la dent es raza de la partida dedintz es autre del razori am le qual es ras entre las dentz segon autras formas, e aquestas formas de razoris sian deves tu preparadas las quals veyras tantost:	And so that you know how the file that is used to shape the part of the tooth that is not cut is different from the file that is used to smooth between the teeth in other shapes, and these shapes of files should be prepared by you as follows:
Capitol .xxx.	Chapter XXX.
D’eradicacio de dentz.	Of tooth extraction.
Cove que tu cures la dent de la sua dolor am tot engen e tardes en tota eradicacio de lu, quar no es denguna causa que suplisqua la veguada de lu quan es eradicada, quar es sustancia sublima entro que es excusacio en la eradicacio de lu.	That you cure the tooth of all its pain and delay in the entire extraction of it, because there is no cause that should supplement the weight of it when it is extracted, because the substance sublimates within which the extraction is made.
Mays cove quan le malaute es forsat aquela dent eradicar, que fermament deves tu sia certificat quala es la dent dolent, quar motas veguadas la dolor descep le malaute e cuga que sia en dent sana, e tu eradicas aquela e aprop la dolor no cessa entro que la dent malauta e dolent sia eradicada, quar nos ja havem vist aquo per operacio dels barbies.	May you also be certain when the patient is ready to have that tooth extracted, because the pain deceives the patient and makes him think that it is in a healthy tooth, and you extract that one and the pain does not cease until the bad and painful tooth is extracted, which we have already seen in the operation of the teeth.
Donc cum deves tu es sertificat qual es la dent dolent, e que o sabes be, lahoras cove que tu scarifiques en le circuit de la dent am spatum en le qual sia alcuna vertut, entro que sia dissolvut de la dent de la gingiva de tota partida, e aprop mau aquel am les tieus ditz, o am forfexs subtils al comensament petit a petit entro que aquela concucesquas.	Therefore, when you need to certify which tooth is hurting, and if you know how to do it, first scrape around the circumference of the tooth with some tool that has some usefulness, until it is dissolved from the tooth from the gum in all parts, and then remove that with tweezers or fine forceps, bit by bit until you have removed those.
E aprop alogua en lu fortz tenalhas grans per bona loquacio o estuptura fort, e pausa le cap del malaute entre les tieus denolhs que be le tengues que no·s maugua, e aprop tratz la dent segon rectitut en manieyra que no trenques aquela, ni al malaute major dolor no dones.	And then place a large wooden spatula in the patient's strong jaw for good loquacity or to prevent suffocation, and place your hand on the patient's head between their teeth so that they do not bite you, and then remove the tooth straight in a way that does not give them more pain or harm the patient.
E donc si no es foro-getat, lahoras pren un de aquels instrumentz, e met aquel dejos lu de tota part am facilitat e esforsa la remocio de lu ayssi que es feyt al comensament.	And if it is not forgotten, then take one of those tools, and place it there to facilitate and reduce the effort in removing it at the beginning.
Mays si la dent es trauquada o corrosa, lahoras cove que tu comples de drap aquel trauc e estrenguas aquel am la extremitat de ray subtil per so que no sia trinquada en la hora de la tua constriccio sobre aquela am tenalas.	But if the tooth is broken or worn, then make sure to wrap that break and tighten it with a fine wire at its end so that it is not crushed in your construction over that at the jaw.
E cove que tu obres exquesitament am scarificacio en le circuit de tota part de la gingiva e guarda mot la tua fortaleza que no trenques aquela e romangua partida de lu, e retorne sobre le malaute per la malicia que sia majo que la primieyra dolor de lu.	And you should work carefully on the incision around all part of the gum and guard your strength so that you do not tear that and remain a part of it, and return over the patient for the major pain that is the first pain of him.
E guarda te que no fassas aquo que fan alscus ignorantz barbiers en lor fistinacio e audacia sobre la eradicacio de lor, ses que no aministran aquo que nos havem recomtat; quar motas veguadas fan venir sobre les homes malautias grans las quals son pus dificils que sian trinquadas, e las razitz de lor remaugudas totas, o alcunas de aquelas, o que extrayguas aquela am alcus osses de la mandigula ayssi cum motas veguadas havem testificat.	And guard yourself that you do not do what ignorant barbers do in their practice and audacity in the eradication of them, which they do not administer what we have recommended; for many wounds bring on great illnesses that are much harder than tooth extractions, and the reasons for their success are all, or some of those, or that they extract that with the wounds which we have testified.
E aprop la eradicacio de lu sia lavada la boca am vi caut o vi agre am sal.	And the eradication of him is washed the mouth with vinegar or with salt.
E si endeve fluxs de sanc per aysso, ayssi cum motas veguadas endeve, lahoras trissa alcuna quantitat de zegi e aspergeys sobre la plagua, e si no confereys aquel zegi, cauteriza.	And if there is a flow of pus through the wound, which also occurs with many wounds, then cut off some amount of zeolite and sprinkle it on the wound, and if you do not find that zeolite, cauterize it.
La forma de las forceps e tenalas subtils am las quals es mauguda la dent al comensament sia de longua extramitat, de breu manubre e gros, per so que no sian doblatz quan am aquels deves obrar.	The form of the forceps and holding them subtly is such that it is praised for its long handle and thin, so that they do not bend when performing those tasks.
E sian ayssi cum vezes de gros manubre entro que quan estrenhas am aquelas no sian dobladas, sian breus extramitatz.	And if there are times of thick handles that when you hold them, they are not bent, they are short extraction tools.
E sian faytas de ferr de India descentment faytas de dreytas extramitatz, e en las extramitatz de aquelas sian dentz de las quals las unas intron en las autras e estrenhan per constriccio descent fort, e alscunas veguadas las extramitatz de aquelas sian la forma del bec d’un auzel le qual ha nom ciconia, so es guanta, e son de fort constriccio.	And if they are made of iron from India, they are straight extraction tools, and in their handles, there are teeth of those that one puts into the others and they are held together by a strong constraint, and sometimes they are shaped like the beak of a stork, which is called ciconia, so it is gripping, and they are of great constraint.
Capitol .xxxi.	Chapter 31.
De erradicacio de dentz e d‘estraccio dels osses de las mandibulas trincadas.	On the removal of teeth and extraction of bones from the jawbones that are impacted.
Quan deves la eradicacio de dent le qual es trinquat roman alcuna causa, lahoras cove que tu pauses sobre le loc coto am boder per un jorn o per dos entro que·l loc sia mollificat; e aprop entromet algesti o tenalhas las extramitatz de las quals so asembladas al bec de un auzel apelat ciconia o guanta, la forma de las forceps:	When you have to remove a tooth that is impacted, it is often caused by some reason, then place your hand over the place where the bone is located for a day or two until that place becomes soft; and then use anesthesia or hold the extraction tools whose shape resembles the beak of a stork called ciconia or guanta, the form of the forceps:
Las extramitatz de lor sian faytas dedintz ayssi cum lima o alfagi.	The outer parts of their joints were cut with a knife or a chisel.
E si no obediys a tu a eyssiment am aquestas forceps o tenalas, lahoras cove que tu caves sobre la razit e descrobas tota la carn e entrometas le instrument le qual ha nom atali, so es palanca petita del qual la forma es aquesta:	And if they do not obey your order to open their mouth or let you hold it, then force them to open their mouth and remove all the flesh, and insert the instrument called the almucia, which is a small hook with this shape:
E sia de breu extremitat grossa un petit, e no sia enbegut per so que no sia trinquat.	And if it is short and thick, make it slightly thin, but not too much so that it does not become square.
Donc si per aquo la razit es foro-getada, bo es; e sino, ajuda te am aquestz autres instrument dels quals aquestas son las formas: la forma del primier instrument es de triangulada extramitat en la qual sia alcuna grossesa:	Therefore, if the mouth is opened, good; otherwise, use these other instruments of which these are the shapes: the shape of the first instrument is a triangular extramitation with some roughness:
La forma del segon instrument es que sia de triangulada e de pus subtil extremitat.	The shape of the second instrument is that it be triangular and have a more delicate tip.
E ja so ajudatz am aquest instrument havent dos ramps del qual aquesta es la forma aprop la seguent:	And you have already helped with this instrument having two ramps, which is the appropriate shape as follows:
e am autres instrumentz les quals precidero en rasura de dentz; quar juvament es fayt am aquest instrument le qual es asemblat a onci gran, e aquesta es la forma:	And you will need other instruments that I will describe in the removal of teeth; because it is very important to do this instrument, which is similar to an awl, and this is the shape:
de la triangulada extremitat torta o curta, la qual sia alcuna grossesa, e no sia enbegut per so que no sia trinquat.	From the triangular distal end that is too short or too thick, which should not be too thin to avoid being triangular.
E otra sapias que·ls instrumentz de las dentz motz so e semblantment les autres instruments.	And other wise men say that the instruments of teeth are like the others.
Mays le artifexs savi e subtil en l’art, atroba per si mateys segon aquo que a lu significa la operacio e las malautias diversas; quar son de las malautias a las quals les antics no diysero ni pausero propri instrument, per las formas de diversas specias.	The artists are wise and subtle in the art, and for this reason they use different tools according to what it signifies for each operation and various diseases; because of the different shapes of various species.
Mays si es trinquat l’os de la mandibula o dels autres osses de la boca, o si poyreys, lahoras sia pes curat sobre aquel en son loc am aquo que es a lu convenient dels instrumentz e de las forceps las quals havem dit en la extraccio de las razitz de las dentz, e ajuda te am gesti del qual aquesta es la forma:	If the jawbone or other bones of the mouth are triangular, then it is necessary to be careful with that one in its place according to what is convenient for the tools and the forceps that we have mentioned in the extraction of the roots of the teeth, and help you with the handling of which this is the form:
E sia en lu alcuna grosseza petit a petit, e sia instringida o tenguda am la boca per que no evasesca o fuga entro que l’os de tot sia foro-getat; e aprop restaura le loc am medicinas convenientz ad aquo.	And if there is any thickness little by little, and it is stretched or held in the mouth so that it does not escape or enter until the bone of all is completely removed; and then restore the place with appropriate medicines for that.
Mays si en l’os es petita poyredura, lahoras ratz aquel de aquela poyredura e de la sua negror, e cura aquel entro que sia sanat.	If there is a small pustule on the bone, then prick that pustule and its black core, and cure it within so that it becomes healthy.
Capitol .xxxii.	Chapter 32.
De la cura de las dentz eminentz sobre las autras.	About the treatment of prominent teeth compared to others.
Quan las dentz so eminentz no segon lor cors natural per aquelas la forma es laga, e majorment quan endeve a las femnas, e majorment a las piuselas venerablas; donc cove que tu consideras: si dent es nada aprop autra dent, e no es possibla sarradura ni linament de lu, lahoras radica aquela; mays que no sia annexa am autra dent, lahoras tu inscideys aquela am aquest instrument del qual aquesta es la forma; e es semblant a morr de porc, e sia feyt de ferr de India de extramitat mot aguda.	When teeth are prominent and do not follow their natural course, and especially when they grow towards women, and more so towards revered virgins; therefore, you should consider: if a tooth is not close to another tooth, and it cannot be sawed off or extracted with a linament, then you should remove that tooth; but if it is not attached to another tooth, then you should incise it with this instrument of which this is the shape; and it is similar to a pig's tusk, and it should be made of Indian iron of extramatted metal for its sharpness.
E sia la tua inscizio am la qual inscideyses aquela en trops dias per la duricia de la dent, e que no sia comauguda autra de las dentz.	And if your incision is too deep and it takes several days to heal because of the hardness of the tooth, and it is not connected to another tooth.
E si es dent eminent expausat a limadura, lahoras lima aquel am lima de ferr de India del qual aquesta es la forma:	And if it is necessary to spread it out, then use this Indian iron knife of the following form:
E sia tot de ferr de India e·l margua eysament; e sia de motz menutz puntz ayssi cum lima am la qual son faytas agulhas, am la qual la dent sia limada pauc a pauc en motz dias am fecilitat, per so que no sia autra dent comauguda e caga.	And it should all be made of Indian iron; and the handle should be the same; and it should have many pointed tips like needles, which are used to cut a little at a time in a few days, so that no other tool is needed and becomes dirty.
E aprop lineys aquela en la fi, e ratz aquela am alscus razoris.	And then draw it along the line, and scrape it with a razor.
E si es dent del qual una partida es trinquada e lideys la lengua, lahoras cove que tu limescas aquel entro que l’aspretat de aquela fraccio sia ostada e engualhada, e sia aplenada per so que la lengua no ledesca ni la paraula no corrumpa.	And if it is of the kind that one part is soaked and lies on the tongue, then make sure that you scrape that part which has been wetted by that fraction is stopped and covered, and filled so that the tongue does not descend or the word is not corrupted.
Capitol .xxxiii.	Chapter .xxxiii.
De restauracio de dentz maugudas am fiel de aur o de argent.	Of the restoration of teeth that are damaged by gold or silver.
Quan accideys a las dentz devant concussio e remossio per percussio o per cazament, e le malaute no pot strenher sobre aquo que manga, e tu has curat aquel am medicinas stipticas, e no ha valgut la tua curacio, lahoras per so que no cagan es engen en aquelas que sian strengudas am fiel de aur e no de argent, quar argent se fa vert e aprop se poyreys aprop alscus dias, mays aur nul temps no es mudat.	When accidents occur to the teeth due to impact or fall, and the patient cannot bear it, and you have treated them with hemostatic medicines, and your treatment has not been effective, then in order that they do not rot in those that are strong by gold and not by silver, because silver turns yellow and becomes porous over time, but gold never changes.
E sia le fiel en tal subtilitat e grocesa segon la quantitat que puesca entrar entre las dentz; e la forma de la reccio es que prenguas le fiel e pren lo doble de lu entre doas dentz sanas, e aprop que cresques am doas tortuositatz del fiel entre doas maugudas, o si’ una o motas, entro que pervengua la tela a la dent sana del autra partida.	And if the bone is so thin and grooved according to the amount that could enter between the teeth; and the form of the reaming is that you take the bone and take double of it between two healthy teeth, and approach that it increases am two twists of the bone between two dirty ones, or if one or more, until the thread reaches the healthy tooth of the other part.
E aprop itera le teyssiment entro a la partida de la qual comenciest, e strenh la tua ma am facilitat e savieza entro que no sia mauguda.	And approach the tying inside the part where you began, and strengthen your hand with ease and knowledge until it is not dirty.
E sia la tua striccio am la qual strenhas le fiel deves las razitz de las dentz que no evasesca.	And your tie should be the one that strengthens the bone from the roots of the teeth that do not escape.
E aprop inscindeys las extramitatz del fiel superfluens am las forceps o tosoyras, e agregua aquelas en quascun loc am gesti, e converteys aquelas e las occulta entre la dent sana e la dent mauguda, per so que no fassa lesio a la lengua.	And approach the excess parts of the bone with forceps or tweezers, and add those in each place with gesture, and convert them into those and hide them between the healthy tooth and the dirty one, so that it does not cause damage to the tongue.
E aprop leyssa aquela ayssi streyta cum roman.	And leave that which is so tight as to be Roman.
Mays si es desliada o rumpuda, strenh aquela o aquelas am autra fiel en tal manieyra en tot son temps.	If it is loose or broken, strengthen that or those with another bone in such a way that they are all in their time.
E aquesta es la forma de las dentz e la figura de la rectacio de doas dentz sanas e de doas maugudas, ayssi cum vezes aquestas liadas:	This is the form of healthy teeth and the figure of straight teeth, such as these often are:
E quan se fa que retorno una dent o doas aprop le cazement de quascuna en lors locs, e sian recrescutz ayssi cum havem recomtat, e que remauguan.	And when a tooth or teeth return to their proper place in the mouth, and are restored as we have recommended, and remain so.
E no fa aquo sino bo artifexs e savi.	Only skilled craftsmen and wise people can do this.
E alcunas veguadas es aptat alcuna causa dels osses de vaca, e es fayt de lor ayssi cum forma de dent, e es pausada en loc en le qual defayl la dent, e es strengit ayssi cum havem dit, e reman e serveys am aquel per lonc temps.	Some people are prone to certain bone conditions of cows, and it is made from them in the form of teeth, and placed in the location where the tooth is missing, and strengthened as we have said, and remains there for a long time.
Capitol .xxxiv.	Chapter 34.
De inscizio del liament le qual ve en la lengua e prohibeys loquela.	About the beginning of the ligament that is in the tongue and prevents speech.
Aquest liguament le qual ve dejos la lengua alcunas veguadas o es natural am le qual hom nays, o accidental e accideys per plagua la qual ja es consolidada.	This ligament that is located behind the tongue in some people or is natural to them, or accidental and occurs due to a wound that has already healed.
E la operacio en lu es que huobres la boca del malaute, le sieu cap existent en le tieu se; e eleva la sieua lengua, e aprop inscideys aquel liament nervos segon la latitut entro que sia solvuda la lengua de la sua recencio.	The operation involves opening the mouth of the patient, removing the existing cap from the tooth; and elevating their tongue, and then inserting that nerve ligament according to the latitude before the tongue is re-established in its original position.
Mays si en aquela es alcuna duricia o denodacio, e aquo es stat per consolidacio de plagua, lahoras tu gieta unci e scindeys aquel per la latitut entro que aias inscindit le liament e sia dissolvuda la nodacio.	If there is any difficulty or stiffness in that area, and this is due to the consolidation of a plague, then you should apply pressure and cut it through the width until it is torn and the stiffness is dissolved.
E guarda te que no sia fayta fissura en le preon de la carn e que scindas aqui arceria e vengua flux de sanc.	And be careful not to make a cut in the flesh and that you do not tear the muscle here and cause bleeding of the sinews.
E aprop sia lavat le vestigi de la inscisio am ayguaros o am vi agre o am aygua frega; e aprop pausa dejos la lengua licini; so es meca la qual tengua le malaute dejos la lengua en quascuna nuoyt per so que no sia consolidat autra veguada.	And then wash the footprints of the incision with warm water or vinegar or warm water; and place your hand over the tongue to prevent it from being consolidated again.
Mays si accideys flux de sanc, pausa sobre le loc vetriol trissat; mays si le sanc ventz, lahoras cauteriza le loc am cauteri lantiginos le qual conveneys ad aquo.	If bleeding occurs, place your hand over the wound; if the sinew is torn, then cauterize the area with a pointed cautery that is suitable for this.
E aprop aquel cura am las autras causas entro que sia sanat.	And then apply the other remedies until it is healed.
Capitol .xxxv.	Chapter 35.
De extraccio de ranula dejos la lengua.	On the extraction of a ranula from the tongue.
Alcunas veguadas accideys dejos la lengua apostema asemblant a nomla petita prohibent la lengua de la sua operacio natural; e fort leu es magnificada entro que huempla la boca.	Some tongue swellings occur before the tongue, resembling a small pimple that prevents the tongue from performing its natural operation; and if it is not filled with the mouth, it becomes magnified.
E la operacio en lu es que huebras la boca del malaute sesent devant le solel e considera le apostema.	And the operation in this case is to open the mouth of the patient facing the sun and consider the abscess.
E si tu le vezes de fusca color o de negra, dur, al qual le malaute no atroba sentiment, lahoras no toques aquel quar es cranc.	And if you see it of dark or black color, hard and without sensation, then do not touch that which is cranial.
E si es declinat a blancor, en le qual es humiditat, lahoras tu met le onci en lu, e inscideys aquel am spatum subtil, e inscindeys le de tota partida; e si sanc te ventz en la hora de la tua operacio, lahoras tu pausa desus zegi trissat, so es vetriol, entro que sia restreyt le sanc.	And if it is declined to whiteness, in which there is moisture, then you put the sponge in it, and insert a sharp needle under it, and cut it from all parts; and if the pus ventures out during your operation, then pause above the three fingers, it is vinegar, until it is restricted.
E aprop retorna a la obra tua entro que lo haias trayt am compliment de lu, entro que sia lavat am vi agre e sal; e cura aquel am l’autra curacio ad aquo entro que sia sanat.	And then return to your work until you have completed it, until it is washed with vinegar and salt; and cure that one with the other cure at that time until it is healed.
Capitol .xxxvi.	Chapter 36
De extraccio de apostema de doas aurelhas e de aquel que es nada en le golayro e de las autras apostemas.	Of the extraction of abscesses from the armpits and from those that are in the groin and of other abscesses.
Quan endeveno en le golayro godat, so son glandulas las quals son asembladas algodat, las quals accideysso deforas e son nompnadas doas aurelhas, las quals quan tu las curas am aquo que havem dit en la divisio e no es sanat, lahoras tu considera si le apostema es dur, de fusca color, de pauc sentiment, lahoras no toques aquel am ferr.	When an abscess occurs in the groin, they are glands that resemble wool, which are deformed and called armpits, which when you cure them with what we have said in the division and are not healed, then you consider whether the abscess is hard, of dark color, and little pain, then do not touch it with a knife.
E si es de roga color e la razic es grossa, lahoras no toques aquela am ferr per le flux del sanc; abantz layssa aquel entro sia madurat, e lahoras o tu trauqueras aquel, o sira romput per si.	And if it is of red color and the pus is thick, then do not touch it with a knife because of the risk of infection; leave that inside to mature, and then you either rupture it or let it break by itself.
E si es de blanqua color, radon, e la razit de lu es subtil, lahoras aquel es que cove esser inscidit.	And if it is of white color, clear, and the pus of it is thin, then that should be incised.

E sia fayt de argent o de aram, e sia subtil cum cotel.	And it should be made of silver or aram, and thin like a knife.
Donc cum tu premes am aquel la lengua e es mostrat a tu la apostema, e catz sobre aquel le tieu vezement, lahoras pren onci e fica aquel en l’amenla, e tira aquel a las partidas defora tant quant podes.	Then, when you press the tongue and it shows you the abscess, and catches the pus on that, then take out the cotton and put that in the wound, and pull it from the sides as much as possible.
Otra aquo que tiras alcuna causa de las tunicas, e aprop incideys aquela am instrument del qual aquesta es la forma:	Another thing that you pull from the causes of the tunic, and then approach the incision with this instrument of which this is the shape:
e es asemblat a forceps, empero las extramitatz de lu son corvadas, ayssi que l’orrifici de quascuna de aquelas es en le endreyt del autra, mot agudas, le qual sia de ferr indi enbegut.	and it is similar to forceps, but the outer parts of which are bent, so that the opening of each of those is at the end of the other, so sharp, which should be made of iron and thin.
Mays si aquest instrument no es a tu present, lahoras inscideys aquel am spatum del qual aquesta es la forma de lu: E sia agut de la una part, no agut del autra part.	However, if this instrument is not at your disposal, then approach the incision with this space of which this is the shape of it: And it should be sharp on one side, not sharp on the other side.

Mays si endeve flux de sanc, guarguarise aygua de decoccio de scorsa de milgrana o de fuelha de mirtra e semblantz ad aquel de las causas stiptiquas entro que·l flux del sanc sia restreyt, e aprop cura aquel entro que sia sanat.	If the patient has diarrhea, guard against water from the decoction of senna or of figs and similar to those of the astringent causes that restrict the flow of the diarrhea, and cure it within that time.

And sometimes in the gullet others are pustules or those two wounds, and insert them second by second as I said at the beginning of these two honeyed remedies equally.

And you have already treated a woman with an abscess that was not in her gullet, the abscess tended to a dark color, of little pain, which had already closed her gullet, and the woman was breathing very straight, and had already prohibited her from eating and drinking water, and had already reached death if more days passed.

So you made an incision carefully and inserted it into one of the openings, and pulled that out, and poured a large portion of it from there, and then you inserted it into another opening, and closed the mouth of it, and pressed her tongue, and then you inserted the other incision into that abscess.
E aprop yeu abscizi gran partida de lu, e no corria de lu sino un pauc de sanc.	And then you should bring a large amount of blood from him, but do not let any of it run out.

Therefore, the absolute cure for that woman, and as soon as she begins to vomit, immediately administer food, and do not cease to incise that abscess with an old knife for a long time, until another abscess forms in its place, which should be incised before it is prolonged.

Capitol .xxxvii.	Chapter 37.
De inscizio de huvela quan es apostemada.	On the incision of a wound when it becomes abscessed.
Quan catarr deysen a la huvula, e es apostemada e es longa, lahoras ela es nompnada perpendicular; e si es en la partida dejos grossa e redonda, e lahoras ela es apelada buba.	When the catarrh (mucus) descends to the wound, and it becomes abscessed and long, then it is not called perpendicular; and if it is in the part that is thick and round, then it is called a bubble.
Mays quan es curada am aquo que havem dit en la divisio, e no comfereys la tua curacio, e eyssament ja vezes que apostema caut ja es ostat de lu e es subtil, lahoras cove que tu inscidas aquela que es agreguadas redonda; e si es ad aquela longitut, e es sanguina, de fusca color o de negre, e no es a lu centiment, lahoras cove que tu temtes la inscizio de lu, quar en aquela es temor sobre le malaute.	When the wound is cured with the remedy we have mentioned in the division, and you do not compare your cure, and if you see that the abscess has already disappeared from the wound and is thin, then you should incise that which has accumulated around it; and if it is at a distance, and is bloody, of a dark color or black, and is not on the surface, then you should make an incision in the wound, where there is fear over the patient.
E quan tu vezes aquela segon la manieyra que yeu he dita de la sua blancor e longuesa, que tu fassas sezer le malaute e premas la lengua de lu am instrument del qual procesic la sua forma e aprop fica le onci en la nuva, e tira aquela en jos e inscideys aquela am un de dos instrumentz les quals e ditz en la inscizio de dos mellas.	When you see the second rib that I mentioned earlier, which is long and white, you should make an incision on the patient's body and take out their tongue with an instrument that fits its shape, and then place the bone in the new place, and pull the other one down and insert it into one of the two instruments called scissors at the beginning of the chapter.
E cove que no inscidas aquela sino aquo que es ajustat sobre le terme natural ses addicio, quar si tu inscides de lu mays, lediyras le sieu parlar.	And be careful not to insert it any more than what is adjusted to its natural term, because if you insert it too much, you will damage its speech.
E aprop la inscizio, usa de aquo le qual havem recomtat en la inscizio de dos mellas, e cura aquela entro que sia sanat.	And then make the incision with the instrument that we recommended earlier, and heal it while it is still healthy.
Mays si era le malaute espaventat per la inscizio de lu, cove que use de engen en la cauterizacio de lu ses temor, e la manieyra del cauteri en lu no es sino am aygua aguda, e es que tu pauses le cap del malaute en le tieu se, e aprop prem la lengua de lu am le instrument le qual havem dit, e aprop pren de l’aygua la qual havem dita en le capitol de cauterizacio, e comfeys am aquela caus viva, e pausa aquela no spessa ni subtil, e de aquela omple la concavitat de l’estrument del qual aquesta es la forma:	But if the patient is frightened by the incision, then use the instrument in the cauterization of their fear, and the handle of the cautery should only be sharp water, and you should place the patient's head in your lap, and take out their tongue with the instrument that we mentioned earlier, and then take some of the water that we mentioned in the chapter on cauterization, and apply it to the wound while it is still alive, and do not press too hard or too delicately, and fill the hollow of the instrument with this form:
Sia la extramitat de lu conquavitat en la qual sia pausada la medicina ayssi cum la conquavitat de culher de ray, e pausa le strument am la medicina sobre la vula, e·l malaute jagua sobre le sieu latz per so que corro saliva o musellage de la boca de aquel per la intrinscequa medicina, per so que no deyssenda de aquela deguna causa sobre le golayro de lu e que ledesca aquel.	The extramatum of the cavity where the medicine is placed should be like the shape of a spoon, and place the instrument with the medicine on the wound, and the patient turns their head to one side so that saliva or drool from the mouth of the other does not fall on the wound due to the intrinsic medicine, so that it does not cause any harm to the wound.
E aprop te la tua ma am la medicina, e exprem aquela sobre la uvula per l’espazi de miega hora entro que vegas aquela esser denegrada e sedada per la mordicacio de la medicina.	Then place your hand with the medicine on the uvula for a period of time until it becomes denigrated and sedated by the bite of the medicine.
E si vols, prengues coto e envolopes aquel sobre la extremitat del ray, e submergeys le coto en la medicina, e entrometas le ray am le coto en una canula de sobre entro que·l coto adheresca en aquela canula, e fay aquo tantas vetz entro que consiegues aquo que vols de la cauterizacio de la uva, e aprop leyssa aquela quar ela se seccara e cayra aprop tres dias o quatre.	And if you want, take a piece of cloth and wrap it around that end of the needle, and submerge the cloth in the medicine, and insert the needle through the cloth into a canula over which the cloth adheres so that you can achieve the desired cauterization of the wound, and leave it there for three days or four until it dries up.
E si indigeysses que iteras la medicina, itera aquela, e aprop la cauterizacio abstergeys en le circuit de la uva am coto enbegut en boder, e mondifica am aquel aquo que es en le circuit de lu de la medicina, e sia lavat am aygua frega, e sia curat deforo am embrocacio, e dedintz am guarguarismes entro que sia sanat.	And if you need to repeat the medicine, repeat that, and after the cauterization remove it from around the wound with a clean cloth in a circular motion, and change that which is inside the circle of the medicine, and wash it with water, and cure it with a warm compress, and give gargling rinses until it is healed.
E aquesta especia de curacio es pus salva que inscizio e pus long de temor.	This type of treatment is more safe than beginning and longer than fear.
Alcunas veguadas es curada la uvuola am aquo que es pus subtil que cauteri e inscizio, quar es curat am subfumigacio en aquesta manieyra: recipe calament, ysop, origua, ruda, scicados arabic, camamilla, broyda e semblant ad aquels de las erbas, e ajusta totas aquelas causas, o alcunas de lor, en una ola, e sian submergidas am vi agre, e bulhan; e la ola sia be lutada am lut decentment, e sia en le mieg loc de la ola un trauc, sobre le qual sia pausat un instrument conquau de aram segon aquesta manieyra; sia fayt de argent o de aram.	Some wounds are cured with this method that is more subtle than cauterization and begins, which is cured by sublimation in this way: take calament, ysop, origan, ruda, scissored Arabic gum, camomile, borage, and similar to those of the herbs, and adjust all those causes or some of them in a bowl, and they should be submerged in very hot water and boiled; and the bowl should be well washed with decent water, and there should be a hole in the middle of the bowl where an instrument made of aram according to this method should be placed; it should be made of silver or aram.
E sia entromesa la extremitat en la boca del malaute entro que la vapor poge a la uvula sobre la quanula, entro que la uvula sia mot ofuscada.	And if the tip is inserted into the mouth of the patient before the steam reaches the uvula on the throat, before the uvula becomes obscured.
E aprop itera sobre aquela motas veguadas entro qu’es secca, e guarda te que no fassas aquesta curacio al comesament de l’aveniment de apostemas, quar trop ajustaria en le apostema, e no cove que tu fassas aquo, sino deves la declaracio de apostema de lu caut.	And if you repeat this treatment until it dries, and keep in mind that you should not do this treatment at the beginning of the appearance of abscesses, because it would adjust too much to the abscess, and do not let you do this, but declare the declaration of the abscess from there carefully.
Mays si no es a tu present aquest instrument, lahoras pren una cana e compon en la extramitat de lu un clos de huou, per so que la boca del malaute sia comborida, quar le closc del huou prohibeys la vapor comburir la boca.	If you do not have this instrument present, then take a cane and place a cloth of hay on its tip, to prevent the patient's mouth from being suffocated, as the cloth of hay prevents the smoke from burning the mouth.
E aquesta curacio es bona am salut.	And this cure is good for health.
Capitol .xxxviii.	Chapter 38.
De extraccio d’espinas e de aquo que adhereys en le golayro e de las autras causas.	Of the extraction of thorns and of what adheres to the wound and other causes.
Motas veguadas adhereys en le guolayro o spina de peys o alcuna autra causa.	Fragments adhere to the wound or thorn of the foot or some other cause.

And what is not apparent and is hidden in the wound, cover it with the patient vomiting when the food is digested in the stomach, because often the cause attached to the wound is removed by vomit; or that the patient swallowed a bone of bread or a piece of raw meat or a bowl of dry bread; or took a sponge of sea sponge and soaked it well with wine, and then placed it on the patient, because as it passes through the place where thorns and are extracted, it is removed.
E mays pren una anguila e be am fiel liada, e sia dedintz mesa e soptament sia extrayta; o pren un porr e soptament le metas e soptament l’en tratz.	And then take a snake and boil it with a little vinegar, and extract the juice from it; or take a pig's foot and boil it in vinegar, and extract the juice from it.
Mays si no so foro-getatz am aquelas causas las quals havem ditas, lahoras husa de un instrument de plom segon aquesta forma:	If you do not forget those causes that we have mentioned, then use an instrument of this form:
E sia pus gros que ray un petit, e en la extramitat de lu sia conquavitat la qual tu entrometas en la sua guola am facilitat.	And it should be as large as a small finger, and in its extraction, the cavity where you will insert it into the neck to facilitate.
E el aga le sieu cap elevat en sus, e guarda te que·l tocament del sieu os de la gola, per so que endevengua a lu cos e am aquela que enpellesca le os o la spina, o que aquel le metge am la sua ma.	And the hand is raised up to it, and be careful that the touch of its neck bones, so that it does not hurt it or the spine, or what that doctor puts on his hand.
Mays empero que·l malaute aquel entrometa es miels, per la sua sciencia del loc de la causa annexa e enpellisca en jos, e tira la sua ma am le instrument en sus, tot aquo segon la quantitat la qual es a lu preparada entro que sia foro-getada.	But if the patient feels pain from that insertion, because of his knowledge of the location of the cause and what he puts on it, and pulls his hand up with the instrument, all this according to the quantity that is prepared in him before it is forgotten.
Capitol .xxxix.	Chapter 39.
De extraccio de sancguisugua annexsa al golayro.	Of the extraction of blood attached to the liver.
Quan es medicada sanguisugua am aquo que havem dit en la divisio de la curacio am medicinas e no comfereys, considera lahoras en le guolayro del malaute al solelh, pus que tu aias compremuda la lengua de lu am instrument le qual a tu havem recomtat. And if it is not possible to extract it, then take a concave needle and insert it into the patient's abdomen, and place your hand on the concavity of the needle, and hold an ignited iron there (until the attached blood is dead and has come out of the abdomen) and keep the patient from drinking all day.

And then take a full wet cloth and place it in the patient's mouth, and wash the mouth with that; do not let any of that cloth touch any cause and make the patient drink water for an hour, then another on their hand, so that the attached blood feels like water.

If we have not forgotten the remedy we recommended earlier, then currently subfuse the patient with chamomile or asafetida using the instrument we recommended for fumigation of the uvula.
Fay aquo, so en quar cayra.	Do that, in four ways.
E es un’autra manieyra de operacio en sufumiguacio de aquela, es que tu prenguas una ola en la qual sian carbos ignitz e la ola sia cuberta am una cobertora en le mieg de la qual sia un trauc, e sia compausat en aquel trauc la extremitat del instrument; e aprop dega desus la subfumigacio; e pause le malaute la sua boca en la extremitat de la canula, e claugua la sua boca per que la subfumiguacio no sia foro-getada entro que sapias que la subfumigacio es pervenguda a la sancguisugua, quar la sancguisugua tantost cayra.	And another way of operation in fumigation of that is to take an iron rod with burning coals and cover the rod with a cloth in the middle of which there is a hole, and place the end of the instrument in that hole; then remove it from the fumigation; and place the patient's mouth on the end of the canula, and close their mouth so that the fumigation is not lost until you know that the fumigation has reached the lungs, as the lungs quickly absorb.
E si no catz, lahoras tu itera la subfumiguacio motas vetz, e abstengua le malaute de beure, e mange causas saladas e alhs, e no begua aygua, e ayssi necessari es que am aquest regiment sia fora-getada.	And if it does not catheterize, then repeat the fumigation after some time, and prevent the patient from drinking, eating salty and other foods, and not drinking water, and if necessary, this diet should be forgotten.
E aquesta es la forma del instrument am le qual es trayta sancguisugua del guolayro quan es vista; e es semblant a forceps ayssi cum vezes, sino quar es en lu alcuna curvitat:	This is the form of the instrument used to treat gout in the great toe when it appears; and it resembles forceps sometimes, but with some curvature.
le qual sia mesa al guolayro, e la extremitat de lu es semblant a bec de ciconia, que es guanta, en la qual es aspretat de lima, per so quar, quan comprem alcuna causa, aquela no leyssa.	which is placed on the great toe, and its end resembles the beak of a heron, which grips, in which a rasp is attached, so that when a cause is found, it does not let go.
Capitol .xl.	Chapter 40.
En le qual es la suma del sermo en apercio de apostemas e en seccio de lor.	In which is the summary of the speech on the detection and lancing of abscesses.
Les apostemas so motas specias, de motas manieyras, segon que ve rememoracio de lor, de quascuna en aquest libre.	Abscesses are special masses, like other masses, according to the recollection of them, each in this book.
E so diversas en perforacio e seccio de lor per doas manieyras, de las quals la una es per la specia de apostemas en si meteys; e per aquo que comprem de las humiditatz.	And they are different in puncture and incision of them by other means, one of which is for the kind of abscesses that contains pus; and because it understands the moisture.
E la segonda manieyra es prop les locs en les quals accideys del cos, quar le apostema accident en le cap es autra de la apostema accident en le cul; e le apostema en le loc carnos accident es autra del apostema accident en junctura; e a quascun de lor es son juguament per operacio.	And the second method is for the places where the disease occurs in the body, as the abscess on the head is different from the abscess on the buttocks; and the abscess in the flesh is different from the abscess at the joint; and each of them has a suitable treatment.
E mays de apostemas so alcunas las quals cove que no sian perforadas sino aprop maturacio de la sania en aquels o compliment de lor.	And more about abscesses, some of which are not meant to be pierced until they have reached maturity and their fullness.
So autras apostemas les quals cove que sian traucatz quan son cruzes, e no son maturatz segon lor compliment, ayssi cum apostemas que son propdas a las juncturas, quar apostema quan ve prop junctura, lo esser de lu es prolonguat entro que·s poyreys aquo que es en le circuit de lu, e fort leu son corromputz les liamentz o les nervis de aquela junctura, per que es fayta causa de contraccio de aquel membre; o es apostema prop de membre principal, e si tu tardas la perforacio de lu entro sia madurat nosira al membre principal; o es prop le cul, donc perfora aque no-madurat; e no cove que·l perforas cru, de no-complida degestio, sino aquel que es prop del cul, per so que no poyresca le preon de lu e sia elonguat a las partidas dedintz del cul, e sia fayta fistula, o que sia fayt en le terme de lu que no sia sanat.	And other abscesses that are supposed to be punctured when they are crossed, and not matured according to their fullness, just like abscesses that are directed towards joints, if an abscess is approaching a joint, then extend it into the area around it, and often the tendons or nerves of that joint are corrupted, so that it causes contraction of that member; or it is an abscess near a principal member, and if you delay the puncture until it is matured, it will damage the principal member; or it is near the anus, so do not puncture this unmatured one, but rather the one that is directed towards the anus, so that it does not spread to the inside of the abscess and be extended to the parts of the anus, and it should be made a fistula, or what is made in the term of the abscess that is not healed.
Mays cove que tu sapias la hora de la perforacio de la apostema, e aysso es quan es maturat.	May you know the time of the puncture of the abscess, and do it when it is ripe.
E sapias que es madurat quan es la cedacio de la dolor e la cessacio de la febre, e aprop la diminucio de la rogor e de la pulsacio, e la acuitat del cap del apostema, e les autres senhals.	And you know that it is ripe when the pain subsides and the fever ceases, and there is a decrease in the inflammation and pulse, and an increase in the head of the abscess, and other signs.
E quar cove que sapias la perforacio cazer en le loc pus dejos del apostema e de pus venient de curacio de la eminencia.	And you know that the puncture should be made in the place closest to the abscess and from where the pus comes out of the boil.
E perforacio tostemps sia per le lonc de la carn o del cors, si las apostemas son en las partidas de las mas o dels pes, e en loc dels lacertz, de las cordas dels nervis, de las arcerias; e, al derier, en totz locs enguals en les quals no es reflecio; quar en aquels que so reflectitz, usa de perforacio segon aquel membre.	And the puncture should be made quickly through the long bones of the body or the body, if the abscesses are in the joints of the legs or feet, and in the locations of the tendons, of the nerves, of the arches; and at the back, in all equal places where it does not reflect; because in those that reflect, use puncture according to that member.
Mays quan le apostema es en loc carnos, lahoras miels es que leysses la perforacio de lu entro que sia confermada la digestio de lu segon compliment, ayssi quo havem dit; quar si tu perforas aquel denant aquo, es prolonguat le cors del poyre de lu e de mota sordicia, e fort leu las labias de lu so enduradas e la profunditat de lu.	When the abscess is in fleshy places, it is customarily said that you should not make the puncture until it is confirmed that the digestion of it has been completed, as we have said; because if you puncture that one before, it prolongs the suffering of the patient and causes much pain, and very hard labors for him.
Mays alcus apostemas so perforatz segon la latitut de la carn o del cos deves la necessitat, o segon aquo del qual lo membre indigeys.	May it be possible to perforate the abscess according to the size of the flesh or bone, depending on the need, or according to what the member requires.
E cove que administres petita perforacio , e·n les apostemas grans gran perforacio e ampla o motas seccios segon la diversitat de la grandesa dels apostemas.	And if you administer small perforations, and in large abscesses, a wide or deep cut according to the variation of the size of the abscesses.

De seccio sobre apostema le qual accideys en le golayro defora, e es apelat hernia del golayro.	Of the incision on the abscess which occurs in the groin, and is called groin hernia.
Aquest apostema nompnat hernia del golayro es apostema gran segon la color del cors, e es mot en las femnas.	This abscess called groin hernia is an abscess of the second color of the body, and is caused by women.
E es segon dos manieyras, quar o es natural o accidental.	And it is of two kinds, either natural or accidental.
E en le natural no es engen de curar.	And in the natural one there is no need for cure.
E l’accidental es segon dos manieyras del qual la un es semblant a nodes grasses, e l’autra manieyra es semblant apostema le qual es fayt per nodacio de arteria, e en aquel es temor.	And the accidental one is of two kinds, one of which is similar to large nodes, and the other kind is similar to abscess which is caused by artery blockage, and in that there is fear.
E no cove que·s fassa presumpcio a lu cum ferr sino en aquel que es petit.	And do not attempt to make incisions with a knife unless it is small.
E tu proha aquel e investigua aquel am le dit, e si atrobas lu semblant a nodi gras, e no es suspendut am alcuna de las venas, lahoras tu inscideys aquel ayssi cum les nodes, e extratz aquel am aquo que conte lu de la pel e bursiclam; e sino, lahoras es perscrutat tot le sieu esser, e aprop cura le loc am aquo que cove de curacio entro que sia sanat.	And if you find that and investigate it, and if it resembles a gangrenous wound, and is not suspended by any of the veins, then incise it with those that are like the nodes, and extract that which contains the decayed flesh and pus; and if not, then examine the entire area, and apply a dressing where there is a chance of healing before it is healed.
