De seccio de las specias de nodes.	On the separation of the kinds of nodes.
Dels nodes so motas specias e yeu ja he dit totas las specias de lor en la divisio.	Of the nodes, there are various species that I have already mentioned all their kinds in the division.
E cove que yeu recomte assi la diferencia entre node e exitura cum fassa dubitacio.	And you should be aware of the difference between a node and an ulcer when making incisions.
Donc yeu dic que am exitura es caliditat e febre e dolors vehementz entro que es sedada la ebullicio de la superfluitat; e es complida putrefaccio que lahora cessa la febre, la dolor e la calor.	Therefore, you say that an ulcer is characterized by heat, fever, and intense pain until the boiling of the superfluous matter ceases; and it is a putrefaction that stops the fever, the pain, and the heat.
Mays am node no es caliditat ni febre ni dolor, e conte aquel ciphac leon le qual es al u sac propri.	When there is no heat, fever, or pain, count the pulse of that lion which is in its proper place.

E es manieyra de inquisicio de apostemas e de totz nodes, e es que tu prenguas aquest sturment e entromet aquel en le loc pus humit le qual atrobas en le apostema, e tu revolveras les tieus ditz am aquel petit a petit entro que sapias que·l sturment ja ha penetrat la codena. If the current moisture is forgotten, of whatever color it may be, then you scrape it off with a shallow cut as I have mentioned in the other abscesses.
E si del vestigi de l’intromes no hieys humiditat, lahoras sapias que es gras.	And if there is no moisture in the imprints of the insertion, then you know that it is dry.
E secca sobre lu am seccio havent forma de crotz segon aquesta forma:	And you apply a dry cut with this form:
ayssi cum t’e ensenhat, e suspen aquel am oncis, e excorja la codena de tota part am facilitat, e guarda la pel o sac, si podes, sobre aquel e extraguas aquela sania am le node.	as you have been taught, and suspend that one on the hook, and excoriate the codena from all parts to facilitate, and keep the skin or bag over that one and extract that pus from the node.

If the pulse is on the opposite side, or not pulsatil, then you should cover and fill that place with three tinctures that are verdigris and leeches for two days or three until the pain subsides and the inflammation stops; and then return to cutting that which remains to be removed.

Capitol .xlix.	Chapter 49.
De seccio de apostemas que accideysso per arceria o per vena.	Section on the incision of abscesses that occur due to laceration or vein.
Quan arceria es rompuda, e la codena es consolidada la qual es sobre aquela, lahoras motas veguadas accideys apostema E les senhals per les quals es conoguda que imflamacio e apostema sian per la arteria o per vena: quar quan apostema es per arceria es lonc agreguat en le preon del cors; e que quan inpelleysses le apostema am les tieus ditz, sentes en lu quays sia stridor. E aquel que es per vena es redon al manifest del cors.	And the one that is due to vein is located at the back of the body.

And if the abscess is through the section of the vein, then make sure that you have your hand on that which is at your possible distance from the abscess and the section, and then introduce the needle behind the place where you have had your hand, and make it penetrate; and be in that double fold inside where you extract that from the other side, and then tie the abscess with a thread according to what I told you in the limb of grape4 of two parts of two extremities of the thread.
Mays si temes que extraguam le fil, lahoras entromet le fiel am aquela agula dejos tot le apostema deves la inscizio de la agulha primieyra, e strenh les tieus fiels en quatre locs.	If you fear that the thread might break, then insert the trustworthy needle into the entire abscess at the beginning of the first needle, and strengthen the four threads in four places.
Aprop secca le apostema en le mieg loc de lu entro que quan es yssit aquo que es en lu, lahoras tu inscideys la superfluitat de la codena, e layssa aquo que de lu es liat.	Then dry the abscess at the middle part of it until you insert what is inside it, and leave that which is left outside.

And then place your hand on the part that you have immersed in vinegar and oil, and then administer the cure which is made with calendula and tincture until it is healed.
Capitol l del apostema le qual accideys per torcio de nervis.	Chapter L of the abscess that occurs due to twisting of nerves.
Ayssi cum accideys apostema en arceria e en vena, e semblantment accideys apostema en les nervis quan accideys en lor percussio o accideys per trebal superfluable, e per semblantz.	Similarly, when abscesses occur in the joints and veins, and similarly, abscesses occur in the nerves when they occur due to their impact or excessive work, and similarly.
E es fayt le mays de lu en les locs dels adjutoris o del talo, o en tot loc en le qual so maugudas las juncturas.	And it is made in the most suitable place for the helper or the talon, or in any place where the joints are not affected.
E es apostema greu, e es asemblat a la color del autre cors, e es en las majors de lu disposicios ses de lor e quan es streyt am vehementia, sent en lu le malaute semblant stupor.	And if it is an abscess that is large and similar in color to the other parts of the body, and it is located in the major joints, and when it is stretched with violence, the patient feels pain similar to that of stupor.
E no es apostema agreguat en le preon del cors, e per so es dejos la codena, e el es maugut a tota partida e no va a las partidas denant ni detras.	And if it is not an abscess attached to the front of the body, and for this reason it is left alone, and it is painful all over and does not go to the parts in front or behind.
Donc aquo de aquels que es en las juncturas no cove que sia envasit am ferr, quar fort leu endevenguera contracio.	Therefore, for those who are in the joints, it is not recommended to be pierced with iron, because it would easily cause contraction.
Mays aquel que es en le cap o en le front fen la codena am spatum.	But if it is in the head or forehead, it should be left alone.
Mays si es apostema pauc, lahoras te aquel am les forfecs e abscindeys aquel de razitz.	But if it is a small abscess, then do so with the forceps and remove that from the root.

Capitol .lii.	Chapter 52
De curacio de eminencia del umbilic.	Of the cure of an abdominal hernia.
Eminencia del umbilic es fayta per motas causas; o per fissuras del ciphac le qual es sobre le ventre, e yeys de lu la tela o budel segon que endeve en las autras rupturas; o per sanc le qual flueys de vena o de arceria segon que es denant dit, o per ventositat coarctada en lu.	An abdominal hernia is caused by various reasons; either by fissures in the navel which is on the abdomen, and through which the intestine or hernia protrudes as it does in other ruptures; or by a weakness which allows blood vessels or arteries to protrude as it is called; or by tightness in the abdomen.
Mays si es per fissura del ciphac e per yssiment de la tela, lahoras la color del apostema es semblant a la color del cors; e es leon ses dolor, e aprop appar de divers situament.	If it is caused by a fissure in the navel and protrusion of the intestine, then the color of the abscess is similar to that of the body; and the pain is sharp, and its appearance varies in different positions.
E si es per egressio del budel, lahoras le situament de aquel am lu de aquo que havem recontat, de mays vehement diversitat, e cum tu premes aquel am les tieus ditz es occultat, e aprop retorna; e fort leu es am lu so, e es magnificat mot deves le introt de banh e vehement trebalh.	And if it is caused by protrusion of the intestine, then its position is different from that of the body we have mentioned, with greater diversity, and as you press on it, it becomes hidden, and returns; and often it is in the same place, and is a sign of great difficulty to introduce it back, and causes great labor.
Mays si per humiditat, lahoras es leon e no es occultat quan premes am la tua ma, ni es constrengut, ni es cregut.	If it is caused by moisture, then the pain is sharp and does not disappear when you press on the abdomen, nor is it tightened or hardened.
E si es per sanc, lahoras am aquestz senhals apareys le apostema a negror declinant.	And if it is for suppuration, then apply these signs to the abscess to make it decline gradually.
Mays si es per carn nada, lahoras es apostema greu, gros e dur, e es ficat segon una quantitat.	But if it is for flesh, then the abscess is large, heavy, and hard, and it remains in place for a certain amount of time.
Mays si es per ventositat, lahoras le tocament de lu es leon.	But if it is for moisture, then the touch of it is like a lion.
E la operacio en lu es que consideras lahoras si la eminencia de l’umbilic es per sanc de arceria, o de vena, o per ventositat; lahoras cove que sias prohibit de la curacio de lu, quar en aquela es temor e paor ayssi cum t’e ensenhat en le capitol en le qual he dit les apostemas per arceria e per vena.	And the operation in it is that you consider whether the prominence of the navel is due to suppuration from an arc, or from a vein, or from moisture; therefore, it is prohibited from the treatment of it, because in that case there is fear and fear as you have been taught in the chapter where he has said about abscesses from an arc and from a vein.

And if the prominence of the navel is due to the intestine or the hernia, then command the patient to hold their own hand, and be standing extended; and then apply a tent around the entire umbilicus, and command that it be held between your hands on the patient's belly, and then wrap the space around the umbilicus over the place where you have well placed the tent; and then extend the margin of the abscess to the parts above the ankle; and then apply a firm or soft bandage and the method of tying the bandage.
E aprop huebre le mieg del apostema extendut sobre le liament e intromet le dit tieu en aquel indic e quereys le budel; e si tu l’as atrobat ni guardat per le liament, lahoras tu extratz alxorati e impelleys le budel a las partidas dedintz del ventre.	And then approach the pus that has spread over the wound and insert the pointed instrument into that place and try to push the intestine back; and if you have not done this before or have not guarded it through the wound, then you extract the pus and push the intestine towards the parts inside the abdomen.
E si has atrobada la tela, lahoras pren aquel am unci; e inscideys las superfluitatz de lu.	And if you have found the skin, then take that one and scrape off its excess parts.
Mays si es contraria a tu arceria o vena, lahoras circunda aquel mot, e aprop retorna a la tua operacio; e pren dos agulhas e met en aquelas dos fiels fortz e entromet dos agulhas en le circuit le qual has feyt entorn le apostema en manieyra de crotz, las quals fassas penetrar; e aprop strenh le apostema en quatre partidas sobre las agulhas.	But if it is against your incision or vein, then circle that part and return to your operation; and take two needles and insert them strongly into those two fields and push two needles around the wound in a crisscross manner, which you make penetrate; and then strengthen the abscess in four parts over the needles.
E si tu vols, osta las agulhas e leyssa le loc entro que poyresca la carn extenduda e caia per si; o inscideys aquel quan es subtiliat e se poyreys, e aprop cura aquel am aquo que cove dels enguentz entro que sia sanat.	And if you want, remove the needles and leave them inside the place where the flesh extends and falls down; or scrape off that part which is thin and can be removed, and then care for that wound which covers the mouth and heal it before it becomes infected.

And at the tip of the instrument, there is a ring, which when the instrument reaches the water, it is slightly raised over the instrument, and then evacuate the water in small quantities, because if you evacuate too much at once, the patient may die from the resolution of their spirit animal, or an accident may occur to them.

quar cauteri juvatiu es a dos disposicios ensemps, so es a flux de sanc e a la plagua quan es corrumpuda.	where the curved cautery is applied at two positions simultaneously, to stop intestinal bleeding and to the wound when it is corrupted.

E aprop sia curat am vi stiptic entro que sia consolidat.	And then apply a styptic to stop the bleeding once it has been consolidated.
Capitol .lvii.	Chapter LVII.
De mundificacio dels enfants e de la curacio de aquo que accideys ad aquels de circumcisio.	About the cleaning of children and the treatment of what happens to those who are circumcised.
Circumcisio no es solucio de continuitat ayssi cum las autras plaguas: mays empero cum sia de la nostra operacio e de nostra voluntat, e lus de aquela sia propriament en les enfants, es necessari que asignem en aquela milhor operacio e via pus leugiera perdusent a salut.	Circumcision is not a solution for continence as with other plagues: nevertheless, since it is of our operation and our will, and it is properly in children, it is necessary to assign in that better operation and via pus the lesser peril to salvation.
Donc dic que les antics no diyssero circumcisio en alcu dels lors libres, quar no n’usan en las suas leys, e no es sino quar havem aquisit per speriment, la qual causa es que yeu he atrobat la major partida dels artifexs e dels barbies usar circumcisir e mundificacio am novacula e am torores; e usan de liament am fiel e de inscizio am la ungla.	Therefore, it is said that the ancients did not practice circumcision in any of those free times, because they do not use it in their laws, and it is only because we have acquired by experience, which is the reason why I have found the greater part of the artisans and barbers to use circumcision and cleaning with a razor and with a file; and they use a brush with hair and with an ingot.
E yeu ja he prohadas totas aquestas manieras e no atrobegui milhor mondificacio am forfexs, am liament am fiel que en mondificacio cum la ungla, quar motas vetz efugeys la codena pus desus, quar la codena del prepucii a dos tunicas, e roman la tonica pus dejos, e fort leu es forsat ad autra inscizio e dolor sicura.	And I have already practiced all these methods and no better method has been found with forceps, with a loop, or a hook that can remove the foreskin underneath, where the foreskin is attached to two layers of skin, and the layer on top is removed, and for some people it is necessary to start from another incision and cause certain pain.
E am mundificacio le qual es fayta per alphecati, e es digital, del qual usan les sabatiers, no es segurada la inscizio de la extremitat del membre viril, quar fort leu intra en le trau de lu.	And the method that is done with a scalpel, and it is digital, of which blacksmiths use, it is not safe to make the incision at the end of the male member, because it can easily enter into its cavity.
Mays en la operacio am ungla, fort leu obazeys ferr e corromp la tua operacio.	In the operation, do not use a hook, as it can easily damage your surgical instruments.
E la codena del enfant es breu per natura, e motas veguadas nays en tal manieyra que no ha necessitat de mondificacio, e yeu he vist aquel.	The foreskin of the child is short by nature, and it can be stretched in such a way that it does not require circumcision, and I have seen such cases.
Mays de la mondificacio que·s fa am forfexs e liamentz am fiel, la bontat, experiment descrobic a mi, quar las forfexs so de proporcional inscizio, per aquo quar la acuitat que es desus es ayssi cum la acuitat que es dejos; e donc cum tu premes la tua ma so proporcionadas dos acuitatz, e inscideysso segon una comperacio en un temps; e es fayta compressio del fiel am figura contenent la codena de la vergua de tota partida, am le qual no catz error de tot.	Avoid the circumcision that is done with forceps, with a loop, or a hook, as I have experienced it myself, because the forceps do not make a proportional incision, so the sharpness above is equal to the sharpness below; and therefore when you place your hand on the area, both sharpnesses are proportioned, and the incision is made in one go; and it is a compression of the foreskin that contains the foreskin of the penis in its entirety, and does not make any mistake.
E la manieyra de la operacio primeyra es que tu fassas estar le enfant majorment si es de aquels que entendo un petit, que no fassas sino que tu lies le fiel en la sua vergua tant solament, e que leysses aquel entro al autra dia.	And the first step in the operation is that you should make the child as comfortable as possible, especially if it is one of those who understands only a little, and do not make them lie on their side, but rather lie them down on their back, and let them enter the other day.
E aprop fay aquel alegrar en tota aquela manieyra que es a tu possibla de aquo que recep la sua intelligencia.	And then do everything possible to make that child happy in every way that receives their understanding.
E aprop fa aquel estar entre las tuas mas estatuir preparadament, e no sia ges cezent; e occulta las forfexs en la tua ma o dejos le tieu pe, que l’enfant no veia aquelas ni degun autre dels instruments.	And then make that child as comfortable as possible, and not too close; and hide the forceps in your hand or behind their foot, so that the child does not see those or any other instruments.

And then place your hand on their back and blow into the mouth, and pull out whatever is inside the throat, and modify that which is added to it from deafness.
E aprop lia le loc signat am fiel dobla, e aprop ligua pus bas de aquel un petit le segon liament, e aprop te am le dit pous e endic tieu le loc del liament dejos am bona retencio, e inscideys entre dos liaments.	And then tie the place where the wound is located with a double thread, and then place a small second bandage under that one, and then pull the end of the thread through the wound and insert it between the two bandages.

And then elevate the head slightly and remove the cap of the bed; and then apply leeches little by little, which is better; and place powder on top of the powder and cover it with a cloth in which is spread a plaster of mustard mixed with honey and rose oil recently boiled; and apply that to the other side; and cure that with the cure until it is healed.
La forma de las forfexs a mondificacio, aquesta es la forma:	This is the shape of the forceps for extraction:

The two prongs should not be sharp and the other two should be sharp, so that the tip of the hook does not damage the intestine, and the length of the blades should be equal to the length of two fingers.

Capitol .lviii.	Chapter 58.
De curacio de urina retenguda en la vesiqua.	Of the cure of urine retained in the bladder.
Retencio de urina en la vesica es fayta per oppulacio fayta per peyra o per sanc congilat, o per poyre o per carnada, e semblantz ad aquels de aquo que havem dit de las manieyras de curacio en la divisio. Then suck the urine from the siringua through the border and into a container of water.

And then introduce the catheter to facilitate its passage until it reaches the tip of the wound; and then bend the catheter upwards to the part of the abdomen; and then push the catheter into that, and then push it until it reaches the bladder, and then insert it into the patient's body, and then remove it if the patient is not in pain, otherwise leave it in place.

Capitol .lx.	Chapter 60.
De extraccio de peyra.	About the extraction of a stone.
Nos ja havem dit en la divisio las specias de peyra e curacio de lu am medicinas, e la diferencia entre peyra engendrada en los ronhos e peyra engendrada en la vesica, e les senhals de aquela. E la peyra engendrada en la vesica propriament es aquela que es ficada en la vesica.	The stone that forms in the bladder itself is the one that gets stuck in the bladder.
E yeu so narrant aquel am exposicio manifesta e abreviacio.	And you will hear about those that are exposed and abbreviated.

E si no catz de tot dejos le tieu tocament, lahoras cove que tu untes am oli le tieu dit indic de la ma sinistra, si malaute es enfant, o le dit miga si es jove complit, e entrometas aquel en le sieu cul.	And if you do not catch all of the stone from the left side, then place your left hand on the patient's right shoulder, if the patient is a child, or the right hand if they are an adult, and insert that into their buttocks.

e scindeys en lu aquo que es entre·l cul e·ls genetius, no en le mieg loc, abantz al latz de la coyssa sinistra; e sia la seccio sobre aquela peyra e·l tieu dit sia en le cul, e sia fayta seccio transversa, per que la seccio defora sia ampla e dedintz streyta segon la quantitat que egrecio de la peyra sia a lu possibla, e no major, quar fort leu comprem le tieu dit le qual es en le cul la peyra deves la seccio, e es foro-getada ses defacultat.	And split in that which is between the anus and the genitals, not in the middle, but towards the left side of the cushion; and let the section be over that stone and the tool placed in the anus, and make a transverse section, so that the deformed section is wide and narrow according to the amount that the stone is possible to be in the tool, and not more, because it is very important that the tool placed in the anus is not forgotten and its deficiencies.
E sapias que de la peyra es alcuna a la qual so angle e margers, per que le eyssiment de lu es fayt deficil per aquo.	And know that there is a stone from which some angles and edges are, so that the issue of it is made difficult by that.
E de aquela aquo es leon semblant a glan, e es redonda, e es fayt de lu leugier eyssiment.	And from that which is like a lion's claw, round, and made of the same difficult issue.
Donc si es aquela al qual so angles e marger, ajusta en la fissura.	Therefore, if it is to that which has angles and edges, adjust in the fissure.
E si no es ayssi foro-getada, lahoras cove que tu engenes sobre aquel, o que strenguas sobre aquel am gesti decentment, la extremitat del qual sia ayssi cum lima am le qual strenguas sobre la peyra, e no evasesca de lu; o que entrometas dejos lu instrument subtil de curvada extremitat.	And if it is not forgotten, then cover that you engage over that, or that you strain over that with a decent gesture of the end of which is like a razor, and does not escape from it; or that you insert behind it the subtle instrument of curved end.
Mays si tu no podes sobre aquel, lahoras tu amplifica le trauc un petit, e si tu veus flux de sanc, abscindeys en strenh aquel am vitriol trissat.	If you cannot reach that one, then slightly widen the wound a little, and if you want to stop bleeding, cut a strong thread with this three-cornered vitriol.
Mays si la peyra es mays de una, lahoras al comensament tu impelleys la ma a la boca de la vesica, e aprop inscideys sobre lu; e aprop impelleys un petit aprop aquo; e semblantment fay si son motas mays de doas.	If the stone is larger than one, then at first push the hand into the mouth of the bladder, and then insert it inside; and then insert a little more of that same thing; and similarly do if they are more than two.
E si es peyra mot gran, lahoras ignorancia es que tu inscidas aquel am gran seccio, quar accideys al malaute una de doas causas: o que mora o que endevengua a lu destillacio de urina continuabla, per aquo quar le loc no es de tot consolidat.	And if the stone is very large, it is customarily known that you insert this great section, which causes one of two things to happen to the patient: either he dies or he becomes unable to urinate continuously, because the place is not completely solidified.
Mays aministra expulcio de lu entro que sia fora-getada, o engenia en la fractura de lu am las forfexs entro que extragua aquela en pessas.	If you administer the expulsion of it before it is completely forgotten, or if you insert it into the fracture of that one with the forceps before it is extracted in pieces.
Donc cum tu auras cumplit la tua opperacio, lahoras omple la plagua de enses de aloe e de sanc de drago, e strenh aquel.	Then when you have completed your operation, then fill the wound with gauze of aloe and dragon's blood, and strengthen that one.
E pausa sobre aquel drap enfus en oli e vi, o en oli rozat e aygua frega, per so que apostema caut sia cedat.	Pause over that cloth soaked in oil or rose oil and water-soaked, to prevent the abscess from being too painful.
E aprop resupina le malaute sobre le sieu col, e no deslias le liament entro al tertz dia.	Then place the patient on their back on the couch, and do not let the bandage come off for three days.
E cum aquel auras desliat, embroca le loc am aygua e mot oli, e aprop cura aquel am enguent diafinicon e am enguent diabazilicon entro que sia sanat.	When those auscultations are over, apply hot water and oil to the affected area, and cure it with an ointment made of honey and a poisonous plant until it is healed.
Mays si en la plagua accideys apostema caut, adhust e corrosiu, e de aquel semblantz ayssi cum si le sanc es en la vesica congelat, e per lu es la hurina prohibida (e aquo es conogut per la egressio del sanc am urina), a donc entromet lo tieu dit en la plagua e extratz aquel sanc, quar si roman provoca la vesica a corropcio de la vesica e de lu putrefaccio. E aprop lava la plagua am vi agre, aygua e sal, e am opposicio a tota specia, am aquo que conveneys a lu de la curacio entro que sia sanat.	Then wash the wound with warm water and vinegar, and with all the ingredients that are suitable for its healing until it is healed.
E cove en las horas de tota la curacio que tu lies amdos las coyssas e ajustes las medicinas las quals so pausadas sobre le loc.	And cover all the hours of the patient's treatment, adjusting the medications placed on the area.
E si la peyra es petita e es en le meat de la vergua, e es ficat en lu, e eyssement de urina es prohibit, lahoras cura aquel am aquo que yeu recomti denant que pervenguas a seccio, quar tropas veguadas per aquesta curacio yest acusat de seccio; e ja yeu e esproat aquo, e es que tu prenguas un perforador de ferr alfelut, del qual aquesta es la forma de lu:	And if the stone is small and located in the middle of the urethra, and it is stuck there, and urination is prohibited, then cure that which I previously recommended to reach the point where many troops are said to be successful in this treatment; and I have already done so, and now you should take a needle made of iron, of which this is its form:
de triangulada extramitat, agut, ficat en fust.	of triangular shape, sharp, fixed in wood.
E aprop pren fiel, e lia am aquel la vergua dejos la peyra per so que no retorne a la vesica.	And then take a thin, and place that urethra behind the stone to prevent it from returning to the bladder.
E aprop entromet le ferr en la vergua, perforant am fecilitat entro que·l perforador vengua ad aquela peyra.	And then insert the iron into the urethra, perforating until the needle reaches that stone.
E revolveys le perforador am la tua ma en aquela peyra petit a petit, e tu perforsa la perforacio de lu entro que fassas aquel del autra part penetrar; quar la urina tantost es absolta.	And then rotate the needle in the small stone little by little, and you will perforate that opening until you make the other part penetrate; for urination is immediately released.
E aprop prem la tua ma sobre aquo que es romas de la peyra de la partida deforo de la vergua, quar aquela es trinquada, e es foro-getada am la urina, e le malaute es sanat.	And then place your hand on that spot where the stone of the kidney is located, which is often called the bladder, and is pierced by urine, and the patient is healed.
Mays si aquesta curacio no es a tu aparelhada per alcuna causa la qual prohibeys de aquela, lahoras lia un fiel dejos la peyra, e autra fiel desus la peyra. E aprop encideys sobre la peyra en aquela vergua entre doas liaduras.	And then cut into the stone in that bladder between two grooves.
E aprop extratz aquela.	And then extract it.
E aprop deslia le liament e mondifica le sanc congilat, le qual es fayt en la plagua.	And then remove the membrane and clean the wound with salt, which is done in the wound.
E no es necessari liament de fiel dejos la peyra, sino per que no retorne a la vesica, e l’autre liament desus sino, quar quan es desliat le fiel aprop la egrecio de la peyra, la codena retorna a son loc e cobra la plagua.	It is not necessary to place a true under the stone, but rather to prevent it from returning to the bladder, and the other true above should not be, because when the true is removed from the edge of the stone, the cord returns to its place and causes the wound.

De extraccio de peyra de las femnas.	Of the extraction of kidney stones from women.
Peyra en las femnas pauc es engendrada.	Kidney stones in women are rarely caused.
Mays si ve peyra ad alcuna de aquelas, lahoras dificil es la curacio de lu, e es prohibida per tropas manieyras.	However, if one of those has a kidney stone, its treatment is difficult, and it is prohibited by many hands.
La una de lor es quar la femna fort leu es verges.	One of theirs is that the strong woman gives birth.
E la segonda es quar tu no trobas femna be scient que descroba si meteyssa al metge quan es casta, o es de las femnas haventz maritz.	And the second is that you do not find a woman who is very skilled in describing whether the doctor is casting spells, or has many husbands.

Donc tu sapias quantas specias so de lu per aquo que tu signifiques sobre aquo que vols.	Therefore, you should know how many types there are of that for what you mean by that which you want.

De seccio sobre ernia acoza.	Of incision for hernia.
Hernia ayguoza no es sino agregacio de humiditat en le ciphac blanc lo qual es dejos la codena dels genetius contenent le huou, e es nompnat ciphac.	Hernia is not other than an accumulation of moisture in the white bag that contains the intestines and is called the peritoneum.
E alcunas veguadas es en le propri pannicol le qual a lu preparec natura en la partida del huou, entro que sia cuyat que ja es autre huou; e es la codena del genetiu entre le ciphac blanc le qual havem dit, e no es aquo sino tart.	And some of them are in the same abdominal wall that nature has prepared in the part of the intestine, before it becomes another intestine; and this is the septum between the peritoneum that we have said, and this is not other than a membrane.
E la generacio de aquest hernia es per debelitat la qual accideys als genetius, per que ad aquels es efundunda aquesta materia, e alcunas vetz accideys per percuscio fayta sobre les genetius.	And the generation of this hernia is due to the weakening of the abdominal wall, which occurs in the intestines, so that this matter accumulates in them, and some occur due to a blow caused by an impact on the intestines.
E aquesta humiditat es havent motas colors, quar la color de lu o es declinant a citrina o a sanguinent, o rog, o es negra feculenta, o es ayguosa blanqua, e es aquo que es mays. E les senhals per les quals es saubut on es aquesta agreguacio de aygua so aquestz: quar si es en le ciphac blanc le qual havem dit, lahoras le apostema es redon declinant un pauc a longitut ayssi cum figura de huou, e appar le genetiu, quar la humiditat conte aquel de tota part.	And the symptoms by which one can recognize this aggregation of pus: if it is in the white phlegm that we have called, then the abscess will gradually decline in length, like a figure of a cow, and appear as a genetic, because the humidity comes from all parts.

And if you make the incision straight and equally distant from the line that goes down the groin, until it reaches the white bone that covers the pubic bone.
E excorja aquel, e observa, e guarda te per aysso que tu no inscidas aquel; e la tua excoriacio am la qual aquel excorjas per partida jassia que sia suspenduda am le huou mays e subtilment escruta am la excoriacio segon la quantitat a tu possibla. And then, separate between two labias of the section of the joints, and extend the cautery to the parts above; and do not touch the cord that contains the genitals, and incise the cautery in that way that is possible for you.

And then, incise it to its full extent or in pieces, and more deeply, because if you do not examine the incision carefully, it is not safe that the water will not return.
Mays si le huou procezeys de aquela defora de la sua codena en la ora de la tua operacio, lahoras quan tu auras complida la seccio del ciphac, retorna dedintz aquel, e aprop ajusta las doas labias de la codena dels genetius am sutura, e aprop cura aquel ayssi cum las autras plagua, entro que sia sanat. e es asemblat a letra greca.	and it is shaped like the Greek letter.

De seccio sobre hernia carnosa e la curacio de lu.	About incision over hernia and its treatment.
Sapias que en la seccio sobre aquesta hernia es temor perdusent a pernicia en las majors disposicios; per que a mi es vista la dimissio de lu e esser salvat per aquela milhor. E yeu so rememorant la operacio en aquela e las specias dels apostemas.	And you should remember the operation in that place and the characteristics of the abscesses.
Donc, dic que l‘apostemas natz en les cos dels quals les genetius so conponutz e es fayt aquo per motas causas: o per superfluitat aguda agra, la qual es efundida als genetius, o per percuscio. De la cura de hernia entestinal.	Of the cure of intestinal hernia.

De castracio.	Of castration.
Sapias que castratio en nostre ley es excomengada, mays per causa es legut a mi que·m remembre de lu en aquest libre; e no es necessaria la rememoracio de lu sino per doas manieyras, de las quals es la una per so que aquo sia en la sciensa del metge quan es enterroguat de aquela, que sapia la curacio de lu al qual accideys; e l’autra manieyra es que nos motas vetz havem necessitat de castracio de autras bestias per les juvamentz nostres per aquelas, ayssi cum de motos, e de bocs, e de porcs, e de semblantz a las bestias.	You should know that castration is forbidden in our law, but by cause it is allowed to remember it in this book; and it is not necessary to remember it except for two reasons, one of which is that the physician knows about it when he is questioned about it, who can cure it; and the other reason is that we have had the necessity of castration of other animals for our benefit, such as donkeys, and bulls, and pigs, and similar animals.
E donc dic que castracio es fayta en dos manieyras: o per atrissio, o per fissura a seccio.	And therefore it is said that castration is done in two ways: either by attrition or by incision and section.
Mays en aquela que es fayta per atrissio, la via de la opera es que nos fassam cezer la bestia en aygua cauda entro que·ls genetius de lu sian mollificatz e sian linhitz e que pendan. Capitol .lxxii.	Chapter 72.
De curacio de alratica.	Of the cure of arthritis.
Alratica es que le conh de la femna no sia perforat, o sia le trauc petit.	Arthritis is when the joint of the woman is not broken, or is a small fracture.

Alcunas veguadas son formatz en la mayre un, e dos, e tres, e quatre, e v, e vi, e vii, e mays x, e ja es deves mi verificat que una femna abortem ne getet vi, e una autra x totz formatz, la qual causa fo fayta per mensuracio dels glorios savis. De extraccio del fet quan es mort.	Of extracting the fetus when it is dead.
Quan tu curas le fet mort am aquo que havem dit en la divisio de la medicacio e no es defora eyssit, e tu yest forsat usar de opperacio am ma, lahoras cove que consideras si la femna es de sana vertut e no es am alcu dels accidentz per les quals sobre ela es temuda perdicio.	When you are treating a dead fetus that we have mentioned in the division of medicine and it is not deformed, and you find it suitable to use forceps, then consider whether the woman's health is of good virtue and not affected by any accidents for which she is feared to be lost.
Lahoras cove que la femna sia envessada sobre le lieyt sobre le sieu dos, e sia le cap de lu enclinat enjos e las coyssas de lu sian elevadas.	Then the woman should be placed on her left side, with her head raised and her thighs raised.
E·l ministre tengua aquela de doas partz o sia liada en le lieyt per so que·l cos de lu no se extenda deves la extraccio del fet.	And the assistant should hold her on both sides or be tied on her left side to prevent the uterus from extending and causing difficulty in extracting the fetus.

E locs convenient en aquo: adonc tu considera si le fet es preparat que deysenda sobre le sieu cap, e lahoras tu fique les uncis en les huels de lu, o en le col, o en la boca, o en le palat, o dejos la barba, o en la furcula de lu, o en les locs propdas de las costas, o dejos les ypocondres.	And in the appropriate places: then consider if the patient is prepared to have the needle sent over his head, and then you put the needles in his neck, or on his back, or in his mouth, or in his palate, or under his beard, or on his breastbone, or on the appropriate places of his ribs, or on his hypochondriacs.
Mays si le deysendiment es sobre les pes de lu, lahoras en le pentenilh, o en le mieg de las costas.	If the application is on his feet, then in the arch of his foot, or in the middle of his ribs.
E cove que tengua le unci am la ma dreyta, e pausa la curvitat de lu en aquel loc le qual es entre les ditz de la ma senestra, e entrometa la ma am facilitat e fique le unci en alcu de aquels locs les quals havem ditz, entro que pervengua a la causa boyda.	And you should hold the needle with your hand straight, and bend the curve of his body in that place between the fingers of your other hand, and insert your hand to facilitate and put the needle in any of those places until it reaches the cause of the pain.
E aprop pause e fique en la apposicio de lu un autre unci, o le tertz si es necessitat, per so que sia atraccio engual, e no sia extencio segon la sua rectetut tant solament.	And then place and hold another needle in the appropriate position of his body, or a third if necessary, so that it is attracted equally, and not stretched according to its straightness only.
Ans sia maugut a tota partida, per so que l’eyssiment de lu sia alleujat ayssi cum es fayt en dent deves la eradicacio de lu.	And it should be applied to all parts, so that the application of his body is pleasant as it is done in teeth for its eradication.
E cove en lu aquo que es entre lor que la extencio sia mollificada; e si alcuna partida de lu es retenguda, lahoras cove que la matrona unte alcus sieus ditz am oli e entrometa aquels espertament e revolva am aquels aquo que es retengut.	And cover that area with a warm cloth; if any part of it is held back, then apply the midwife's ointment and insert those experiments and rotate those that are held back.
Donc si la partida del fet es fora-getada, lahoras les uncis sian permudatz entra loc le qual sia pus aut; e fay aysso entro que tot le fet sia fora-getat.	So if the part of the fetus is forgotten, then move your fingers into the space that is most open; and make an incision so that the entire fetus is removed.
Mays si la ma es eyssida denant l’autra, e no es possible reduzir aquela per la coartacio de lu, lahoras cove que drap sia envolopat sobre aquela; e aprop extratz aquela entro que tota sia fora-getada, e inscideys aquela o en la junctura de la ma o en le coyde.	But if the hand is on the other side, and it is not possible to reduce it by the pressure of the intestine, then cover that area with a cloth; and remove it so that everything is removed, and incise it in the joint of the hand or in the cavity.
E ayssi cove que fassas en l’autra ma e en les dos pes.	And make an incision in the other hand and both feet.

And similarly, if the fetus is very large by nature: and then you should insert that hook into the uterus, or take hold of it with the forceps as we have said; and then remove it from the bones.

E si la boca de la mayre es coartada per apostema caut le qual accideys a l’u, lahoras cove que no sia trebelhat sobre lu; abantz cove lahoras aministrar efusio de causas humidas grassas. E cove que non layssas alcuna causa dedintz de la segondina.	And do not leave any cause of decay in the second stage.

E si accideys flux de sanc, lahoras deyssendas en ayguas stipticas e aministra l’autra curacio.	And if there is a flow of pus, then apply stifling waters and administer the other cure.
E yeu ja e vist una femna en le ventre de la qual era fet mort, e aprop sobre aquel foc autra veguada emprenhada, e aprop foc mort es le fet autre.	And I have already seen a woman in the belly of whom was made dead, and then another incision was made, and then the dead fetus was removed.
Accidit al u aprop lonc temps apostema en le sieu embelic; e inflat es entro que foc ubert, e comensec a getar brac.	An abscess occurred in his abdomen; and when it was inflated inside, he began to move his arm.
E yeu fu appelhat a la cura de lu, e medicat a lu per lonc temps, e la plagua no es consolidada.	And I was called for his care, and treated him for a long time, but the wound did not consolidate.
Adonc yeu pausegui sobre lu de alscunas causas emplastra de forta atraccio, e eyssic de lu un os, e aprop passero alcus jorns, e eyssic un autre os; e yeu fu trop meravilhat, cum en le ventre no sia os. Aquesta es la forma de strenhedor en le qual so engualhatz les libres, al qual engualhament sian dos virtitges en doas extremitatz de dos futz.	This is the form of a forceps in which the handles are placed, to which the handles are attached, with two spoons at both ends of two feet.

De extraccio de la segondina.	Of the extraction of the second tooth.

Forma de instrument am le qual la femna es sub-fumiguada deves la retentio de mestruas e de la segondina:	The form of instrument by which the woman is sub-fumigated helps to retain menstruation and prevent miscarriage:

De curacio de las fistulas que endeveno dejos.	For the treatment of fistulas that have occurred previously.
Las fistulas que endeveno en la partida dejos pus bassa so nodacio e grossetut las quals endeveno prop del cul defora o en l’espazi de la una partida.	The fistulas that occur in the lower part of the abdomen and are more numerous, those that occur near the anus or in the space between the buttocks.
E es una fistula o motas.	And if it is a fistula or a fistula.

E si no sentas aquela de tot ni no procezeys del trauc alcuna causa de egestio ni verm ni ventositat, ayssi cum havem dit, lahoras sapias que es no-penetrant, e lahoras coyta te a la curacio.	And if you do not feel that at all or if there is any cause of excretion or worms or turgidity, as we have said, then know that it is not penetrating, and then treat it accordingly.

When the fistula penetrates into the bladder or into the meatus of the urethra, then the meaning of this is that it is urine from that place and prohibition of it so that that location be strengthened by medicine.

De curacio de las plaguas.	Of the treatment of plagues
Yeu ja e dit en la divisio de la curacio de las plaguas aquo que convenia al libre, e yeu dic assi la curacio de aquelas am ma e am medicinas segon le conpliment.	It has already been said in the division of the treatment of plagues that such things were suitable for free people, and thus the treatment of those who are not free is said in this way according to the complement.
Donc dic que las plaguas son diversificadas segon aquo en que son faytas las plaguas e segon le loc sobre le qual cazo las plaquas.	Therefore, it is said that the plagues are diverse according to what they are made of and where they occur.
E las causas per que motas vetz son faytas las plaguas so ayssi cum getament de peyra, o inscisio d’espaza o de cotel, o percussio am lansa, o am fustz, o am sageta, o semblantz ad aquels de motas causas.	And the causes for which certain plagues are made include being caused by a pebble, or an incision with a spit or a dagger, or a blow from a lance, or a stick, or a sword, or similar to those of other causes.
Mays las plaguas que so en les locz del cos so ayssi cum plagua la qual catz sobre le cap, o·l col, o·l pietz, o·l ventre, o·l fitge, e semblantz ad aquels dels membres.	May the plagues that are in the parts of the body include those that catch on the head, or neck, or chest, or abdomen, or thigh, and similar to those of the members.
E yeu so recomtant la curacio de alcunas plaguas per que pauses aquela ratiocinacio e regla sobre las autras plaguas.	And I will recount the treatment of some plagues because of that reasoning and rule over other plagues.
E yeu comensare de las plaguas del cap simplas, quar la rememoracio de las compostas vindra al comensament del tertz capitol.	And I will begin with the simple plagues of the head, as the memory of the composed ones will come at the beginning of the third chapter.
Donc dic que quan accideys en le cap plagua simpla e no es fractura, lahoras considera: si es per getament de peyra o de semblant, e ja ha trinquada la codena tant solament e es gran plagla e temes sobre aquel malaute havinement de apostema caut, lahoras tu te coyta e fleubotoma la cephalica tantost, e no tardas aquo; e extrats ad aquel del sanc segon la quantitat de la vertut de lu si no mes alcuna causa prohibent de fleubotomia, majorment si·l sanc que es eyssit de la plagua es pauc.	Therefore, it is said that when a simple head plague occurs and is not a fracture, if it is due to a stone or something similar, and has only been treated with water for a long time and is large and causes great concern about the patient possibly developing an abscess, then you should immediately apply a lancet to the cephalic vein, and do not delay; and remove as much of it as possible, depending on the amount of its virtue, unless some cause prohibits bleeding, especially if the stone that is left from the plague is small.
E sia la flaubotomia del contrari de la partida plaguada; e guardase le malaute de replecio e de vi e de viandas grossas.	And if bleeding is the opposite of the affected part, then keep the patient away from eating and drinking coarse foods.
Mays si de la minuicio prohibeys alcuna causa, lahoras sia aminorat de la vianda e no apropinque a carn ni a vi.	But if there is some cause that prohibits minor action, then reduce the food and do not approach meat or fish.
E pausa sobre la plagua, si a lu accideys apostema caut, coto enfus en oli rozat solet o en vi en le qual es stipticat.	And if an abscess forms on the plague, apply a poultice of roasted bread or some other stinging substance.
Mays si est segur de apostema caut, lahoras pausa sobre la plagua, si es recent am le sieu sanc e le ayre no ha mudat aquela la polvera la qual yeu recomtare aprop petit.	If you are sure of the abscess, then pause over the wound, if it is recent and its pus and air have not changed to powder, then apply a small amount of the following remedy.
E si le ayre ja ha mudada aquela, lahoras pausa sobre alscus enguentz entro que sia sanada.	And if the air has already changed to pus, then pause over the wound with some healing ointment until it is healed.
Mays si la plagua es gran o es per inscizio d’espaza e de semblantz, e no so ajustadas las labias de lu per puvils, lahoras ajusta aquelas am sutura segon que yeu recomtare de la sutura de lor.	If the wound is large or extends into spaces and is not closed by lips, then adjust those with sutures according to what I will recommend for their sutures.
Mays si la plagua ja es discuberta del os e pen, e no es retencio de lu sino un petit suspensori, lahoras inscideys aquela e aprop cura la plagua am medicinas e restaura la carn aprop en loc de codena, e comanda al malaute que sia pescut de viandas en las quals es groceza: caps e formen coyt e semblantz a lor, entro que sia compost.	If the wound has already been exposed to the bone and flesh, and is not retained by a small suspensor, then insert that and care for the wound with medicines and restore the flesh in its place, and command the patient to eat foods in which there is grease: caps and similar things until it is healed.
E si atrobas en la codena putrefaccio e no adhereys al os, lahoras tu inscideys tot aquo poyrit e geta aquo, e aprop cura aquo.	And if there is putrefaction in the wound and it does not adhere to the bone, then insert all that rottenness and remove it, and care for that.
Mays si en aquestas plaguas es arteria o vena de la qual fluxs de sanc pot evenir, e no es abscindida per medicinas, lahoras tu inquier sobre la arteria, e si atrobas aquela no-inscidida, lahoras tu inscideys aquela am spatum, o lia aquela; e si necessitat te provoca que aquo que havem dit no comfereys, lahoras tu cauteriza entro que·l sanc sia abscidit.	If in these areas there is an artery or vein from which unclean blood can flow, and it is not severed by medicine, then examine the artery, and if you find it unsevered, then incise it with a needle or thread; and if necessity causes that what we have said does not suffice, then cauterize where the unclean blood is being severed.
E si aquestas plaguas son simplas e petitas, lahoras la causa de lor es leugiere; enayssi que tu polverizas sobre aquelas aquesta polvera, quar consolidada aquela denant que l’ayre mude aquelas.	And if these areas are simple and small, then the cause of their simplicity is likely to be leprosy; in any case, powder this powder over those areas, which will consolidate them so that air does not move them.
E la manieyra de la polvera es aquesta: recipe oli de enses partida una, de sanc de drago partida doas, de caus no-extincta partidas tres; sia tot mot trissat e crivellat, e de lu sia la plagua omplida, e sia constrengida per bona constriccio entro que be sobre aquela aderesca, e sia coagulada am le sanc.	The method of the powder is as follows: take one part of broken olive oil, two parts of dragon's blood, and three parts of unextinguished charcoal; grind all of this into a fine powder, and fill the area, and compress it with a good compression so that it adheres to the area and is coagulated by the unclean blood.
E aprop strengeys aquela desus am pulvils e leyssa aquela, e no la deslias mentre esta ayssi que no es apostemada, quar no es eredicada de lu la medicina entro que sia sanada.	Then compress it above with the powders and let it rest there, and do not remove it until it is completely healed, because it cannot be removed by medicine before it is healed.
E alcuna vetz fa aquo sola cautz, quan no es a tu en present enses e sanc de drago.	And sometimes they do that alone, when you are not present and they lack your strength.
E ja fa aquesta meteyssa operacio en las grans plaguas quan conveneys que sia pausada sobre aquelas e sian streytas, e so plaguas recentz am le lor sanc, las quals le ayre no ha alteradas.	And this surgical operation is performed on the large wounds when it is necessary to place it over those and to keep them straight, and their recent wounds are kept clean, which the air has not altered.
E si le ayre las ha alteradas, e majorment quan es en temps d’estiu, lahoras no es entencio a la posicio de aquesta polvera, mays adonc cura aquelas am aquo que havem dit, enayssi que tu pauses sobre aquelas alcus enguents degistius, o que pauses sobre aquelas pols de la farina del ordi am aygua e mel entro que getan poyredura; e aprop cura aquelas am l’autra curacio entro que sian sanadas.	And if the air has altered them, especially in summer, then this powder is not applied to those wounds, but instead use what we have mentioned earlier, unless you place it on those wounds with honey and water mixed together; and then cure those wounds with the other treatment until they are healed.
Mays si accideys am la plagua fractura en os, e es petita, lahoras tu extratz aquo am gesti.	But if an accident occurs and the wound is small, then you remove that which we have mentioned earlier.
E yeu diyre la cura de las fracturas del cap en aquo que es envenidor.	And I will describe the treatment of fractures of the head in this poisonous substance.
De las plaguas del col.	Of the wounds of the neck.
Mays si la plagua accideys en le col, lahoras no es en lu differencia en medicacio, e entre la plagua del cap quan es simpla.	But if the wound occurs on the neck, then it is not in the difference in medicine, and between the wound of the head when it is simple.
Mays si ja le nervi del col es inscis o arteria, lahoras si es nervi, no es en lu engen sino que sia evitada curacio de lu am aquo que fa vehement stipticitat, ayssi cum ziniar e zegi que es vetriol e semblantz a lor quar nozo als nervis e contrazo aquel.	If the nerves of the neck are severed or the artery, then if it is nerves, do not insert them into the engine but rather avoid curative treatment with that which causes strong hemostasis, as well as ziniar and zegi say that it is vetriol and similar to their quar nozo to the nerves and contract it.
E no pauses sobre la plagua alcuna causa de tot freja, quar la sustancia dels nervis es freja e la continuacio de lu es am le cervel, le qual es le pus aut de totz les membres.	And do not place your hand on any cause of the whole forehead, as the substance of the nerves is fragile and its continuation is connected to the brain, which is the most important of all the members.
E si’ aquo am que es curat de medicinas leugieras, ayssi cum es caus lavada am aygua dousa, alcuna veguada enfusa en oli rozat o no-rozat, e thucia quan es lavada am aygua dousa e las autras peyras minarantz segon aquesta manieyra, e enguentz humitz.	And if that which is cured by false medicines, such as washing with warm water, some vinegar in olive oil, rotten or not, and then when it is washed with warm water and the other stones are minimized according to this manner, and found humidity.
Mays si la plagua es gran, lahoras aministra sutura, o coarta las labias de lu, e aprop cura aquela am pulvils entro que sia sanada.	If the wound is large, then administer sutures or cut the lips of it, and then cure that which is inside with powders until it is healed.
Mays si a la plagua es profunditat o accideys en lu a la pus bassa partida poyredura, lahoras perfora aquela en le loc mays depremegut.	If the wound is deep or has accidents in the lowest part of the foot, then pierce it in the most depressed area.
Mays si en la plagua ja es inscisa arteria e es conseguit flux de sanc, lahoras separa o secca aquela, o lia aquela, o cauteriza aquela si necessitat te provoca ad aquo.	If there is an artery cut in the wound and bleeding occurs, then separate or dry that, or tie it, or cauterize it if necessary to prevent further bleeding.
Mays si ja ha insciditz les spondils del golayro o tot, e so salvadas las venas del col, lahoras tu ajusta las labias de la codena am sutura sobre la cana del golayro e no toques aquel; abantz egala aquel e reduzeys aquel sobre la sua figura natural, e aprop strenh aquel am strectura decent, e leyssa aquela per alcus jorns; e aprop cura aquel am enguentz en les quals es stipticitat e excitacio entro que sia sanat.	If the ribs of the chest or all have been cut, and the veins of the neck are saved, then adjust the lips of the wound over the edge of the chest and do not touch that; equalize it with the rest, and strengthen it with a proper structure, and leave it for several days until it is healed.
Mays si la plagua ja en le os a fayta enprecio, lahoras percuireys aquela, e lahoras si en lu ha fragmentz de hos, extratz totz aquels que podes de lor; e aquo que a tu no es apparelhat, leyssa aquo entro que la plagua se poyrisca, e sia separat e la egrecio de lu sia alleujada.	If the wound has already penetrated the bones, then perforate that, and if there are fragments of bone in it, extract all that you can from them; and what is not visible to you, leave it until the wound heals, and let it be separated and the edges of it be brought together.
E si la plagua es recent lahoras polveriza sobre aquela polvera la qual t’e recomtada.	If the wound is recent, then powder it with the powder that was recommended to you.
Mays si en la plagua es fayta fistula, lahoras cura aquela am aquo del qual la rememoracio vindra aprop en le sieu capitol.	But if in the wound a fistula is made, then cure it with the oil that will soon come to its head.
De las plaguas del col o de semblantz quan fayta entre las spallas e es fayta am spaza o am cotel o am lansa o am semblantz.	Of wounds of the neck or similar ones that are made between the ribs and are made with a spatula, a knife, a lancet, or a similar instrument.
Si es percussio de lansa o de cotel, e vezes de lu la profunditat, lahoras considera mays si de la plagua yeys ventositat quan le malaute elena; lahoras sapias que la plagua es mortal.	If it is a percussion of a lancet or knife, and sometimes you see the depth of it, then consider more if the wound has warmth when the patient breathes; then you will know that the wound is mortal.
E si en lu no es profunditat e la plagua es recent am le sieu sanc, lahoras tu pauses en lu de la primieyra horo polvera, e no strenhas aquel per que no sia le sanc retengut en la profunditat de lu e que retorne al cor e que aucigua le malaute, mays pausa en lu enguent atractiu, e deslia aquela doas veguadas le dia.	And if there is no depth in the wound and it is recent to its own sinew, then you place powder on it in the first hour, and do not stretch it so that the sinew is not held in the depth of it and that it returns to the body and that no one hurts the patient, but place a moist dressing on it, and remove those bandages every day.
E si l’enguent no es a tu present, lahoras tu pausa en le orrifici de la plagua coto viel per que sucque aquo que yeys de las humiditatz; e fay que le malaute dorma sobre la plagua per que corra aquo que es en lu ajustat.	And if the mouth is not at your present, then pause in the orifices of the wound to allow the moisture to seep out; and make sure the patient sleeps on their side so that the liquid can drain properly.
Mays si ja de la plagua son passatz tres dias o mays e no accideys al malaute spasme ni tremor de cor mal ni strictura de ale, e vezes las autras dispozicios bonas de lu, lahoras sapias que plagua es salva; e adonc cura aquela am calguas e am l’autra curacio entro que sia sanada.	If the wound has passed three days or more without causing spasm, trembling of the heart, malice, or stricture, and if other symptoms are improving, then know that the wound is healing; and then treat with compresses and other remedies until it is fully healed.
Mays si la sanacio de lu es excusada, e ja tot temps es uberta, lahoras sapias que ja es fayta fistula; cura donc aquela per le sieu capitol.	If the healing of the wound is delayed, and it has been opened for a long time, then know that it has become a fistula; treat that by its own capital.
E si la plagua es per inscisio de spaza o de cotel, e es simpla en la superficia del pietz o del dos, lahoras cura aquela am aquo que es precedit de sutura, si es gran, o am polvera, si es petita.	And if the wound is caused by a stab or cut, and is simple on the surface of the chest or back, then treat that with water that precedes suture, if it is large, or powder, if it is small.
Mays si ja ha fayta enprecio en le os, e so ja de lu inscizas pessas, lahoras tu torqua la plagua e coyta ad extrayre aquelas pessas, si so separadas.	If the wound has previously been treated with poultices on the bone, and it is now cut open, then twist the wound and extract those pieces, if they are separated.
Mays si no so separadas, lahoras leyssa las entro que se poyresca la plagua, que la extraccio de lor es alleujada.	If they are not separated, then release the intestines that are causing the pain, as their extraction is beneficial.
E de las autras plaguas accidentz en les autres membres le juvament en curacio es le juvament de aquo que havem dit.	And of the other pains that occur in other members, the treatment is the same as we have mentioned.
De las plaguas del ventre.	Of abdominal pains.
L’indisposicio la qual accideys en le ventre es o gran, o pauc, o migiera.	The indisposition that occurs in the abdomen is either large, or small, or variable.
De la gran alcunas veguadas yeys le budel o nervi del budel, per que es fayta intromissio de lor e la sutura de lor esser pus vehement e pus subtil.	Of the large ones, some are in the intestines or the nerves of the intestines, for which intrusion of them and the suturing of them is done more forcefully and more skillfully.
E disrupcio petita es fayta dificil per autra manieyra, e siec se que la reduccio de lor es pus dificil, si no te coytes de la intromissio de lor al sieu loc tantost, quar se ubre e es engrossat per que le intrament de lu es fayt difficil.	And the disruption of small ones is done difficultly by another method, and if the reduction of them is more difficult, then do not wait to insert them back into their place immediately, because they open and become larger, making the instrument for them difficult.
E donc la milhor disrupcio es migiera, quar en aquela no es dificil la reduccio del budel, ayssi cum es dificil en las doas specias denant ditas.	And therefore the best disruption is variable, because in those it is not difficult to reduce the intestine, as it is difficult in the two species mentioned.
E sapias que sutura del ventre es segon quatre manieyras, mays doas suturas son comunas que conveneysso en suturas de las autras plaguas del cors.	You should know that a belly suture is done in four ways, but two common ones are suitable for other parts of the body as well.
E duas autras suturas proprias comunican a las autras plaguas, mays empero so mays proprias en la sutura del ventre.	Two other sutures are specific to other parts of the body, but they are more specific for belly sutures.
E yeu recomti a tu quascuna am exposicio e declaracio.	I recommend you to each one with exposure and declaration.
Donc dic que quan la plagua es petita e es eyssit alcuna causa del budel per aquela, e es fayt dificil a reduzir aquel, lahoras aquo es en una de doas manieyras: o per parvitat de la disrupcio ayssi cum havem dit, o quan al budel es venguda inflacio per la frigiditat de l’ayre.	Therefore, say that when the wound is small and there is no cause of the intestine for it, and it is difficult to reduce it, then one of two ways: either by disruption as we have said, or when the intestine is swollen due to cold air.
E donc quan aquo es ayssi, lahora cove que tu scalfes aquel enayssi que tu submerges una sponga ho drap humit en aygua tebeza sola, o que coguas en aygua squinant, e cyperum, e spic, e embroques am aquela le budel entro que la imflacio sia resolvuda.	And when that is the case, then cover it with a cloth soaked in warm water alone, or with water and vinegar, and pepper, and spice, and embrocations at that intestine inside until the inflammation is resolved.
E alcunas veguadas fa aquo vi en le qual ha stipticitat, e es milhor que la aygua sola en resolucio de la imflacio.	And some ways do it in the one that has stopticity, and it is better than water alone in resolving the inflammation.
E donc cum tu vezes la imflacio esser resolvuda, lahoras tu humecta le budel am aygua en la qual es coyta altea e malvas, quar per aquo es alleujat le intrament de lu am pauca causa.	And when you see that the inflammation has been resolved, then moisten the intestine with water in which salt and vinegar are dissolved, because for this reason it is called the instrument of life and cures many diseases.
Mays si es escusat le intrament de lu aprop aquesta curacio, lahoras scindeys la disrupcio un petit am strument am le qual so inscididas emorroydas.	And if the instrument of life is applied to this cure, then gently separate the disruption with a small sharp instrument that is not inscribed with any markings.
E la curacio primieyra es milhor, quan es propriada que no es seccio, e no sia occupacio a seccar aprop necessitat e defaliment.	The first cure is best when it is appropriate that it does not dry out and is not occupied with the need to dry it too quickly or too slowly.
Del instrument, sec se la forma de lu:	Of the instrument, its shape:
La una partida de lu torta aguda, e l’autra partida no-acuta, e la extremitat subtil, e no sia am la subtilitat de spatum, abantz sia obtusa un pauc.	One part of the instrument is sharp and pointed, and the other part is not sharp, and its tip is thin, but not as thin as a needle, with a slightly rounded end.
E donc cum la plagua es amplificada e yeys fora le budel, lahoras cove que la sua reduccio sia segon la forma de lu natural, en le sieu loc propri, si es possible sobre aquo, quar milhor es.	And when the plague has spread and the intestine has come out, then return it to its natural shape in its proper place, if possible on top of it, because that is best.
Mays quan la disrupcio es ampla, e es en la partida pu bassa del ventre, lahoras cove que tu fassas jazer le malaute sobre le sieu dos, e pausa las suas cambas pus autas que·l sieu cap; e si es en la partida pus desus del ventre, lahoras tu pause le cap de lu e·l pietz pus autz que las partidas dejos.	When the disruption is widespread, and it is in the lower part of the belly, then make the patient lie on their side, and place their legs higher than their head; if it is in the upper part of the belly, then place your hand on their head and their chest higher than their knees.
E semblantment si la disrupcio es en una de las doas partz del ventre, lahoras pausa la tua entencio e la tua consideracio tostemps en aysso per que la partida en la qual es la plagua sia pus auta que l’autra.	Similarly, if the disruption is in one of the lower parts of the belly, then place your ear and your stethoscope quickly in that area so that the part where the pain is higher than the other.
E ayssi cove que tu aministres aquo en las plaguas grans e en las plaguas migieras.	And thus, administer this in large and small doses.
E en las plaguas petitas, pausa aquo que es a tu preparat, e aprop fay que·l ministre sia entre las tuas mas pyatados, le qual tengua la disrupcio tota am la sua ma e ajusta las labias de lu, e aprop descuebre de aquela ad aquel que siec la sutura alcuna causa aprop autra.	And in small doses, place the remedy you have prepared between your fingers and make sure the administrator holds the disruption completely with their hand and adjusts its lips, and from one to another, if there is a cause, then another.
E aquesta es la manieyra de sutura comuna: una que prenguas la agula, o comte de agula segon la cantitat de la amplitut de la plagua; e aprop layssa de la extremitat de la disrupcio del dit anular, e strenh la agula una, otre que tu no metas fiel en las doas extremitatz de la codena, am doas extremitatz del ciphac que es dejos la codena de las partidas dedintz, entro que fassas aquela penetrar de aquela partida; e tu ja has agreguadas doas extremitatz de la codena e doas extremitatz del ciphac, e so faytas quatre ordes.	And this is the common method of suturing: take a needle, or count a needle according to the amount of the wound; and lay it on the edge of the disruption of that ring, and strengthen the needle one, or not to put it in the two ends of the thread, the two ends of the suture that are outside the thread of the parts that are inside, until you make that penetrate into that part; and you have added two ends of the thread and two ends of the suture, and so make four stitches.
E aprop strenh am fiel doble en le circuit de la agula, e alcunas veguadas de doas partz ensemps, e aprop agregua las doas labias e la plagua per agreguacio decent; e aprop layssa la grossitut del dit e fiqua una autra agulha en aquela, e aprop lia aquela am fiel ayssi cum fiest am la primieyra agulha; e no cesses far aquo si es necessitat am las agulhas entro que ajas complida tota la contriccio de la plagua.	And then apply strong pressure around the circumference of the needle, and some stitches in several parts together, and then add the two lips and the wound by aggregation, and then leave the larger one and insert another needle in that place; and then hold it with a strong force like the first needle; and do not stop doing this until the needles are all completed through the entire contraction of the wound.
E sian las agulhas migieras entre groceza e subtilitat, quar las agulhas subtils mot leugierament insciden la carn; e las grossas so de dificil intrament en la codena, e donc per aquo cove que sian migieras en subtilitat e grosseza.	And the needles should be of medium size, because thin needles more easily penetrate the flesh; and large ones are difficult to insert into the codex, and therefore it is necessary that they be of medium size.
E no cove que la agulha sia ficada en doas extremitatz de la codena propdana mot, per so que la carn no sia inscidida leugierament e que la plagua se huebra devant la sua consolidacio.	And it is not necessary that the needle be inserted at both ends of the codex, because the flesh should not be penetrated too easily and the wound should heal before its consolidation.
E no sian prolonguadas de sutura per que la plagua no sia prohibida de consolidacio.	And they should not be extended too much in stitching, so that the wound is not prevented from healing.
E aprop inscideys las extremitatz de las agulhas per so que no ledescan le malaute deves le sieu dormier; e pausaras sobre la sutura pulvils expanduts de tota partida, les quals tenguan las extremitatz de las agulhas; e layssa aquelas entro que sapias que la plagua ja es consolidada.	And then insert the tips of the needles so that they do not pierce the patient, and place powdered sulfur on the sutured wounds from all parts, which held the tips of the needles; and leave those in until you know that the plague has been consolidated.
E aquestas specias de sutura am agulhas en cal manieyra es pus convenient en las plaguas petitas, quar habasta en la sutura de lor una agulha o doas o entorn aquelas.	And these types of sutures with needles in a careful manner are most suitable for small wounds, where in their suture there is one needle or two or around those.
Mays la segonda sutura es cominal: e es que tu aministres am sutura las quatre extremitatz, de la codena e doas extremitatz del ciphac, en una veguada, am agulha en la qual sia fiel envolopat engual en subtilitat e grosseza.	The second suture is similar: and it is that you administer the four tips of the needle, two of the cord and two of the thread, in a way, with a needle that is as fine as its thickness and size.
E aprop quan am la agulha auras penetrat aquestas quatre extremitatz, reduzeys la agulha de aquela meteyssa partida de la qual comensest, per so que le fiel retrayt caja de la pus subirana partida a la plagua, per so que la sutura sia segon sutura de drap am la qual les draps so strengutz.	And then when the needle has penetrated these four tips, reduce the needle from that part of the thread where it began, so that the correct retracting cord of the part that rises above the wound, so that the suture is the second suture of strong cloth.
E pausa entre quascuna sutura la quantitat del gros del dit mendre.	Pause between each suture the amount of the thick part of the mentioned bandage.
E aquesta sutura sabo les homes.	This suture is for women.
E am tal sutura yeu cozegui la plagua la qual era accidida a un home en le sieu ventre le qual era stat plaguat am un cotel, e era la disrrumpcio de la plagua major de un palm, e era eyssit dels budels entorn dos palms del budel del mieg loc e era la disrupcio en le mieg del membre; e adonc yeu reduzegui aquel depus que le budel havia stat foro la plagua per xxiiii horas.	This suture is used to close the wound that occurred in a man's abdomen, which was pierced with a knife, and it was the rupture of the major plate of a palm, and it was located around two palms from the intestine of the middle member; and then I reduced it because the intestine had been exposed for twenty-four hours.
E la plagua fo consolidada en le spazi de xv dias o entorn, e curegui aquel e es sanat; e aprop aquo visquec per motz ans, e es conversat en las suas disposicios.	The wound was consolidated in the space of fifteen days or so, and it was treated and healed; and then I used this ointment for many years, and it was useful to him.

Mays le juguament de medicacio de plagua es jutgament de las autras plaguas.	The judgment of medicine for plague is judgment of the other plagues.

De curacio de zuchem e fistula.	Of the treatment of fistulas and abscesses.
Sapias que tota plagua e apostema quan se envilheseys e se Antiqua, e es fayt ulcus, e no es consolidat e geta braç tot temps e no es abscindit, lahoras, en qualque membre sia, universalment es nompnada fistula e nos la apelam aquela azukem. However, if you are afraid, place that which is submerged in the supertar trissat oil, or submerged in Egyptian anguent, or in any of the verdant oils, because when they harden those ligaments, and the bones are separated from them, the dislocation is alleviated.
Mays si es un gran os ayssi cum le os de camba o de coyssa o semblantz ad aquels, e aquo que de lu es corromput es la facia de lu tant solament, lahoras ratz aquela am resio tant solament derriera entro que sia ostada aquela negror e corrupcio, e aprop restaura la plagua.	If there is a large bone like those of the thigh or cushion or similar to those, and that which is corrupted from it is only the surface of it, then remove that resin only behind where that blackness and corruption is, and then restore the wound.
Mays si aquo que de lu es corrumpyt es gran partida, e la corrupcio ja ha conseguida la medulla del os, lahoras es causa necessaria cerrar aquel e aquel tot inscidir entro al loc on es pervenguda la corrupcio, e lahoras cura aquel entro que sia consolidada.	If that which is corrupted from it is a large part, and the corruption has reached the marrow of the bone, then it is necessary to close that and that entirely incise into the area where the corruption reaches, and then cure that before it is consolidated.
E yeu recomti a tu aquo que endevenc ad un home en la sua coyssa per que pausez aquela a eyssempli e adjutori sobre la tua operacio.	And I recommend that you have someone who has experience and assistance over your operation.
Foc un home jove per etat entorn xxx ans, al qual accideys dolor en la sua cueyssa, e de las partidas dedintz mauguda es sobre la materia dedintz le cors entro que la materia es pervenguda a la cueyssa, e es materia de apostema am gran apostema, e no foc a lu causa extrinseca.	A young man around the age of thirty, who experiences pain in his thigh, and from the parts that are corrupted on the matter of the body within which the matter reaches the thigh, and that is a large abscess, and not an external cause.
E adonc foc extendut le temps am aquela per la error dels metges entro que l’apostema es hubert, e acorrero de lu materias motas, e la sua curacio foc aprop pausada entro que la camba foc fistulada, e faytz son en lu motz orrificis les quals totz getavan poyredura e las humiditatz del cos.	And then he extended the time with that until the abscess was formed, and after that matter moved, and his cure was not paused until the thigh was fistulated, and in those wounds all the pus was drained and the moisture of the body.
E adonc le curec multitut de metges entorn dos ans, e no foc en aquels savia ma en la art, entro que yeu fu appelat.	And then the cure was taught to many doctors around two years, and not in those times but in the art, until I was called.
E vi la camba de lu e las materias que corrian de lu aquels orrificis per gran cors; e ja le cos de aquel home era tot stabozit e la color de lu era citrina.	And I saw the bed of the patient and the matters that flowed from him to those orifices by great veins; and his condition was completely stable and the color of his blood was yellowish.
E adonc yeu intromesi la tenta ad un de aquels orrificis e pervenguec la tenta al os.	And then I inserted the needle into one of those orifices and reached the needle to the bone.
E aprop yeu e perscrutat tostz les orrificis e trobegui aquels pervenir a lor de totas partidas de la camba.	And then I quickly examined all the orifices and found that they were open from all parts of the bed.
E adonc yeu me coytegui e inscidegui sobre un dels orrificis aquels entro que descrobegui una partida del os, e atrobegui aquel corromput, e ja era terros e corrumput e denigrat; e era ja corrumpuda una partida de la camba entro que havia penetrat entro a la mezola.	And then I guided and inserted into one of the orifices those that described a part of the bone, and at the same time I found that it was rotten and corrupted, and already decayed and corrupted; and a part of the bed had already been penetrated by the meat.
E adon yeu serregui aquo que a mi era discubert e preparat del os descubert.	And then I prepared that which was discovered from the bone.
E yeu cujegui que no fos en le os sino aquela corrupcio la qual abscidigui e serregui, e yeu ja havia derraziguada.	And I saw that it was not in the bone but that corruption which had been cut and prepared, and it had already been discarded.
E aprop pausegui la restauracio de la plagua am medicina consolidativas per lonc temps, e no es consolidada.	And then, by means of medical consolidating remedies for a long time, the wound does not consolidate.
E aprop yeu iteregui e descubregui sobre le os segondament sobre le descubriment primier, e atrobegui continua corrupcio am le os.	And then, by repeatedly examining and discovering the second bone under the first, the corruption continues in the bone.
E serregui aquo que a mi apares de aquela corrupcio, e aprop yeu fo perforsat fayre la curacio de lu e restauracio, e no es restaurat.	And then, by repairing that which appears to be corrupted from it, and by making a fair cure for it and restoring it, it is not restored.
