Sapias que a la pinche de la ma e als nuzes dels ditz tart endeve fractura, e no accideys a lor sino atricio motas veguadas.	Know that the pinch of the knee and the knuckles of the fingers are prone to fracture, and do not occur except due to slight trauma.
E quan accideys a la ma fractura o atrissio, lahoras cove que·l malaute segua cayrat e denant lu lies cezent segon equalitat, e aprop pausa la ma de lu sobre aquela extenduda.	When the patient has a fracture or slight trauma, have them lie down with their legs evenly extended, and place your hand on top of that extended leg.
E aprop le ministre extenda les osses trencatz e·l metge engualhe aquels entro que sian congongitz am bona congoncio.	And the assistant extends the broken bones, and the doctor aligns those that are misaligned with good alignment.
E lahoras cove que pause emplastre e estopa, si no accideys apostema caut; e aprop pausa stela desus segon la quantitat del loc, e tu ja has envolopada aquela en drap de li.	And then have them place a poultice and bandage, unless there is no risk of abscess; and place your hand on top of that according to the size of the wound, and you have already wrapped that in cloth.
Mays si la trincadura es en las partidas dedintz deves le ventre de la palma, e lahoras fay semblant de spera de drap, e comanda al malaute que strenha aquela am la sua palma trincada; aprop sia strenguda am drap lonc.	But if the wound is in the parts of the hand, and then make a similar shape of cloth, and command the patient to press that on their palm wound; and have it pressed firmly against the cloth.
E sia la stelha de cuer am drap en le qual sia levitat, per so que le cuer sia aplicat a la palma; e strenh aquela segon que cove.	And have the cloth with the meat on it be lifted, so that the meat is applied to the palm; and press that according to what is suitable.
Mays si la fractura es a las partidas defora, lahoras cove que pauses desus stela e autre estela de la partida dejos en la palma, per so que la ma sia uberta e dreyta; e aprop pausa la strictura, ayssi cum es revolvuda la ma a la rateta entre les ditz am liamentz.	If the fracture is at the parts deformed, then place your hand above and below the part, so that the wound is opened and straightened; and then place the structure, as if it is being rolled between the mentioned blades.
E si accideys fractura a alcu dels nozes dels ditz, lahoras si es le dit pous, sia engualat segon que cove e aprop sia strenhut am la palma e si·t voles, pausa a lu astela petita dreyta per so que sia elevada la fractura e no sia mauguda.	And if the fracture occurs at one of the nuts of the mentioned bones, then if it is possible, secondly, place your hand on the palm and if you wish, place a small wedge to elevate the fracture and not make it crooked.
Mays si la fractura es en les autres ditz, ayssi cum en aquel del mieg loc, o en le indic, o en le auricular, o en le anular, lahoras sia engualhat e liat am le dit sa le qual siec aquel; o sian totz liatz segon continuacio, e es milhor; o pausa sobre aquel stela petita, ayssi cum havem dit en le pous.	If the fracture is in the other mentioned bones, such as in the middle one, or in the index, or in the ear, or in the ring, then place your hand on the mentioned bone; or all of them continuously, and it is better; or place a small wedge above, as we have said in the wrist.
E considera, en la tua restauracio, e aprop aquela, la disposicio de apostema caut e oppose — am la tieua operacio — am aquo que cove quan accideys alcuna causa de aquelas, segon que es iterada la narracio de lu.	And consider, in your restoration, and place it, the disposition of abscess careful and opposite — to that operation — to that which covers when any cause of those occurs, according to what is related about it.
Capitol .xiv.	Chapter 14.
De restauracio de fractura del os de la coyssa.	Of the restoration of the bone fracture of the thigh.
Le os de la cueyssa motas veguadas es trencat e es declarat al sentiment segon que es convertit a la partida denant e a la pus sobirana.	The bones of the thigh are broken and are declared to be second-degree when they are converted to the part that is most painful.
E la restauracio de lu se fa enayssi que·l liament es strenhut sobre la fractura e autre liament dejos la fractura, e le malaute sia prostrat sobre le sieu ventre e sobre la cara.	And the restoration of it is done by applying a bandage over the fracture and another bandage under the fracture, and the patient lies on their stomach and on their face.
E aprop le ministre extenda tot le liament a la sua partida segon la qualitat, quan la fractura es en le mieg loc del os.	And then the healer extends the bandage to its full length according to the quality, when the fracture is in the middle of the bone.
Mays si es propdana a la razitz de la cueyssa, lahoras sia le liament propda al denolh a la partida del pentenilh, per so que la extencio caja en sus, e le autre liament dejos la fractura.	But if it is proposed to the top of the thigh, then the bandage should be placed at the back to the part of the femur, so that the extension can be in front, and the other bandage under the fracture.
E semblantment si la trencadura es propdana al denolh, lahoras sia fayt le liament propda al denol, e sia la extencio a las partidas dejos.	And similarly if the fracture is proposed to the top of the thigh, then the bandage should be placed at the front, and the extension to the parts behind.
E aprop le metge enguale le os am amduas las sieuas mas entro que reduzesca aquel segon la semblansa natural e l’os es conjungit per bona conjunccio; lahoras cove que pauses emplastre e strictura, si no accideys al membre apostema.	And then the doctor should place his hand under the affected bone and gently push it back into its natural position, so that it is joined by a good joint; then apply a poultice and bandage, unless the member has an abscess.
Mays si accideys en lu apostema, lahoras tu layssa aquel per alcus dias entro que l’apostema caut sia cedat, e aprop retorna a la tua curacio.	But if the abscess is in that member, then leave it for several days until the abscess has drained, and then return to your treatment.
La strictura de lu sia ayssi fayta: cove que envolopes sobre la fractura una benda dura, e dobla aquela dos o tres veguadas, e remaugua de lu superfluitat; e aprop envolopa la camba entro que pervengua al talo e a la razitz de la cueyssa.	The bandage for that member should be made like this: cover the fracture with a hard bend, fold it twice or three times, and remove any excess; then place the cushion under the calf and the back of the thigh.
E intromet lonc fiel entre la cueyssa e la camba prop del denol a las partidas dejos, e venguan las extremitatz del fiel de la partida pus sobirana de las doas partz, e aprop revolveys sobre la camba e la cueyssa aquo que superflueys de la benda.	And introduce a long, thin piece of cloth between the thigh and the cushion, and let the ends of the cloth go through the two parts on the side that is more accessible; then roll it over the cushion and thigh to cover any excess from the bandage.
E aprop pausa sobre la cueyssa en le loc de aquela fractura astelhas, e pausa de aquelas una stela sobre le os de la camba.	And then place your hand on the thigh in the location of that fracture, and place a splint on the bone of the cushion.
E aprop uempli las vacuitatz entre la camba e la cuoyssa am draps mols, per so que sia coagulada la extrictura.	And then fill the empty spaces between the chest and the cushion with many cloths, to prevent the contraction from coagulating.
E aprop comensa am strictura fort del mieg sobre le loc de la fractura am tres envolucios o quatre, e quant mays tu te alonhas am liament del loc de la fractura, la tua strictura sia menor e pus leugiera e pus molha.	And then begin the strong contraction from above over the location of the fracture with three or four layers, and as much as you extend the layer of the fracture location, your contraction should be smaller and looser and wetter.
E aprop exten a doas extremitatz del fiel a las partidas dejos entro que pervengua a la cavilha del pe, e strenh amdoas las extremitatz de las stelhas del autra part per so que·l liament no sia remaugut del sieu loc.	And then extend both ends of the strip to the parts that reach the cavity of the foot, and strengthen the other end of the strip with the other part in order that the layer does not remain in its own location.
E aprop leyssa la strectura sobre aquel, don esta ayssi que no accideys al membre corrosio ni apostema caut ni emflacio e semblantz ad aquels; e si accideys alcuna causa de aquelas, adonc cueta te am desliament de lu, e rectifica aquo que accideys tot aprop, segon que havem dit motas veguadas.	And then lay the contraction over that, so that none of those things happen to the member: corrosion, abscess, inflammation, and similar things; and if any of those things happen, then count yourself as undone from it, and rectify what happened immediately, according to what we have said above.
Mays si en le os es pessa del os la qual pongua, lahoras cove que tu engualhes aquel segon que a tu es possibla; e sino, fen sobre lu e remau aquel, e cura am aquo del qual es precedida la rememoracio entro que sia sanat.	But if there is a bone that presses on the bone that you are putting in place, then try to equalize it as much as possible; and if not, do so on it and return it, and cure what follows from the memory of when it was healed.
E alcunas veguadas es strenhuda aquesta fractura de la coyssa otra aquo que sian ajustadas a lu stelhas, ayssi cum havem dit en le adjutori e·n le bras.	Some splints are strengthened to this fracture of the thigh bone, which are adjusted to its shape, as we have said in the assistant and in the arm.
Mays empero en la restauracio de lu en tal manieyra fayta no accideys al malaute claudicacio; e si es restaurada sola, otra aquo que li sia applicada l’autra camba, lahoras es necessari que claudique aquel del qual es tostemps.	However, in the restoration of this fracture, do not cause the patient to become paralyzed; and if it is restored alone, another cushion should be applied on the other leg, as it is necessary for him to quickly regain movement.
E sapias que la coyssa es strenhuda en xl dias o un pauc mes o un pauc mens, e tot aquo es segon la diversitat de las compleccios e de las autras dispozicios.	And you should know that the thigh bone is strengthened in 10 days or a few more or a few months, and all of this depends on the diversity of the conditions and the other dispositions.
Capitol .xv.	Chapter 15.
De restauracio de la fractura de la rodela del denolh.	Of the restoration of the fracture of the humerus bone.
Sapias que fractura de la rodela del denol tart endeve, mays accideys a lu motas veguadas atrissio.	You should know that the fracture of the humerus bone occurs in the arm, but it does not affect the surrounding muscles.
Mays si accideys a lu fractura, lahoras no es sino fissura o trauc en las suas partidas, e aquo es am plagua o ses plagua, e sobre aquo tot es estat am le sentiment.	And if it does affect the fracture, it is only a crack or tear in its parts, and this is a minor or major injury, and over this, everything is based on sensation.
E la restauracio de lu es enayssi que sia engualat aquo que es romput de las partidas de lu am les ditz entro que sia agreguat e conjongit segon que es possible per equacio e facilitat e fabricacio.	And the restoration of it should be equal to what was broken from the parts of it with the mentioned enterings that are aggregated and joined as much as possible for equality, ease, and convenience and making.
E aprop pausa emplastre e pausa sobre aquel stela redonda, si indigeysses de aquela; e strenh desus am strictura ad aquo convenient.	Then place a poultice and place it over that round stone, if necessary for that one; and strengthen above the stricture to that convenience.
E aprop considera totas las disposicios las quals havem recomtadas en las autras fracturas, ayssi cum es apostema caut e semblant ad aquels enaissi que se oppause a tot accident am aquo que a lu es convenient entro que sia sanat.	Then consider all the arrangements that we have recommended in other fractures, including the abscess cautery and similar to those so that it is opposed to all accidents that are convenient for that one until it is healed.
Capitol .xvi.	Chapter XVI.
De restauracio de la fractura de la camba.	Of the restoration of the fracture of the ribs.
Sapias que en la camba so dos osses dels quals la un es gros, e es le nompnat per nom de la camba; e l’autra es subtil, e es nompnat focil.	You know that in the ribs there are two bones of which one is large, and it is called the name of the rib; and the other is thin, and it is called the clavicle.
E accideys a quascus de las specias de fractura aquo que accideys als dos osses del bras, e per aquo es fayta restauracio de lu ayssi cum restauracio del bras engualment, e la operacio de lu es una.	And depending on the type of fracture that occurs in those two bones of the arm, and for that one, the restoration of it is made equally, and the operation of it is one.
E si so trincatz dos osses ensemps, la camba es convertida a totas partidas.	If two bones are fractured together, the cushion is turned to all parts.
E si es trinquat le os pus subtil, la camba es convertida a las partidas Denant.	And if the more delicate bone is fractured, the cushion is turned to the denant parts.
E si es trincat le os pus gros, atrobas aquel dejos, e es de aquelas causas que no so a tu ameguadas.	And if the larger bone is fractured, then leave that one behind, and those are causes that you have not yet understood.
E aprop aministra extencio e equacio e liguacio de las astelas segon aquel engualment.	And then administer extension, equality, and ligature of the splints according to that equality.
Mays empero cove, si la fractura de la camba es laja havent motas satagias, que la extencio sia mendre e pus leugiera, e alleuja am la tua vertut.	However, if the fracture of the bone is not healing due to lack of strength, then the extension should be less and looser, and it will help your skill.
E en la camba es alcuna causa de operacio sobre le bras, e es quan tu engualas las stelhas e que comples tota la tieua operacio, lahoras tu prendras pessas de fustz de pi le qual es pausat dejos las cauzas las quals so pausades en solies, e so faytas eyssament de brancas de palma; aligeys de aquelas a las quals es petita groceza, e no sia ges de las manudas, e sia la longuesa de aquelas segon la longuesa de la camba, e del denol entro al pus dejos.	And in the arm, there is a cause for operation when you equalize the splints and complete the entire operation, then take weights of lead that are placed behind the causes that are placed on the palms; attach them to those that are small groceries, and not from the hands, and be the longest of those according to the longest of the arm, and the one closest to the elbow.
E aprop envolopa sobre quascuna drap en doas envolucios segon la longitut de lu, e pausa la una sobre la partida de la camba de la una part e l’autra del autra part, e sian del denol entro al pus bas loc del pe.	And then wrap each in two blankets of appropriate length, and place one over the part of the bed on one side and the other on the other side, and the end under the lowest part of the foot.
E aprop lias las doas stelhas en tres locs de doas extremitatz e al mieg loc, quar am aquesta strectura la camba es prohibida de clinar a la partida dextra e sinistra, e sta per bona stacio.	And then place the three blankets in three places of the bed's extremities and at the middle, so that this structure prevents the bed from tilting to the right and left, and it is well-positioned.
E ja es aministrat un brasset de fust segon la longuesa de la camba; e sia pausada en lu la camba per so que conserve aquel de movement.	And then a wooden board of appropriate length is placed on the bed; and it is placed under the bed to support it.
E majorment cove que tu fassas aquo en fractura, e quan am aquela es plagua propriament.	And especially be careful that you do this in fracture, and when it is properly placed.
E aprop considera en quascun jorn la camba e studia am aquel per derier studi, e tu le guardes de apostema e de imflacio o de autres causas semblantz; e cum accideys alcuna causa de aquelas, lahoras opausa te a lu am aquo que cove entro que sia sanat.	And then consider the bed each day and study it for any signs of worsening, and guard it from abscess and inflammation or other similar causes; and if something happens that indicates that it is not healing, then stop doing what you are doing until it is healed.
Capitol .xvii.	Chapter 17
De la fractura del talo e dels osses del pe e dels ditz.	Of the fracture of the talus bone and the bones of the foot and those mentioned.
Al talo no accideys fractura de tot; mays als osses del pe accideys fractura alcunas veguadas; e als ditz del pe pauc accideys fractura, e no accideys a lor sino atricio en las mes de disposicio.	The talus bone does not always have fracture; rather, some fractures occur in the bones of the foot; and in those mentioned, few fractures occur, and they do not happen to them but only in certain positions.
E si als osses del pe endeve fractura e vezes aquels osses esser elevatz sobre si entre lor, lahoras le malaute pause le sieu pe sobre la terra preparat ayssi cum anant.	And if the bones of the foot have fracture and sometimes those bones are lifted above themselves between them, then place the patient on his back prepared on the ground as if he were walking.
E aprop pausa la un pe sobre aquo que es elevat de aquels osses, e aprop calca aquels, e prem, e engualha aquels entro que torno en los locs.	And then place one foot on top of that which is lifted above those bones, and press them, and equalize them until they return to their places.
E aprop pausa emplastre e stopa desus, e pausa dejos le ventre del pe una petita taula a la qual sian dos caps plas.	And then place a poultice and a bandage above, and place a small table under the belly of the patient with two flat surfaces.
E aprop strenh aquela am le pe am strectura descent, pus que tu has envolopada aquela am draps e am autres causes de las quals indigeys.	And then strengthen that bandage to the leg structure below, because you have wrapped it with cloth and other causes of which it is in need.
E cum a lu passan tres dias o quatre, lahoras tu deslia le liament, quar tu atrobaras les osses engualatz, o sian trincatz o sian dislocatz, e la operacio en aquels es ayssi co coneysses.	And if three or four days pass, then you will remove the bandage, where you will find the bones equalized, or they are broken or dislocated, and the operation in those is as follows.
Mays si alcus ditz son trincatz, lahoras restaura aquels, e enguala aquels ayssi cum yeu e recomtat a tu en la restauracio dels ditz de la ma.	If the patient's toes are curled, straighten them and place them in a natural position, and then gently stretch them and guide them back to their original position.
E aprop pausa al dit trincat stela segon la longitut del dit, e sia pus lada de lu un pauc; e aprop dejos le pe aquesta taula la qual e a tu recomtada, e strenh aquela am strictura decent.	Then place your hand along the length of the curled toe, and put a bandage on it; then move the table with this one that you have recommended, and tighten the bandage properly.
Mays si aquo que es trincat dels osses so dos o tres o mays, lahoras tu pausa sobre quascun dit astela de la sua quantitat envolopada en drap leon, e strenh la taula en le pus bas del pe, e sia stant sobre la un dels caps de la taula foro le ventre del pe per que la tengua am bona retencio.	If the toe is curled more than two or three, then place your hand on each of these toes, wrapped in a lion-skin cloth, and tighten the table at the lowest part of the foot, and have one of the ends of the table over the belly of the foot so that it holds well.
E es convenient a tu que no oblides que no consideres totas las causas las quals que e ditas a tu en las autras fracturas dels accidentz que havem dit; e opausa te a tot accident am aquo que cove.	And it is important for you to not forget that you should consider all the causes that were told to you in other cases of accidents that we have mentioned; and pause at any accident that occurs.
Capitol .xviii.	Chapter 18.
De fractura del conh de la femna e del os del pentenilh e de la vergua del home.	Of the fracture of the nose of the woman and the bone of the shinbone and the ankle of the man.
Quan le conh de la femna es trincat, lahoras fay aquela ceser en cezela cayrada, e aprop enclina aquela a la partida del dos un petit, e sia tenguda detras.	When the woman's cervix is trapped, then perform a cesarean section in the lower abdomen, and then gently place it on the back of the belly, and hold it there.
E aprop la matrona umpla le conh de coto, e sia fayt en le conh de lu ayssi cum spera; e aprop la femna sia concutida, e eleva le dos de lu petit a petit, quar tot aquo es fora-getat entro que sia denant la partida del conh ayssi cum spera e l’os trincat retorna.	And then the midwife should pull the woman's cervix out, and do so with great care; and then the woman should be shaken, and her back raised little by little, until all of that is done carefully and the trapped bone returns.
E aprop pausa pulvils sobre le dos de lu, e quan vol urinar remaugua le coto am facilitat e aprop urine, e reduzeys e retorna aquel segon la manieyra segon la qual mezist aquel al comensament, e aprop retorne al sieu pulvil primier.	And then place powder on her back, and when she needs to urinate, gently turn her on her side and remove the urine, and then return her to her original position, and replace the first powder.
E fassa ayssi per vii dias o enviro aquels, quar aquel es restaurat.	Do this for seven days or around that time, until it is restored.
E si voles, pren una vezica de ovela e strenh sobre le trauc de lu una canula de canavera; e entromet tota la vesica en le conh de lu, e aprop ensuffla en la canula am vertut entro que la vesica sia imflada dedintz le conh, quar la fractura retorna.	And if you wish, take an ox's bladder and strengthen it over the wound of the woman with a catheter; and inflate the entire bladder into the woman's womb, and then gently blow into the catheter until the bladder is fully inflated inside the womb, because the fracture returns.
E aprop sia umplida de coto e estia per alcus dias segon que havem recomtat, entro que sia sanat.	And if it is necessary to fill it with cotton and linen for several days as recommended, until it is healed.
E quan le os del pentenil de home o de femna es trincat, lahoras aministra en la restauracio e agulacio de lu aquo que havem recomtat en l’os del anca.	When the bones of the fingers of a man or woman are fractured, then apply in the restoration and drilling of that which we have recommended for the bone of the leg.
E aquo que es dreyt no es occultat en aquestas fracturas proprinquas e que pauc endeveno, majorment ad aquel al qual es alcun studi e us e enten aquest meu libre mot; quar aquela fractura significa a tu en las majors disposicios via dreyturiera en la restauracio e en la strictura de lu, e donc enten be.	And that which is drilled should not be hidden in these nearby fractures and that does not occur, especially to him who has some study and uses and understands this my free hand; because that fracture means to you in the major dispositions via drilling in the restoration and in the structure of it, and therefore understand well.
Mays en la vergua del home quan es trincada, pren guarguamela de auca, e met la vergua en aquela; e aprop pausa sobre lu envolucio de drap, e sia envolopada, e aprop sia layssada per tres dias o enviro aquels, e sia sanada.	In the wound of the man when it is fractured, take guarguamela of gold, and put the wound in that; and place your hand over it wrapped in cloth, and wrap it, and let it be laid for three days or around those, and let it be healed.
Capitol .xix.	Chapter XIX.
De restauracio de fractura dels osses quan es am plagua.	Of the restoration of bone fractures when they are infected.
Convenient es ad aquel al qual accideys fractura am plagua, e majorment si le os es gran ayssi cum es le os de la cuoyssa o de l’adjutori, o semblant ad aquel, que tu te cuoytes e fleubotomes aquel tantost si las condicios de fleubotomia a tu o testifican ayssi cum desus havem dit.	It is convenient for the one who has suffered a fracture, and especially if the bone is large and as big as the bone of the thigh or the forearm, or similar to that, which you should be careful and use forceps as soon as the conditions for forceps are present.
E si la plagua eflueys sanc, lahoras cove que tu te coytes a la retencio de lu enayssi que tu polverizes sobre lu zegi trissat, si a tu autra causa no es present.	And if the fracture is not complete, you should be careful to retain it in place, unless you powder it with three grains of sugar, if there is another cause.
E aprop comensa restaurar la fractura en aquel meteys dia, e no prolongues aquo, si no accideys apostema.	And then begin to restore the fracture on that same day, and do not prolong it, unless an abscess occurs.
Mays si accideys apostema caut, lahoras tu layssa la restauracio de lu entro al ix dia, entro que sia cedat le apostema, e no apropinques a lu en le tertz dia e·l iiii de tot, quar tu faras accidir mals accidentz.	However, if an abscess occurs carefully, you should leave the restoration of it until the ninth day, before it has passed, and do not approach it on the third or fourth day, as you will cause more harm.
Mays si le os trencat es eminent sobre la codena descubert, lahoras cove que te perforses reduzir aquel e engualar aquel am las tuas mas am facilitat e am pauca extencio.	However, if the fractured bone is projecting above the knee, you should be careful to reduce it, and equalize it with your hands, at your discretion and with as little extension as possible.
Mays si extencio no es a tu preparada e la equacio de lu am las tieuas mas, lahoras tu reduzeys aquel am las tuas mas am aquest sturment; e es sturment le qual es fayt de ferr, la longitut del qual es de vii ditz o de viii e la latitut del qual es segon la quantitat de la plagua; e per aquo es necessari al metge que prengua de aquels tres o quatre segon la quantitat que indigeys ad aquo en la curacio en tota specia de fractura.	If the extension is not to your liking and the equilibrium of it does not match the size of your hands, then you reduce that to the size of your hands with this tool; which is made of iron, the length of which is seven or eight inches, and the width of which is according to the extent of the wound; and for this reason, it is necessary for the doctor who uses these three or four to match the amount that is needed in the cure in all cases of fracture.
E sia redon, e sia en lu pauca groceza per so que no sia doblat deves la comprecio sobre aquel en la hora de la operacio.	And it should be round, and it should be in the shape of the part to be treated, so that it is not folded during the operation.
E sia de aguda extremitat al qual sia marge en las sieuas extremitatz; e sia le desus de lu a grossetut tendent, e de la maytat de lu entro a las partidas.	And it should have a sharp edge at which there is a margin on both ends; and the underside of it should be thick and the top of it should go into the parts.
E aquesta es la forma de lu:	This is the shape of it:
E es nompnat en grec “labre volentz atelarem”, so es paleta pauca.	And it is called in Greek "labra volentz atelarem", so this is the name of the tool.
Per que cove que sia pausada la extremitat de lu acuda elevada sobre la extremitat del os eminent.	Because of which, it should be supported by a pillow at the end of its sharp edge, raised above the end of the prominent bone.
E inpelleys aquel en una veguada entro que retorne le os, e sia engualat am alcuna equacio.	And push that one into a narrow space where the bone returns, and let it be equal to some balance.
E donc esforsa te engualar las extremitatz de la fractura entre lor, e si la extremitat de lu trencada es subtil, e no pren aquela le sturment per bona axcepcio, lahoras cove que tu inscidas la extremitat de aquel os entro que l’insturment haja poder de aquo.	And then force the extremities of the fracture together between them, and if the extremity of that bone is thin, and you do not take it with the instrument for good reason, then you should insert the extremity of that bone into the place where the instrument has power.
Mays si no podes reduzir le os de tot am aquo que havem recomtat, lahoras enscideys aquel am aquo que coveneys a lu dels inscizoris les quals havem ditz; o serra aquel am una de las serras en qualque manieyra sia a tu possible.	But if you cannot reduce the bone to all that we have recommended, then insert that part which should be with the scissors that we have mentioned; or saw that part in some way that is possible for you.
E aprop ratz aquel que roman en le os de asperitat e de scorsas menudas.	And then remove those parts that remain in the bone of sharpness and small cuts.
E cum le os es reduzit, e aprop la reduccio le malaute atroba dolor vehement ledent, lahoras sapias que le os no es retornat al sieu loc natural; e adonc fay aquo quar tu confereyses al malaute gran juvament.	And when the bone is reduced, and the patient experiences great pain after the reduction, then you should know that the bone has not returned to its natural place; and therefore do that which you confer upon the patient with great benefit.
Cum es complida la tua restauracio la qual fas al os, e lahoras submergeys drap en vi stiptic negre, e propriament si es en estiu, e no pauses sobre la plagua cerot ni autre causa en la qual sia oli, per so que no fassa en lu accidir poyredura e corropcio.	When your restoration is completed, which you do for the bone, and then submerge dressing in a tight black stiptic, and especially if it is in summer, and you do not place it on the wound or any other cause in which there is oil, so that it does not cause more pain and corruption.
E aprop aministra stelas en la hora del tieu compliment de la restauracio de l’os, e layssa la plagua descuberta enayssi que inscidas le trauc am forfexs e uses de envolucios segon la quantitat de la plagua.	And then administer stitches at the time of the bone's complementary restoration, and leave the wound open so that the bent part can be inserted with forceps and wrapped according to the amount of the wound.
E guarda te am tota cautela que no strenhas la plagua am la fractura, quar motas veguadas an fayt aquo les fols metges, e fero accidir sobre les sieus malautes mort o malautia corrodent o zuthement, so es sania.	And be very careful not to tear the wound over the fracture, as this was done by some doctors, and they caused harm on their patients' legs, making them dead or worse. This is dangerous.
E si la tieua strictura leugiera, molli, diversa de la strictura de las autras fracturas.	And if the wound is larger, soft, and different from the fracture of other bones.
E si la plagua es gran o es plagua mala, e temes sobre aquel alcus accidentz mals les quals havem recomtatz, e atrobas dolor en le loc, lahoras no cove que pauses sobre aquel astelas, mays fay ad aquel envolucio de draps durs en loc de stelas e strenh lu am aquelas.	And if the wound is large or a bad wound, and you fear those bad accidents that we have mentioned, and cause pain in that place, then do not place stitches over those stitches, but rather apply that bandage of hard cloth in place of stitches and press on those parts.
E cum aprop un dia o dos vezes ja la plagua comensar, que en lu sia engendrat brac, lahoras tu osta desus le drap le qual havias pausat sobre aquel am vi, e aprop aministra calguas, enguentz am les quals de nostra constuma es que mediquem las plaguas, ayssi cum enguentz tetrafarmacon e semblantz ad aquel.	And when the wound begins to close after a day or two, which in that place generates pus, then remove the cloth that you placed over that and administer poultices, using those that we usually use as medicine for wounds, such as tetrafarmacon and similar to that.
E conveneys a tu que deslias le liament e considera la plagua en quascun dia mati e vespre entro que sia consolidada e fermada, e cove que·l membre sia preparat en tal manieyra que la poyredura corra de lu a las partidas dejos am facilitat.	And it is convenient for you to remove the bandage and consider the pain in each day that matters and evening until it is consolidated and closed, and cover that member in such a way that the swelling runs from it to the parts behind to facilitate.
si a la plagua passan motz dias, e no es consolidada ni es abscindit de lu le brac, lahoras sapias que aqui so satagias de las petitas per que cove enquieras la plagua am tenta.	If the pain lasts for several days and is not consolidated or discharged from it, then know that here are the remedies for the small ones to cover and seek the pain in order to test.
E de aquelas satagias aquelas que so separadas remau e extratz, aquelas que de lor no so separadas e pongen le membre e fan accidir dolor, perforsa te a inscidir aquelas segon que a tu aquo es possibla.	And of those remedies, those that remain separated and extracted, those that are not separated and put the member and make it painful, perforate you to insert those second that to you is possible.
E si accideys a la plagua zuchem o eluchen, so es stiomenios, o autra specia de corrupcio e de putrefaccio, lahoras cove que pauses a quada un de aquels am aquo que conveneys a lu de la curacio del qual es precedida narracio en le sieu capitol.	And if the pain becomes purulent or putrid, it is a different kind of corruption and putrefaction, then cover that with one of those that are suitable for that cure which is preceded by the story in its own chapter.
E de aquo en le qual cove que stia lo mieu sermo e tu fassas present la tua pessa: quan os gros es trincat, emineys sobre le membre ayssi cum le os de la coyssa e del ajutori e semblantz ad aquels dels membres grans, e que no presumas atraccio de lu, ni la extraccio de lu quar motas veguadas accideys per aquo la mort; habantz layssa aquel entro que poyresca, quar fort leu cayra per si aprop xx dias o xxx; e lahoras cura la plagua si a tu es vist, e si no layssa aquela.	And of that in which you cover that the best service and you make present your foot: when the large ones are cut off, emerge over the member that is there with the bones of the body and the helper and similar to those of the large members, and do not assume attraction of it, nor the extraction of it that many things have happened per aquo the death; having left that inside which is greasy, because strong it will be for if you approach xx days or xxx; and then cure the pain if you see it, and if not leave that.
Capitol .xx.	Chapter 20
De la curacio de nodacio que accideys en le vestigi de alcuna fractura.	Of the cure of a node that occurs at the site of a fracture.
Motas veguadas accideys aquesta nodacio en le vestigi de sanacio de fractura, e majorment que es prop de las juncturas, e es orrasada per lu la figura del membre; e fort leu prohibeys le membre de la sua operacio natural.	Nodes often occur at the site of fracture healing, especially near joints, and are shaped like a member; and they strongly prevent the limb from performing its natural function.
Adonc considera si la nodacio es recent e aministra en aquela medicinas que han stipticat ayssi co es aloen, e enses, e mira, e sercacollo, e acrassia, e semblantz ad aquels; enayssi que prenguas de aquela alcunas o totas, e comfesiys aquelas am vi stiptic, o am album de huou, o am vi agre, e pausa aquela sobre la nodacio en estopa, e constringeys aquelas sobre lu per bona constriccio.	Therefore consider if the node is recent and administers in those medicines that have stoptic properties such as aloe, senes, mirbane, serpacollo, acrassia, and similar to those; or you take some or all of them, and confirms those as a stoptic, or album of honey, or vinegar, and place that over the node in a cloth, and bind it over the node for good compression.
E leyssa extrictura que no deslies aquela per motz dias; e aprop deslia aquela e itera autra, entro que sia remauguda la nodacio; o strenh sobre aquela lamina de plom descentment, quar plom ha proprietat de remaure tot aquo que es imflat en les membres.	And do not apply too much pressure that it does not dislodge the node for several days; and remove it and apply another, until the node is reduced; or strengthen on that layer of lead descentment, which lead has the property of retaining all that is applied in the limbs.
Mays si nodacio ja es en peyra convertida e streyta es e nessessitat provoca a ostar aquela coytadament, e lahoras scindeys aquela per la partida pus sobirana de lu, e inscideys la superfluitat e eminent, o ratz aquela am alcus rezoris entro que sia remauguda; e cura aquel entro que sia sanat.	If the joint has already become hard and narrow and necessarily causes pain in that way, then cut it along the most prominent part of it, and scrape off the excess and inflamed parts, or remove those with a sharp instrument before they become ulcerated; and cure it within the time that it becomes healed.
Capitol .xxi.	Chapter 21.
De restauracio de fractura quan es restaurada e aprop aquo roman le membre subtil e freul no segon la sieua natura.	When a fracture is restored and brought back to its original shape, but the member does not return to its natural position.
Quan fractura de os es restaurada, e aprop aquo roman le membre subtil e freul, lahoras aquo no es fayt sino per motas causas: de las quals la una es multitut de solucio del liament e de la liguacio de lu fayta no segon que cove; o per superfluitat de strictura dels liamentz entro que·l nutriment sia prohibit correr al membre; o per multitut de embrocaccio superflua; o per movement superfluent no en la sua hora; o per pauquesa de sanc en le cors del malaute e per debelitat de lu.	When a fracture of the bone is restored, and the member returns to its original shape, but it is not done for many reasons: one of which is the lack of solution of the ligaments and tendons of that part, made not according to its natural course; or because there is an excess of stricture of the ligaments before the nutrient can reach the member; or because of excessive embrocation; or because of superfluous movement not in its proper time; or because of weakness in the body of the patient and because of its debility.
E curacio de aquo es dar a mengar al malaute e far le cor de lu tendre entro que·l sanc sia multiplicat en lu; e aministra banh; e entromet gaug e leticia sobre lu.	And the treatment for this is to make the patient lie down on their back and keep them there until the swelling has subsided; and administer baths, and apply compresses of figs and lettuce on it.
E aprop pausa pegua sobre le membre, per so que la pegua atire a lu mot nutriment, o continua embrocacio de lu am aygua tebeza, entro que·l nutriment corr e retorne a la sua figura natural.	And then place a poultice on the limb, so that the poultice draws out any remaining nourishment, or continues to bring warm water through it, until the nourishment flows and returns to its natural shape.
Capitol .xxii.	Chapter 22.
De curacio dels osses trincatz quan so restauratz tortuozament e prohibeys la operacio de lor de aquo que cove.	Of the treatment of broken bones that have been restored improperly and prevent surgery on them for this reason.
Quan accideys al membre ja restaurat aprop la sanacio de lu de tortuositat e eminencia al os trincat e nodacio, e es per aquo fededa de forma del membre, mays empero le membre no es prohibit de la sieua operacio natural, lahora no cove que tu recipias la paraula de aquel que exsistima aquel membre sia de novel trincat.	When an injury occurs to a member that has already been restored, it is necessary to correct the deformity and swelling of the broken bone and its nodosity, and to shape it into the form of the limb, but if the limb is not prohibited from its natural operation, at that time you should not receive the word of that person who exists that that member is newly broken.
Mays ja so statz motz fols metges e restauradors les quals han fayt aquo en nostra tera; e aquesta operacio es mot vituperable perduzent a gran temor le senhal de la qual es mortal.	But if many foolish doctors and restorers have done this on our earth; and this operation is very blameworthy, causing great fear to the patient, which is mortal.
Mays si claudicacio e nodacio son recentz, lahoras cove que sian enbrocatz am aygua tebeza en la qual so coytas erbas mollificantz, ayssi cum son fuelas de altea e razitz de lu, e mellilot, e semblantz ad aquels; e sia fayt a lu emplastre am emplastre mollificatio ayssi cum dyallaquilon ben fayt; o que sia preza mucillage de razit de altea e sia contucida am gray de gualina o am oli de cirami, e sia emplastrat am aquel; o que sian prezes figuas grassas e sian trissadas am fems de colom, e semblantz ad aquels de las medicinas que son nompnadas amermans consolidacio.	If the limping and stiffness are recent, then it is recommended to apply a softening lotion containing the mollifying herbs such as elderflowers and rue, and melilot, and similar ones; and this should be made into an ointment like diascoral well prepared; or it should be made of the pounded root of elderflower and be mixed with grey gualine or oil of camphor, and this should be applied to the affected area; or it should be made of soft fatty substances and be rubbed into the skin of a columbine, and similar ones like those of medicines that are named consolidation.
E alcunas vetz es dissolvuda am assidua fricacio leugiera que sia am las mas humidas, e sia administrat movement del membre a tota partida en totas horas.	And some vinegar is dissolved in light friction with the wettest ones, and this should be administered to move the member in all parts at all hours.
Mays si tortuositat ja es anada denant e es fayta fort e convertida es en peyra e provocada es necessitat a curacio de lu am ferr, lahoras cove que sia le pus desus cecsat e la continuacio del os sia dissolvut, e sia inscidit aquo que superflueys de nodacio de aquel meteys am le os am inscissoris subtils, e sia aministrada facilitat en aquel am sollicitut e studi.	If the twisting has already become severe and is made strong and converted into a stone and provokes the need for treatment with iron, then it is recommended to apply the pus under the skin and dissolve the continuity of the bone, and to scrape off any excess from the stiffness of that meat with subtle surgical knives, and this should be administered to facilitate movement in that area.
Capitol .xxiii.	Chapter 23.
De sermo en dislocacio.	Of speech in dislocation.
Dislocacio es eyssiment de alcuna de las juncturas del sieu loc, per que es prohibida de movement, e es orrezada la figura del membre, e fa venir sobre le malaute dolors e lesios grans.	Dislocation is an injury to one of the joints of the body, which prevents movement, distorts the shape of the limb, and causes severe pain and great injuries on the patient.
Donc quan accideys ad alcu dislocacio, lahoras cove tantost perforsar que sia reduzit, e no tarde aquela reduzir, quar si es tardada, le loc es apostemat e fort leu am aquo es fayta dificil la reduccio de dislocaccio.	Therefore, when an injury occurs in a dislocation, it is immediately necessary to reduce it as soon as possible, and not to delay the reduction, because if it is delayed, the limb becomes inflamed and very painful, and in that case, reducing the dislocation is difficult.
E per aysso no cove que sia maugut ni stendut en la hora de la apostemacio, quar motas veguadas fa venir spasme e dolors ledentz.	And to prevent this, it is necessary that the limb not be overstretched or extended in the hour of inflammation, because swelling causes spasms and slow pain.
Mays quan aquo accideys, lahoras cove que tu te coytes a la flaubotomia del malaute, e aprop sia layssat entro que repause le apostema; e aprop le membre sia embrocat am aygua cauda e oli, e aprop sia reduzit am facilitat.	When that happens, it is necessary to approach the patient's bedside and allow the swelling to subside before reducing the joint; then apply heat to the limb with hot water and oil, and reduce the joint as easily as possible.
E tot membre sia curat am aquo del qual la rememoracio vindra en son loc.	And all the limb should be treated with the oil that will bring its memory back to its place.
E yeu ja e ordenatz les capitols de dislocacio segon que es precedit en fractura; de la partida del cos pus sobirana entro a la partida pus dejos.	And I have already ordered the capital letters of dislocation according to what is preceded in fracture; from the part of the hip bone, enter into the part that was just left.
Capitol .xxiiii.	Chapter 24:
De curacio de dislocacio de la mandibula dejos.	Cure for dislocation of the jaw.
So dislocadas las doas mandibulas si no tart; e la dislocacio de amdos es fayta segon una de dos manieyras: que o son remaugudas de lurs locs per pauca remocio, e so mollificadas un petit; o so dislocadas per entiera dislocacio e complida, entro que sian mollificadas a la partida de la junctura entro que corro saliva del malaute e que no puesca tenir aquela ni puesca claure la sua boca, e la lengua de lu sia envolopada en sa paraula.	So dislocated jaws that are not tart; and the dislocation of the other is made in one of two ways: either they are reinserted into their places by a little removal, and are slightly molded; or they are completely dislocated and completed, until they are molded at the part of the joint where the saliva of the patient flows out, and they cannot hold that nor close their mouth, and the tongue of them is wrapped in their palate.
Mays quan la dislocacio de lu es pauca, lahoras en las majors disposicios retorna per si an pauca causa.	When the dislocation of it is slight, then return to the greater positions as if by a slight cause.
Mays si la dislocacio es entiera e complida, lahoras cove que sia administrada reduccio de lu leugierament, e no sia tardada de tot.	When the dislocation is complete and completed, then cover that it be administered reduction of it more slowly, and not be delayed for too long.
E es que·l ministre tengua le cap del malaute, e entrometa lo metge le dit pous de la una sieua ma en la razit de la dislocacio de la mandibula dedintz la boca de lu, si la dislocacio es de la una part; o que entrometa les sieus dos pouzes ensemps, si la dislocacio es de doas partz, e les autres ditz de las mas de lu sian defora am les quals enguale; e comanda al malaute que cesse las suas mandibulas e absolva aquelas anar de quascuna partida; e le metge engualhe la mandibula e enpellisca la mandibula entro que retorne al sieu loc.	And the minister should hold the patient's head, and insert the doctor's finger in the patient's mouth, on the side of the dislocation of the jaw, inside the patient's mouth, if the dislocation is on one side; or insert both fingers together, if the dislocation is on both sides, and the other fingers equally, and command the patient to stop their jaws and release those that are in each part; and the doctor should equalize the jaw and push it back into place before it returns to its original position.
E si dificil es la reducio de lu, e majorment si amdos las mandibulas so essemps dislocadas, lahoras aministra evoporacio am aygua cauda e oli, entro que sia fayta leugiera la reduccio de amdos e no tardes la reduccio de amdos de tot, ayssi quo havem dit.	And if the reduction is difficult, especially if both jaws are frequently dislocated, then administer evaporated water and oil, until it is easy to reduce both and does not delay the reduction of both, as we have said.
E donc cum retornam e so engualadas, e es clausa la boca del malaute e no es mollificada, lahoras pausa sobre aquelas polvils de drap am cerot, e sia fayt de cera e oli rozat; e aprop sia liat am facilitat am liamens mols.	And when they are reduced and equalized, and the patient's mouth is closed and not molded, then place something soft on those wounds with wax, and make it from cera and oil, to facilitate movement of the jaw.
E sia le dormir del malaute sobre le sieu dos, e·l cap de lu sia stant entre dos aurelhes, per so que no maugue aquel a la partida dreyta ni a la sinistra; e no li fassas per forsa masteguar alcuna causa; habans la sieua vianda sia forbicio leon, entro que quan las dolors sian remaugudas e las mandibulas so nozadas, lahoras maugue aquo que vol.	And the patient's body should be lying on their side, with the head between two pillows, so that it does not press against the back or left side; and do not force any cause; having the same view, use a lion's tongue, until when the pain is relieved and the jaws are unlocked, then turn them to their will.
E aquo sia aministrat am facilita, e no trebalhe sobre la apercio de la boca deves la comestio e beure e ocitatio, entro que la mandibula sia nozada e sanada.	And this should be administered with ease, and do not force the opening of the mouth for food, drink, and breathing, until the jaw is unlocked and healed.
E si es dificil la reduccio de duas mandibulas quan so dislocadas en alcuna hora e no so convertidas als lors locs, lahoras motas veguadas accideysso febres e soda assidua, e fort leu es alerguat le ventre del malaute, e fort leu e vomeys colera pura.	And if it is difficult to reduce two dislocated jaws at any hour and they are not converted to their usual places, then apply cold compresses and frequent fever, and strong heat is applied to the patient's belly, and strong heat and vomiting pure bile.
E quan tu vezes aquo, lahoras sapias que es perdicio; e motas veguadas mor aquel al qual accideys aquo en x dias.	And when you see that, know that it is fatal; and those who have that happen to them die within a few days.
Capitol .xxv.	Chapter 25.
De reduccio de la dislocacio de la furcula e de la extremitat del muscle.	The reduction of the dislocation of the furcula and the extremity of the muscle.
Furcula no es dislocada del latz dedintz per la sua continuacio am le pietz; e alcunas veguadas es dislocada a la partida defora, e aquo es declarat al sentiment.	Furcula is not dislocated from the back due to its connection with the chest; and some vertebrae are dislocated at the front, and that is felt as pain.
E la restauracio de lu es que·l malaute jagua sobre le sieu dos e extenda les sieus brasses.	And the restoration of it is that the patient lies on their back and extends their arms.
E aprop coarta le loc am la tua palma am fort coartacio, quar ela retornara.	Then cover the area with your hand using strong pressure, and it will return.
E aprop pausa sobre aquela emplastre e pulvils e strenh aquela.	Then place a poultice and powders on that area and strengthen it.
Mays la extremitat de aquel que siec le coyde e·s continuat am aquel, no es dislocada en alcun dia; lahoras cove que sia reduzida e engualhada segon que havem dit e segon que es a tu aparelhat.	The extremity of that which is connected to the body and continues with that, is not dislocated on any day; however, it should be reduced and splinted according to what we have said and according to what is available to you.
E aprop pausa sobre aquela emplastre, e pulvils, e extrictura, e comanda al malaute adherir a trenquilitat e a repaus entro que sia sanat.	Then place a poultice, powders, and compression on that area, and command the patient to remain at rest until it is healed.
E am aquesta meteyssa curacio es reduzida la extremita del muscle quan es separada del sieu loc.	And with this method of treatment, the extremity of the muscle is reduced when it is separated from its place.
Capitol .xxvi.	Chapter 26
De la reduccio de la dislocacio del muscle.	Of the reduction of the dislocation of the muscle.
Sapias que·l muscle no es dislocat sino segon tres manieras, de las quals es la una que sia dislocat a la partida del titillic a la partida dejos.	You should know that the muscle is not dislocated in three ways, one of which is that it is dislocated at the tip of the elbow to the opposite side.
E la segonda es que sia dislocat a la partida desus del muscle, e aquo es fayt tart; e no es dislocat a las partidas detras per la spalla; e no es dislocat a las partidas denant per les nervis.	And the second is that it is dislocated at the part above the muscle, and this is done quickly; and it is not dislocated at the parts behind the shoulder; and it is not dislocated at the parts in front of the nerves.
E majorment es dislocat e defora eyssit a las partidas dejos deves le titillic, e majorment en aquels dels quals las carns son paucas, leugierament es dislocat; mays en aquels en les quals so motas carns, es eyssit fora am dificultat.	And it is more commonly dislocated and deformed and stuck at the parts behind the elbow, and especially in those in which the meat is thin, it is easily dislocated; but in those in which there are many muscles, it is stuck out with difficulty.
E fort leu accideys ad alcus homes percussio o cazement, e le muscle de lu es apostemat de apostema caut, e es cujat per aquo que ja sia dislocat.	And many people often suffer from contusion or bruising, and the muscle of which is inflamed with abscess, and it is known that it has been dislocated.
Adonc cove que tu sproes aquo entro que estias sobre-sertetut de lu, e lahoras procesiscas en la curacio de lu.	Therefore, you should know that you are overburdened with it, and then proceed to the treatment of it.
E es conoguda la dislocacio de lu quan es a las partidas dejos deves le titillic; per so que distingescas entre le muscle dislocat e·l muscle sa, quar tu atrobas entre aquels diversitat manifesta; e atrobas en le cap del muscle concavitat e dejos le titillic deves le tocament del cap del muscle ayssi quo un huou, e al malaute no pot redusir la sua ma a la sieua aurelha, ni maure aquela per totz movementz.	When it is known as dislocation when the parts behind are devastated; so that you can distinguish between the dislocated muscle and the healthy muscle, because you notice differences between them; and you feel in the head of the muscle concavity and behind the devastation, touching the head of the muscle like a bone, and the patient cannot reduce their hand to its usual position, nor move it at all.
Si es dislocat deves le pietz o ensus, e tu lahoras atrobas manifest tocament, e no es amaguat.	If it is dislocated, you must press or pull, and you should feel a clear touch, and it is not hidden.
E de aquesta dislocacio es fayta leugiera reduccio quan es fresca e le malaute es enfant.	And this dislocation is easily reduced when it is fresh and the patient is young.
E la reduccio de lu es que·l ministre eleva la ma de lu a las partidas desus; e aprop pause les tieus pouses dejos le titillic de lu, e eleva la junctura am fortaleza en sus al sieu loc, e·l ministre eleva la ma de lu, e extenda aquela en sus; e aprop pausa aquela dejos quar ela retorna leugierament.	And the reduction of this is that the practitioner raises the patient's hand above the parts behind; and places their fingers under the devastation of the patient, and strengthens the joint in its usual position, and the practitioner raises the patient's hand, and extends it in front; and places it back gently.
Mays si per aquo que havem dit no retorna, e so del comensament que accidic la dislocacio, motz dias, lahoras cove que·l malaute sia banhat en aygua cauda e sia aministrada enbrocacio que mollifique e liniesca ayssi cum si so coytz razitz de altea, e fenugrec, e melillot en aygua, e sia administrada.	But if it does not return, and from the beginning of what caused the dislocation, several days later, the patient should be given an embrocation that softens and melts like if they were made of aloe, fenugreek, and melilot in water, and should be administered.
E aprop le malaute sia ressupinat sobre le sieu dos e sia pausat dejos le titillic de lu espera de lana que sia engual entre levitat e strictura, e aprop le metge pause le sieu talo sobre la spera, e eleva le cap del muscle am vertut, e atire la ma del malaute per que no sia mauguda a las partidas dejos, e autre ministre tengua le cap del malaute, que no sia maugut a las partidas dejos, quar aquela tantost retorna al sieu loc.	And then the patient should be placed on their back and supported underneath by a pillow made of wool that is equally between elevation and restriction, and the doctor places their hand on the sacrum, elevates the head of the muscle with virtue, and pulls the hand of the patient so that it does not hang down, and another minister holds the head of the patient, so that it does not hang down, because at that moment they return to their place.
E si voles, reduzeys aquel segon aquesta manieyra: e es que tu fassas esser prezent un home le qual sia pus lonc que·l malaute, e estia de la part de aquel latz, e entrometa le sieu muscle dejos le titillic del malaute e eleve le titillic de lu a las partidas desus entro que·l malaute sia suspendut en ayre, e autre ministre tire la ma del malaute de las partidas dejos del sieu ventre.	And if you wish, reduce the second in this manner: and it is that you make present a man who is longer than the patient, and stand on the side of the other, and insert their muscle behind the titillus of the patient and lift the titillus of them to the parts above until the patient is suspended in air, and another minister pulls the hand of the patient from the parts below their belly.
Mays si le malaute es leugier, lahoras cove que am lu que autre causa sia suspenduda, per so que grave aquel, quar la dislocacio retorna tantost.	But if the patient is heavier, then cover them with something else that another cause should be suspended, so that it does not burden the other, because the dislocation returns quickly.
E es reduzit eysament segon autra manieyra: e es que sia ficat en terra un fust lonc le cap del qual sia redon de figura, ayssi cum pilo de mortier, que no sia gros ni subtil, e aprop sia pausat dejos le malaute; pus que so pausatz sobre·l cap del fust draps leons, e·l malaute sia stant segon la longitut del fust, e aprop sia extenduda la ma de lu a las partidas dejos del autra part; e sia extendut le cos de lu del autre part am fortaleza, quar la junctura retorna al sieu loc am velocitat.	When reduced alone by another method: place a long wooden stick on the ground, shaped like a mortar, not too thick or thin, and place it under the patient; then cover the patient's head with cloth lions, and the patient should stand along the length of the stick, and extend the hand of the other part to the parts behind the other part; and extend the other part's limbs for strength, because the joint returns to its place quickly.
E si es dificil reduccio de lu per totas las causas que havem ditas, lahoras usa de aquesta cura: e es que tu prenguas un fust la quantitat del qual sia en le lonc de dos brasses, e latitut de aquel sia de quatre ditz, e la grossetut de lu sia aleujat en le preon del tittilic segon aquesta forma:	If it is difficult to reduce the joint by all the causes we have mentioned, then use this cure: and you should take a stick of the length of two spans, and its width of four fingers, and its thickness at the end of the handle in the form of a button:
E aprop sobre le cap redon sian liatz drap leons per so que·l fust no ledesca le malaute.	and then place a cloth lion on the head to prevent the stick from entering the patient.
E aprop sia pausat dejos le titillic del malaute, e sia extenduda la ma o le bras sobre·l fust entro a las partidas dejos, e sia liat le fust sobre le adjutori e le bras e la extremitat de la ma.	and then place the stick under the patient's elbow, and extend the hand or arm over the stick between the parts behind; and tie the stick to the assistant and the arm and the end of the hand.
Aprop sia pausat le bras sobre un scalo de scala segon la latitut, e la ma sia extenduda a las partidas dejos, e l’autre cos sia suspendut de l’autre part, quar la junctura intra tantost.	And then place one arm on a scale of the second level according to its height, and the hand should be extended to the parts behind, and the other thing should be suspended from the other part, as the joint is soon affected.
E cum le intrament de lu es complit segon quascuna maniera que es a tu possibla, e lahoras cove que tu pauses dejos le titillic spera de lana de engual quantitat; e aprop pauza emplastre perparat de polvera de moli am enses e album de huou sobre tot le muscle, ayssi quo es revolvut desus, e aprop strenh dejos le titillic am strictura decent; e le liament sia revolvut sobre le emplastre, e la ma de lu sia annectida al col de lu, e sia leyssat, e no sia mauguda la ma de lu per vii dias.	And if the instrument of the patient is completed according to each possible manner, and then cover it with a woolen cloth of equal quantity; and prepare an ointment of powdered myrrh and egg white on all the muscle, as it is rolled over, and then place the bandage behind the joint, as it is stretched decently; and roll the bandage over the ointment, and the hand of the patient should be attached to the neck of the patient, and let it be, and do not press the hand of the patient for seven days.
E cove que sia pausada la vianda del malaute pauca, entro que·l membre sia confortat, quar es pus leugier a la sanacio de lu.	And cover the food of the patient little by little, as soon as the member is comfortable, because it is more beneficial for its cure.
E aprop la vianda sia donada major aprop vii o v e sia exercitat un movement; e donc si es fermat e no es mollificat, lahoras ja es sanat.	And then the food should be given more frequently in seven or five days and should be exercised with a movement; and if it is stopped and not softened, then it is already cured.
Mays si la junctura es dislocada motas veguadas per humiditat que accideys a lu o per autra causa, lahoras cove que en aquela sia administrat cauteri am tres traucs, segon que denant es dit en le capitol de cauteri.	If the joint is dislocated due to moisture that has accumulated in it or for another reason, then apply a pointed cautery three times, according to what is said in the chapter on cautery.
E si tot aysso es fayt e aprop vii dias es desliat le liament e la junctura no es fermada, e le emplastre e la strictura son reduzitz sobre lu alcunas veguadas, e no es fermada e catz e no pot elevar aquel bras a las partidas desus, lahoras sapias que·ls nervis de lu, les quals so al cap del muscle, ja so inscizes o extendutz o mollificatz, e sapia que la junctura nul temps no sira ficada en loc sieu.	And if everything has been done and after seven days the ligament and joint are not healed, and the bandage and splint are reduced due to some swelling, and it is not healed and catheterized and cannot be raised to the parts above, then know that the nerves of which are at the top of the muscle, which have been incised or extended or softened, and know that the joint will never be fixed in its place.
De la dislocacio de aquela qu’es fayta deves le pietz e la mamilha o las partidas detras, la reduccio es fayta am impulcio e extencio am las mas, entro que retorne.	From the dislocation of which is made, the hand and arm or the parts behind, reduction is made by impulse and extension with the hands, until it returns.
E sia administrada en aquela l’autra strictura, e cura aquela entro que sia sanada.	And the other splint is applied in that place, and cure it within the time it is healed.
E si accideys aprop la sanacio gravitat en le membre e tarditat en le movement de lu, lahoras le malaute uze de banh motas veguadas entro que aquela gravitat sia alleujada e que retorne a la natura de lu primiera.	And if the healing is slow in the member and delayed in its movement, then use hot compresses until that gravity is alleviated and it returns to its original nature.
Capitol .xxvii.	Chapter 27
De curacio de dislocacio del coyde.	Of the treatment of dislocation of the shoulder.
Sapias que la junctura del coyde es dislocada am difficultat e semblantment retorna am difficultat; e aquela es dislocada a totas partidas, e majorment a la partida denant a la partida detras, e la dislocacio de lu no es amaguada a tu quar es cazent dejos le vezement o dejos le tocament segon qualque figura sia dislocat, e quan ajustes le coyde disloguat am le sa, aquo es a tu declarat manifestament, quar la junctura es concavada e no pot doblar le bras, ni tocar am aquel le sieu muscle.	You know that the shoulder joint is dislocated with difficulty and similarly returns with difficulty; and if it is dislocated in all parts, especially at the part nearest to the back, and the dislocation of it is not hidden from you when it is found behind the clothing or behind the touch according to any figure that is dislocated, and when you adjust the shoulder dislocated, if it is not adjusted, that is your declaration manifestly, because the joint is concave and cannot bend the arm, nor touch its own muscle.
E cove que·t coytes, e reduzescas la dislocacio tantost denant que vengua a lu apostema caut, quar si ve a lu apostema caut, dificil es la reduccio de lu, e fort leu no es sanat de tot; e majorment quan es a las partidas detras, quar pus mala es de totas las autras specias de dislocacio, e de major dolor, e motas veguadas deyssen am aquela la mort.	And if you see that the shoulder is dislocated, and reduce the dislocation as soon as it comes to the abscess cautery, because if you see the abscess cautery, the reduction is difficult, and not all is healed; and especially when it is at the back parts, because it is worse than all the other species of dislocations, and more painful, and more dangerous than the others, and can cause death.
E la restauracio de lu, quan es aquela que es possibla reduzir, es que la ma de lu sia extenduda am doas mas, e le bras de lu sia expandut, e las mas del metge sian sobre le coyde e dejos lu, e el empellisca la junctura am les pouzes de las suas mas ensemps, o am la razit de la sua palma entro que torne en son loc.	And the restoration of the foot, when it is possible to reduce it, is that the hand of the patient should be extended in two directions, and the arm of the patient should be expanded, and the hands of the doctor should be on the side and below, and the finger should be applied to the joint at the base of the palm where it returns to its place.
Mays si la dislocacio es a las partidas denant, lahoras retorna ayssi que dobla la ma am la sua ma, entro que percuta le coyde am la razit de la sua palma.	If the dislocation is at the joints, then return it as if you were bending your arm at the elbow, until you strike the chest at the base of the palm.
E si la dislocacio no obezeys a la reduccio, lahoras aministra vehement extencio e mot fort.	And if the dislocation does not yield to reduction, then apply strong extension and force.
E es que dos ministres extendan le bras, e tenguan aquel eyssament dos ministres per so que no sia remaugut deves la extencio.	And if two assistants are extending the arm, then hold it firmly with two assistants to prevent it from moving during extension.
E aprop sia revolvut le bras deves tota part, pus que es envolopat drap doblat lonc sobre la ma de lu, o liament.	Then rotate the arm in all directions, so that it is wrapped in a rolled cloth or bandage.
E quant le metge toca la junctura am la sua ma, unte aquela am alcun oli per so que aquo sia aquelas causas las quals ajudan en lubricitat de la junctura am facilitat; e aprop empellesca la junctura am empulcio vehement entro que retorne.	And when the doctor touches the joint at the base of the palm, apply some oil to it so that it is one of those causes that help in the lubricity of the joint and facilitate its return.
E aprop la reduccio de lu cove que sia pausat sobre aquela empastre en le qual sia stipticitat e excequacio am album de huou, e sia extrenhut am strictura descent, e·l bras sia suspendut del col, e sia layssat per alcus dias.	And then approach the reduction of the uterus that should be placed on that pad where there is astringency and execution with egg white, and it should be extracted from the stricture descending, and the arm should be suspended from the neck, and it should be left for several days.
E aprop sia desliat; e donc si la junctura es formada en le sieu loc, lahoras tu deslia le liament de lu e layssa aquela.	And then it should be dislocated; and if the joint is formed in its place, then you should dislocate the ligament of it and leave it there.
E si vezas la junctura no be strenher, lahoras tu itera le emplastre e·l liament, e layssa aquela per alcus dias entro que sia extrenhuda; e aprop deslia aquela.	And if you see that the joint is not strong enough, then you should reapply the plaster and ligament, and leave it there for several days until it is extracted; and then dislocate it.
Mays si accideys a lu gravitat aprop la reduccio de la junctura, e la disposicio de lu es en movement, lahoras aministra humectacio en banh e fricacio subtil, e comprecio, entro que sia aleujat; o pausa sobre la junctura aleliati, so es coyssa de moto grassa; e aprop sia liada, e layssa aquela sobre le os le dia e la nueyt.	But if an accident occurs to the joint during reduction, and its position is in movement, then administer moisture in baths and gentle friction, and compresses, until it is removed; or pause on the moved joint with a greasy cloth; and then it should be laid down, and left there for several days.
E aprop osta aquela, e met aquel en banh; e quan suza, lahoras tu fregua la junctura am fricacio temprada, e aprop itera sobre aquela aleliati, so es ronhonal de moto, una veguada, e la segonda, e la .iii.a.,	And then place that there, and put that in the bath; and when dry, then you should rub the joint with a cool friction, and then repeat on the moved joint with a warm cloth, one day, and the second, and the third.
am intrament de banh, entro que sia linit.	When using a medicinal bath, ensure it is not too hot.
E si voles, pausa sobre aquela fenda de vaca humida e scalfada am boder e stren sobre aquel; e fay aquo alcunas veguadas, quar aquela es humida e reduzeys a la sua disposicio.	And if you wish, place your hand on the wound of a wet and scalded cow and apply a strong pressure; then make some incisions, as that wound is moist and reduce it to its proper position.
Capitol .xxviii.	Chapter 28.
De curacio de dislocacio de malassen, so es de la junctura que es entre·l bras e la ma.	Of the cure of dislocation of the shoulder, it is at the joint that is between the arm and the chest.
Malassen de la ma alcunas vetz es deslocada, e la reduccio de la dislocacio de lu es leugiera, e·l contrari es de las autras juncturas, mays empero cove que sia velocitat en la reduccio de lu en la hora en la qual es deslocada, denant que le loc sia apostemat o que accida en lu apostema caut.	The shoulder of the chest has sometimes been dislocated, and the reduction of that dislocation is difficult, but rather than causing harm to other joints, it is important to have speed in reducing it at the time of the dislocation, because the joint may become abscessed or something may happen in that abscess.
E la reduccio de la dislocacio de lu es que tu pauses la junctura de la ma del malaute sobre una taula e le ministre extenda la ma de aquel, e le metge pause la sua ma o o la sua palma sobre la iminencia de la junctura, e empellisca aquela entro que retorne al sieu loc.	And the reduction of that dislocation is that you place the shoulder joint of the patient on a table and the doctor extends the arm of that person, and the surgeon places his hand or his palm on the immediate vicinity of the joint, and pushes it back to its proper position.
Mays empero cove que sia considerat si la palma ja es ostada al ventre de la ma, lahoras le malaute pause le dos de la sua ma sobre una taula deves la extencio e la reduccio; e si la dislocacio es precedent deves le dos de la ma, lahoras sia la posicio de la ma de aquel intrinicequement sobre la taula, per so que la ma del metge caja sobre aquela iminencia de la junctura.	However, it should be considered whether the palm is already on the patient's abdomen, then place the patient's hand on a table for extension and reduction; and if the dislocation is previous, then the position of the patient's hand should be intrinsically on the table, so that the doctor's hand is near the joint.
E donc si retorna tantost, bon es; e sino, lahoras strenh aquela am empastre cedant le apostema e layssa aquel; e no iteres aquo, quar sino, no soferta ni no podes sobre la reduccio de lu pus que passan a lu dias.	And if he returns soon, good; and if not, then immediately apply the ointment to the abscess and leave that; and do not repeat this, because otherwise, it will not be softened or cured before the days pass.
Mays empero la junctura roman segon la sua tortuositat; e no notz al malaute alcuna causa, sino que la ma es mollificada e no pot strenher alcuna causa; lahoras sapias que les nervis son trincatz o trissatz, e lahoras no es engen en lu sino que sia strenhuda am cauteri prop le cazament de lu e fort leu aquo confereys alcuna causa.	However, the joint may be twisted; and the patient does not know any cause, but the hand is softened and cannot bear any cause; then you should know that the nerves are crushed or torn, and then do not put it in the joint but apply a pointed cautery to the surface of the joint and firmly press on that.
Donc cum malassem es retornada, lahoras pausa sobre lu empastre le qual havem recomtat, e sia layssat e strenhut per v dias; e aprop sia desliat e sia layssat e la ma de lu sia excercitada.	And when the abscess has returned, then place it on the ointment that we have recommended, and let it be left and strengthened for several days; and then remove it and let it be left and the hand of that should be exercised.
Mays si le movement de lu es ostat e accideys en lu alcuna gravitat, lahoras leniys aquela am aygua cauda e am fricacio alcunas veguadas, entro que sia alleujat.	If the patient's movement is obstructed and there is some gravity in it, then apply cold water and friction to some parts of the body until they are relieved.
Capitol .xxix.	Chapter 29.
De la curacio de dislocacio dels ditz.	Of the cure of the aforementioned dislocations.
Alcunas veguadas so dislocatz les ditz a tota partida.	Some parts are dislocated in these aforementioned cases.
E quan es dislocat alcun dit de aquels al dos de la palma o al ventre de lu, lahoras sten le dit e impelleys la dislocacio de lu am les tieus pouses, entro que retorne.	And when one of those parts is dislocated at the back of the hand or on the belly, then press the dislocated part and push it back to its place until it returns.
E aprop sostenta le cap del dit, e suspen aquel deves la part a la qual es dislocat, e layssa aquel per dos dias.	And then support the head of the dislocated part, suspend the weight of that part to which it is dislocated, and leave it for two days.
E aprop suspen aquel e exten aquel entro que dreyt sia engualhat en aquel sieu dia.	And then suspend it and extend it until it is equal to the other side on that day.
E quan sira noyt, lia aquel segon aquela narracio, e no cesses desliar aquel en le dia e exercitar am movement, e lia aquel en la noyt; e fay aquo per alcus dias entro que sia streyt.	And when it is not straight, apply the second method according to that description, and do not stop removing it on that day and exercising its movement, and apply the second method at night; and do this for several days until it is straight.
E fay semblant am aquo, si es dislocat al ventre de la ma, e lia aquel ad aquela partida e fay am aquo la tieua primiera operacio, entro que sia sanat.	If the patient's abdomen is also dislocated, and that part is attached to that part, then perform the first operation, which is to enter and heal it before it is healed.
E semblantment fay am aquo quan es dislocat a las autres partidas.	And similarly, do the same when other parts are also dislocated.
Capitol .xxx.	Chapter XXX.
De la curacio de dislocacio dels spondils del dos.	Of the cure of the dislocation of the dorsal vertebrae.
Quan accideys ad alcun dels spondils del dos o del col dislocacio complida, e so remaugutz motz spondils de lors locs, lahoras en aquela no es curacio, quar la mort se coyta al malaute.	When a complete dislocation occurs in one of the dorsal or neck vertebrae, and the remaining vertebrae of those places remain motionless, then there is no cure, as death approaches the patient.
E senhal de aquo es que la egestio del malaute es fora-eyssida ses voluntat, e no pot retenir aquela; e motas veguadas so mollificatz alcus membres de lu o doas cambas de lu o dos brasses de lu, o un de aquels; o es remaugut un spondil de son loc, quar motas veguadas es remaugut e motas veguadas es fayta la remocio de aquels a quatre partidas.	And in such cases, the patient's excretion is forced by his will, and he cannot retain it; and the other muscles or ribs or arms or legs of the patient, or one of those, or if one of the vertebrae of that place remains motionless, then the other muscles are softened and the removal of those is made in four directions.
Donc aquela ja es remauguda a las partidas detras e es nompnada gelbozitat.	Then it is already removed to the back parts and is called lumbar.
Mays la curacio de lu es que lahoras consideras si la gelbozitat accidey de puerissia, quar lahoras en aquela no es curacio ni de aquela no es sanacio de tot.	If the patient's condition is such that you should consider whether the cause is impotence, because in that case neither cure nor healing of any kind is possible.
Mays en aquela que ve per cazement o per percussio o per semblant ad aquels, ja diyssero les Antics las manieras de curacio am sermo prolixs, del qual lo mays retorna am profieyt; mays yeu ja e abreujat de aquel del qual lo pauc escusa del trop de lu, per la mieua propinquitat a la entencio mieua exposicio, am la qual he aquo expausat et format ex instrument divers de aquel am le qual mostrero aquo e espausero aquel.	However, in cases where it is seen through tapping or percussion or similar to those, as the ancients said about the methods of cure for such speech prolixity, which most returns to profit; however, I have already opened and enlarged from that one of which few people escape the excess of it, because of its proximity to understanding and explanation, which he has exposed and formed from various instruments of that kind, which will show you that and explain it to you.
E dic que en gelbosita que accideys de la partida denant en le pietz, no es engen ni sanacio de aquela; e semblantment en aquela que es fayta a dos latz.	And it is said that in impotence which occurs in the chest, there is neither cure nor healing of any kind; and similarly in that which is made on both sides.
E de aquelas no es curada sino aquela que accideys en le dos propriament am aquo que yeu recomti.	And of those, there is no cure except for that which occurs naturally in the back, which I will recommend to you.
